review_content: This review is for cooking class at the Hattie May. (I live in Fort Worth and therefore have not had occasion to stay at the Inn.)Laura and Scott, the new owners of the Hattie May, are just the nicest people you'd ever care to meet. In addition to owning and operating the Inn, Laura is a holistic nutritionist and chef and offers small group cooking classes at the Inn. Tonight I attended the first of what I hope will be many classes with Laura. The focus of tonight's lesson was cruciferous vegetables; we started off with a handout to review the many veggies in the category and all of the important health benefits they provide. It was immediately clear that Laura really knows her stuff! I thought she gave us just the right amount of information to give context to the lesson without getting too bogged down in the science. Then we dove right in preparing three dishes: a bok choy and apple slaw, steamed broccoli salad, and an arugula mushroom saute with cauliflower "rice." I loved how hands on the class was. Laura gave us tips for better knife technique and even sharpened the knives we brought from home. We five students had plenty of opportunities to prepare the different ingredients, and the class moved quickly enough that we were never bored. And then of course we got to eat! All of the food was delicious, and nothing felt too intimidating to replicate at home. Not only did we get a chance to try some familiar ingredients in new ways, but we met some veggies that I wouldn't have even been able to identify before tonight (hello, daikon).I would recommend cooking classes at the Hattie May to anyone- of any level of expertise- who is interested in learning more about the power of eating natural, whole, unprocessed foods and how to prepare them in a way that's both appetizing and healing. I can't wait to go back for "alternative grains" in a couple weeks!I booked a rather long stay--4 nights--as an alternative to a downtown conference hotel and boy am I glad that I did! Hattie May offers an opportunity to relax in comfort while keeping a short and equidistant walk north to downtown or south to hipper nightlife spots. That said, the real highlight here is co-owner Laura's vegan/vegetarian breakfasts--the best part of the day, every day. She and husband Scott are a delight to stay with, so I'm sure that I will again when I'm next in Fort Worth.Beautiful:)!  Great place & close to the convention center.  What a gem!  My friend loved staying here - plus new owners are super people!!This review is for the cooking classes at Hattie May Inn. I can't tell you how excited i was to learn the cooking classes offered by Laura Slayton are both yummy and healthy (right up my alley)!  I have taken a Grains class, a Cruciferous Vegetables class, a Greens class and a "Game Day Eats" class! All classes have three recipes that the class participants make. We chop, we measure, we massage (kale), we stir, we do it all! After the recipes have been prepared, we clear the dining room table, Laura brings a pitcher of Hibiscus tea and we eat our creations! It's fun, it's educational, it's great for newbies or seasoned cooks. I've made several of the recipes at home. I'll definitely be signing up for more classes! This is by far the best setting for cooking classes--a 100+ year old Victorian home--come on, it doesn't get better than that!Thank you to the new owners, Laura and Scott, for sharing this small part of your lives with us. My husband and I don't normally stay in bed and breakfasts, but we wanted a change from the typical hotel. We felt so special and comfortable when we arrived and Scott brought us a glass of wine in our room.Neither of us are vegan or vegetarian, but we want to eat better, and were excited to see what nutritionist Laura would prepare for breakfast, and it was delicious.We recommend the Hattie May Inn to anyone who wants to stay in a warm and comfortable home that's close to everything you might want to visit in Fort Worth.We were so happy with our stay at the Hattie May Inn.  The house, and rooms were beautiful.  The owners were so nice.  Price was great.  Food was delicious.  Location was perfect.  We can't wait to come back!My husband and I really enjoyed our stay here. We stayed in the Oriental Oasis, which is fairly small, but extremely comfortable. It connects to the original bathroom, which still contains the original claw-foot tub and a pull-chain toilet.Linda, the owner, is extremely friendly and accommodating. I forgot to tell her beforehand that I have a gluten sensitivity, but she still had everything she needed to make me delicious gluten-free blueberry waffles in the morning.This is about as close as I've ever come to staying in a traditional and authentic bed and breakfast. The house is lovely and well-preserved, clean, and nicely decorated with a mix of antiques and modern artwork. Laura greeted me upon my arrival and was extremely hospitable.  I met Scott the next day and he was equally friendly.  My room, the Americana, was just perfect in terms of size and the bathroom was extremely clean and updated. My room had a sleeping porch attached so I was able to keep my balcony door open all night to catch the cool spring breeze. It might be a little warmer in the summer but there is a window unit in the room. I was very comfortable. Breakfast was delicious and again, because it was an authentic bed and breakfast, the guests sat together at on big table and were served at the same time. That allowed for some nice conversations with people I would have never met otherwise. The south side of Ft. Worth is developing into a fabulous place for dining. The homes in the neighborhood are in transition but you can see he potential everywhere. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone traveling to act. Worth.Ok this is only my second bed and breakfast so compared to my first, very sketchy B&B - this one IS as good as it gets!  The owner reminded me of my own-everyone-is-a-wonderful-person kind of person.  Super sweet and very obliging.  Going at Christmas was great for an elf like me.  ( What's your favorite color?)  It was decorated so beautifully.  The owner gave us a great tour at first which was interesting and neat. Then we hung out to enjoy our wine while we enjoyed some records . . . oh yeah, CHRISTMAS records.  :-D   Breakfast was delicious and Linda, the owner, stayed with me because I was kinda late getting down and everyone else got up almost as soon as I sat down because they were done.  I have a secret favorite room but I'm not sure I'll share it bc I want to get it again sometime!!  Hint - its NOT the biggest one!I've stayed there twice with my wife and both times Linda was exceptionally accommodating. She is happy to share the history of the house and people associated with it. I recommend the room at the back of the house with the US flag - it has a little screened porch which is great for lounging. Only problem with the porch is a window from an adjoining room looks out on to it - assuming the guest pushes curtains out of the way. So as long as you stay partially clothed should be OK.We stay at Hattie May Bed & Breakfast every time we go to Fort Worth. It's beautiful and comfortable and Linda is wonderful. I notoriously forget things and she's so sweet and accommodating. The beds are cozy and the bathrooms spotless. It's our favorite place and we highly recommend it!!What an amazing bed and breakfast.  Wonderful house with interesting rooms and comfortable beds.  Everything was decorated and homey.  Linda the owner was friendly and sweet.  Breakfast was delicious.  I couldn't ask for anything more from a bed and breakfast.

We had a great stay. The staff were lovely and having the free shuttle bus was fantastic. We were shuttled around and saved money on taxis.Hotel was clean and had everything we needed.The facilities here are very clean; perhaps overly so. Upon arriving, I was greeted by the strong scent of disinfectant in the lobby - I think it had just been cleaned. I could also detect a trace of it in the room, but it was not enough to be an irritation.The man at check-in was not very friendly; I felt like I was just taking time away from him playing Candy Crush. The WiFi is free; it was not working when I first checked in, but it did work later in the evening. (Luckily, there was an internet enabled-computer in the lobby.)I had been on the road for a week, and this hotel had the best breakfast spread by far - there was the requisite hash browns, eggs, sausage (which were good) and pastries, but there was also yogurt and fresh fruit. They even provide silverware (not plastic), which is a nice touch.One downside to this hotel is that there is not a lot of interest in the immediate area. There is a Mexican restaurant called Mercado Juarez across the street; I didn't go there, but you can check the reviews on Yelp: yelp.com/biz/mercado-jua.... If you are ok with this, then Country Inn & Suites is a fine place to stay.Quaint place, very comfy beds, nice and helpful staff. Free shuttle to Sundance and stockyards. Right next to mercado juarez! Was pricey on a busy weekend.The room was huge. I had 2 queens with a love seat and mini-kitchenette (microwave, frig, sink, counter). It could stand some updating, but it wasn't bad. The night before I stayed in a completely up-to-date room, this room was a step down, but still nice.They have a free breakfast with a large variety of items. The eggs were awful, but there were plenty of other choices.Also, free internet.They had chocolate chip cookies at check in, that always earns a few points in my book!I would stay here again.This was the dirtiest Country Inn & Suites I have ever been to. The shower head came off during my shower, too... Very run down.We stayed here for an anniversary and had a lovey time. The hotel is located near the stockyards so we were able to enjoy great dinner choices and also we walked on the scenic river walk paths. We wished we would have brought out bikes but instead, we just walked.The hotel has a two room suite with TV's in both rooms, a couch and table in one and the bedroom had a two-person jacuzzi tub. It was a lovely room that was quite and comfortable.I see there are other reviews that are terrible but this was NOT our experience at all. Maybe they have had a change in management or new help since those were posted. We thought we would like to stay there again!The breakfast was small but we came for the comfort of the room and the location.Had good prompt service upon arrival. There was a strange smell in our room that I couldn't quite put my finger on. Not a bad smell but it was almost like they were trying to cover up a bad smell. But on the positive side you did get used to whatever the smell was quickly and did not even notice it after 15 minutes. The included breakfast was ok. The coffee was cold but other than that it was edible.Great room for the price. Not the Ritz, but clean and that's really all you should expect for how cheap the rooms are.This is the worst place I've ever stayed in my life. Avoid it if you can. The rooms are outdated by at least 30 years. There was trash on the floor in my room, the upholstery was ripped on one of the chairs, the complementary toiletries were previously used (the seals were broken), there were "small hairs" still on the floor of the bathroom from the previous guest, the curtains didn't close all of the way (I had to use clips to close them), the tv sound was broken, and the room smelled strange. To top it off, I couldn't sleep because I was so terrified that there were bedbugs. I left absolutely disgusted.I didn't expect the Ritz, but I expected clean and it wasn't. There were crumbs all over the floor and used q-tips next to the microwave. YUCK!!! The room also reeked. It smelled like musty cigarette smoke and the entire hotel is non-smoking. I would not recommend staying here unless you have to.

The front desk (Damaris and Tammy) was very friendly, professional, and helpful. It is unusual compared to other Staybridge Suites' front desks.The rooms were clean and in great condition.We will be definitely come back to this Staybridge if we come back to the area.Can't go wrong staying here.I don't really have a single complaint about Staybridge. The breakfast was better than average (and they provide bags so we could take a few things to the room for snacking). The amenities are better than average. No nickel-and-diming. Friendly staff and good guest info (what's going on in town, weather, etc. We stayed at another one mid-week and got the free reception. Had a king room there with pull-out. That one had recycling. This one doesn't, so taking ours with us. This time we shared a 2-bedroom with my brother and it worked perfectly. Two beds in ours and one in theirs, two bathrooms, three TVs and the living area. Would be nice if the bedroom doors locked for a tad more privacy, but with family we all got enough space. Only other negative was having to sign in to the wifi every time you use it. Overall, great stay at both places. Maybe a step down from Embassy, but then so was the price, so overall may be a better value. Got our money's worth here as a family of four. Will definitely be back!I am so pleased with the Staybridge Suites Ft. Worth on Clifford Center Drive.  The staff has neen exceptionally welcoming. Their hospitality is off the charts amazing.  Marteka, the desk clerk, was prompt, informative and displayed a great attitude.  I also met with Laquentha, a manager at Staybridge.   Again, another employee with a genuine joy for her job and her desire to make all of her guests feel welcomed and happy to be here.  The accommodations are very clean, very well taken care of, and a pleasant Texas style.  I would highly recommend a stay here. They offered a complimentary social with food and live music that was awesome!This place is not worth the money.  The carpet in the room is filthy. There is a gummy bear stuck to the kitchen counter. It is a dump. The walls are dirty and it smells bad. The beds are not made correctly...the fitted sheet was put on the wrong way. It is gross and I want my money back.Great place to stay and for all that you get, you just really can't beat the price.  Check in and out  was really quick.  During my stay all the staff were very friendly.  Decent, clean room with queen size bed and pull out couch.  There is a full size refrigerator with burners, dishwasher and microwave.  The fitness center is great--it has an elliptical, two treadmills and a bicycle--all with tv's in them.  There is a large tv on the wall, a yoga mat, weights, an incline bench and a large exercise ball. The pool is outside.  It's very clean--I saw them cleaning it every morning and the temperature was perfect--around 75.They have a great breakfast every day--oatmeal, waffles, omelets, bacon or sausage, potatoes, cereal, fresh fruit, bagels, toast, muffins, cottage cheese.  There's juices, coffee, tea and milk.  Tuesdays - Thursdays, they have a social which includes, wine, beer and food.  There are free cookies at the front desk--I think all night.  The coffee carafes are out from morning til night. There is a nice theater room with really comfy seats--I saw the tv playing, but I didn't use it myself.  I did notice that others were using it during the evening and it did sound like there was a good sound system.Although good during the day, the wifi is a little slow and spotty during peak hours.  Luckily there was a McDonald's nearby with speedy wifi.  I'm sure this doesn't matter if your computer has wired connection capability, but my laptop doesn't so I had to depend on the wireless.  I used the business center's computer at times, but there is a humming noise that goes on and off (not sure what it is) which can be annoying if you're using the computer for any length of time.  But this wasn't such a big deal since I was able to get around it.There's a Walmart, CVS, Savon, Walgreen's and an Albertson's nearby.  Saw a drive-thru Starbuck's (which I didn't need since the hotel had good coffee), Chili's What more could you ask for?  This place is a great deal!Great place to stay. The rooms are nice and the bed is soft, with great assortment of  pillows for anyone's taste. Free breakfast, the usual. On Tuesdays through Thursdays they have an evening meal with free wine and beer. Quiet hotel with plenty of parking.  I've stayed here twice and would stay here again. Don't forget to get a IHG membership to rack up some points.I booked a night here on Hotwire for a concert at Billy Bobs.Checking In/Out-We checked in late (8 pm) and the lady was very helpful and cheerful. It was a very quick process. Check out is noon but we were able to get it extended to 2pm. Again a very quick process with great staff.Room- The room was very clean and I am picky on that. We had a queen suite It had the bed, pull out couch (bedding for it in the closet), two small coffee tables, desk, full size refrigerator,  mini dishwasher, 2 burner stove top, sink, dishes, microwave, flat screen tv that swivels. There was plenty of room to move about. The shower had great pressure and no limit of hot water. The bed was comfortable. Breakfast- They had a complementary breakfast. I did not have any but the person with me loved it. Cereal, fruit, fresh waffles, muffins, ect.I did not get a chance to check out the pool or the grill they have by the pool. They have a 24 hour pantry with microwave meals and such, I didn't check the price but they had a decent selection.I will for sure stay here againWe were sent over here when their sister property (Candlewood Suites) gave our reserved room to someone else. We were told by Candlewood Suites that Staybridge Suites would honor our $106.99 rate. They did NOT, and our room ended up being $155.24. Seems a little like a scam, doesn't it?In addition, I discovered that the phones in our room didn't work, and that the smoke detectors in our room were both covered by plastic wrap taped to the ceiling. Maybe the previous occupant was a smoker? It didn't smell like it, so that was really strange. There was a guy at the front desk (Chris?) who came and looked at it. He was MORTIFIED and immediately offered us another room. However, by this time we just wanted to settle in. So they got the plastic off and we were good. As an FYI, there is a Chili's within walking distance. So that's what we ate for dinner. We got it to go and brought it back to the room. As we were eating it, there was a knock on the door. It was Dominique, who was working the front desk. She had a little gift bag full of goodies to make up for the inconvenience. And the next day, they called me when a guest found a presciption medicine that had fallen out of my purse in the parking lot.The staff here are wonderful! They get 5 stars! And the rooms are nice with comfy beds. It's not a bad place to stay. I just feel like they should have honored the $106.99 rate I was offered at Candlewood Suites. We were there for a National cheerleading competition, we didn't get to stay with our team at Candlewood. So there was quite a bit of disappointment.The wife and I stayed here for a weekend in Fort Worth. The service was good, room clean and very comfortable, breakfast was ok. Very good value. Only complaint was the hotel was kinda hidden no large sign to see from road, front driveway not very well lit  and parking was sparse.  Be sure to pet Oreo the hotel cat.Ok, 2 things..I stayed here before, it was great. Beautiful rooms, attentive care, honest policy's. This last time I was charged 109.00 originally, then got a bill for 160.00, they said it was "hospitality tax"I travel all the time & hospitality tax isn't usually 25% without being near Disneyland. I asked several times before being charged, and even signed a receipt for 119.00 (with tax) but they had my credit card, and so they charged it whatever they wanted. 2) I lost a very important fur throw, called & they said they had it. great! Girl named Katie took my credit info again to ship it to me..again telling her to call me so Id get tracking & cost on shipping. I never got a call, as a matter if fact, I'd call & I got the biggest run around, & guess what? They finally tell me two weeks later, they sent it..still haven't got the blanket. I'm disappointed. There were coffee grounds in our coffee the morning we left & the bananas were green, but hey ..at least they tried. I will personally plan in staying anywhere else.Good customer service and room was clean as well as the bed. Towels didn't look clean.  We were given our dog fee back due to the noisy environment that evening. Which was nice of the manager, we had also cancelled a previous reservation and they were very nice to deal with.  If the towels had been clean and we had encountered less noise. I would give them 5 stars. There is also Chilis's in the same parking lot which is very convenient.

Well, this review has been a long time coming, but after a staying here for a week straight I decided that now it was time to write a review...I've stayed in a few hotels in the area, including the Omni in Downtown Ft. Worth, but even it doesn't have the charm and comforts of this hotel.The atrium is lively, bright and welcoming.  The hallways are simple and clean.  The dinner and breakfast areas are excellent.  There is a putting green near the outside lounge and pool area.The beds are comfortable as can be, the TV and Blu-ray player is awesome and the rooms are (with the exception of one time) very clean.The service is really where this place shines.  From the front desk to the cleaning ladies, their service is top notch.  In fact, for that reason alone, you should stay here.  If you take advantage of it, it's really that good.            All in all, do yourself a favor and stay here.  This is where you'll find me.  ;)I've  stayed here twice now, one week each time as it is close to work when I'm in town.  The hotel looks relatively new.  Unfortunately my stay was not pleasant.  I woke up to multiple bites on my arm at 2am in the morning.  I packed my things and went downstairs to ask for a room transfer. I showed them the pictures attached to this post,  and the young lady switched my room.  I was moved from a king suite to a queen due to availability.   The young lady suggested the hotel take my suitcase to have my stuff cleaned to prevent the possible transfer of bugs. I agreed and went to bed.The next morning I decided to check on my suitcase and retrieve clothes.   I was surprised to find my suitcase was back in the bug room.  It was explained they did this to quarantine the bag until pest control could investigate.  I was told someone would call me when complete.Long story short the call never came.  I approached the desk to get an extra key and was asked if I had been called about the bugs.  I told them no.  She said not to worry, it was just fleas. She asked if I was a Hilton member.  I said no.  She said that she wanted to do something nice for me,  but apparently only if I was a Hilton member.  My job payed for the room so I really couldn't leave without being out of pocket.Really a poor experience.  I expected them to be shocked there were bugs in the room,  but it seemed as thought it was business as usual. No apologies and very little concern. Btw, the bugs in the pictures are definatley not fleas.Let's just call this our "Wedding Weekend Disaster." We reserved a wedding block of rooms in January 2015 at Homewood Suites Fort Worth Medical Center, a subsidiary of Hilton, and fulfilled our minimum 5 reservations needed by April, months ahead of the deadline. Knowing we had many people coming from out of town, and that it was TCU vs. SMU and TCU Parent's weekend, we also added a block at the hotel across the street to provide everyone ample number of rooms to stay near each other and our wedding venue to cut down on transportation costs. Fast forward to the week of our event on Sept. 19, 2015. Three, I repeat THREE days before people start checking in, We get a phone call from Homewood Suites informing us that our entire wedding block has to move 20 minutes south to Hampton Inn & Suites  Fort Worth - Burleson, or has to be separated out across Fort Worth to various hotels. Although we were told Homewood Suites was hosting "an unusually large number of residents who had been displaced," my wife and I could not find any wars, fires, floods, natural disasters, etc. in Fort Worth that were mentioned in our contract. We also contacted the Hilton corporate offices, but never heard back and were told the Homewood Suites contact was our only option for support. So we began to speculate back to our original reason for making the contract so far in advance - the TCU vs. SMU game and TCU Parent's weekend. Heck, the hotel is only two miles from campus, why wouldn't they try and double rates for parents to make more money?! The lady we were working with at Homewood Suites said "You are the last person I want to be calling right now about this," ...Then why are we even having this conversation?! The football schedule came out months ago, yet we were never contacted at any point to express concern about overbooking. We even exchanged emails with the lady from Homewood Suites on September 9 to get an updated list of rooms. Being just 10 days before we check-in, there was still no mention of even the slightest possibility of there not being enough rooms to accommodate us. Any hotel worth staying at should have some idea that there might be an issue with accommodating a wedding block with a contract.So now we had less than three days to track down everyone who was staying at the hotel and inform them of the situation. Even though Homewood Suites Fort Worth Medical Center sent emails out trying to inform all guests, several email addresses were wrong, meaning several guests would have been totally unaware of the changes had we not given them a heads up. The rest of the week became chaos.  Being forced out to Hampton Inn & Suites Fort Worth - Burleson was also just the beginning. We missed part of our wedding photographs as the bride, groom, family of 20 and photographer all had to fight over the ONLY UBER that existed in Burleson (which I'll come back to). My sister, her husband and kids missed our rehearsal dinner because of the added 45 minutes of traffic hell getting through downtown and south Fort Worth traffic on I35. My wife, myself and all other guests were unable to celebrate with all of our out-of-town friends and family that were fortunate enough to stay at the other hotel, defeating the whole point of reserving blocks at side-by-side hotels. We also had some cancel their reservation entirely because their homes were now closer than the Burleson hotel, or because the new hotel didn't provide the same amenities as the one originally booked. We also almost got stuck in the elevator as it dropped half of a floor while we were on it the first night. Just dandy. We also noticed the elevator was past-due for inspection - even better! I will acknowledge that Hampton Inn & Suites  Fort Worth - Burleson tried their hardest to make things right, but telling us we will get "Free Uber and Lyft vouchers" when they were really only promo codes for first-time users so we couldn't use them, "craft beer" that was actually Blue Moon, "two bottles of wine" that were actually mini bottles of Sutter Home pink something-nobody-drinks-and-were-probably-free, and "snacks" that were really just one of every item in their mini convenience store, "maps provided from the hotel to the venue and back" which must've just been Google maps because we never received any maps, and one free night at the hotel, there was still more to be desired for how much chaos this caused the week leading up to and during our wedding. I know so many people say there's always one thing that goes wrong during a wedding and to not sweat the small stuff, but I felt I had to write this and post it everywhere so the world knows just how awful this one thing was, and how little respect Homewood Suites Fort Worth Medical Center and their Hilton corporate partners had for their customers and their wedding guests.Beautiful, CLEAN, well appointed room with a great staff. Nice thick towels, comfy bed, loved the mini stove and included kitchen ware. Will definitely stay here again when visiting Ft Worth. A few minutes from Cavendars and 15 minutes from the Stockyards.This hotel I am guessing is a brand new hotel, if not they sure do keep up with it!The decor was very Texas, not in a bad way. It was beautifully done. A very friendly staff. Nice big king sized room we had. There is a practice putting green, laundry, pool and spa area, exercise room, a little convenient store down stairs. Really everything you could ask for.They are pet friendly...a clean pet friendly. Breakfast area had a good spread of things. Texas shaped waffles which was pretty cool! It's a quiet hotel, by that I mean you know there is noise outside but their windows and walls are thick and you don't hear that noise or the neighbors.I highly recommend this hotel and if we are ever in the area again we will stay every time!This is a new hotel in the area.  Stayed here for 10 days while in the area.  We had a king bed suite.  It was very nice.  The room was well appointed and had a separate bedroom and living room/ kitchen.  It was enough room for my husband, son and I to spend time in the room without being on top of each other.  The bathroom is good size and the closet was big enough to fit two large suitcases as well as hanging clothes and shoes/ laundry basket on the floor.Breakfast is good.  New selections each day.  The evening reception was hit or miss but the staff were very friendly and attempted to provide you with what you needed to relax at the end of the day.  I used the hot tub and gym almost every night.  They never felt over crowded and were always clean.The hotel is right next to the train track and you can hear it in your room.  It did not keep me up at night and my son enjoyed watching the trains come and go.  Unless you are a very light sleeper I don't think it should stop you from booking here.Very enjoyable stay.Can't believe I am the first to review this place. But I guess it is pretty new and the amenities showed. Get here and stay here before the place gets "used." What I mean is that everything is still pretty new now. The BBQ area, pool, and putting green are in great condition. The hot breakfast is of course a nice touch and the staff is extremely friendly. We needed our room made earlier than their scheduled time and a maid came within 10 minutes to complete the job.As for the room itself, it was spacious and had everything you need. Stainless Steel appliances and granite counter tops gave it a modern look and the bathroom was well designed, with the sink outside of the closed off area with the toilet and shower. My only complaint is that the TV was not in a good position to be viewed by anyone in the room. Oh ya, and it is next to some train tracks, but you hardly notice the noise that happens every once in awhile.We stayed overnight while a family member was staying in the hospital. The employees were friendly and helpful, breakfast was great and the rooms were comfortable. There is a pool and a putting green along with lots of outdoor space and seating. Our kitchen came with utensils, cookware, even tupperware for leftovers.They offer free breakfast and weeknight evening dinner. Everything was clean and new, and I loved all of the outlets around the room!The bedroom was spacious but the tub and toilet area were somewhat small.I would happily stay at this property again.This hotel stands out for many reasons.  The location off I30 and Forest Park is very convenient, downtown is only a $5 Uber away.  The friendly service is the first thing  you notice.  My wife joking said as we pulled up "well this isn't the Omni so we won't be getting any champagne for our anniversary!" and then when we got to our room there were 2 small bottles of Muscato, 2 flutes, a huge selection of chocolates, and a Happy Anniversary card signed by the staff.  Seriously, this was unexpected, and while it may have only cost them a few dollars it really showed how much they appreciated us.  I should mention we were staying on points and this was our first time here, so it was all very unexpected.  The hotel is beautifully appointed, gorgeous lobby, quiet and swanky hallways.  Our 4th floor room (even numbered) faced downtown Fort Worth, which while not a massive skyline, is pretty neat from this angle, especially at night.  The suites are large, with a comfortable kitchen and living room.  For 2 people it was too big, it could easily handle 4 people before getting crowded.  The bedroom was comfy, and the bathroom plenty big.  The hotel is recently built with very soundproof walls and windows.  Some light rail noise but nothing to wake you up.  Breakfast was nothing fancy, but plenty of choices.The staff is WONDERFUL! They work very hard to make sure that you will enjoy your stay and feel like home. The pool was warm and the exercise room is much bigger then your typical hotel. Having the kitchen in your room makes life much more convenient. They also have a real estate discount for people moving into town or in between homes.I have been staying for a while here, I am from Turkey and here is liley second home. All staffs are extremely friendly and so I don't feel alone. Pool and fitness room are so clean and rooms and appleances are so new. When I came fort worth, the first suite that I stayed is here and I never minded to look for another place.

We have been living in Arizona for the past 5 years a trip back home to Texas for Thanksgiving reminded us how friendly Texans are, starting with this great place to stay!  Establishment is very clean, and comfortable.  Employees are  very helpful and friendly!  Love it!  We will visit again.  Highly recommend!Alright so we got to fort worth Friday October 30 due to a family matter.  Due to the last minute scramble to get here, and coupled with the 4.5 hour drive from the Bastrop area due to flood and a tornado warning we had no reservations.  After having been in town for several hours we decided on Hampton.  We have had positive experiences before in multiple states so why not.  We got the room booked and headed over in the rain. We arrived to find it packed to the gills.  I love sports but never thought about tcu & the Dallas Cowboys playing. I'm reasoning that was the reason for folks everywhere.  We got our room keys and tired headed upstairs.  We got in and weren't awe struck.  We have stayed in very nice Hampton inn before but this seemed lacking.  The shower tub was dated. The bathroom door squeaked.  The shower pin was difficult to pull up.  The bed......well let's just say it did us no favors. I tossed and turned all night and so did my Wife.  We also had the great pleasure of the ice machine being right next to us. In the morning we checked out and were running off fumes. The breakfast wasn't appealing so we grabbed tea, juice and two boxes of cereal and left. I'm not boycotting Hampton inn but I would say we'd put our hotel snobbery at a 10 before we reside here again temporarily.The rooms at this Hampton in are decent and on par with what you would expect from a Hampton Inn. If all you need is a place to shower and sleep, you'll be happy with your accommodations. It is worth nothing though that the hotel itself is located on an usually small lot and so this is hardly a "Texas-sized" hotel. This means that there is not lobby to speak of and upon entering the hotel you immediately get to the front desk on your left. Beyond the check-in desk are hallways that take you by an indoor pool and jacuzzi to the elevators. Again the rooms are fine, and few people probably pick a hotel for its lobby. But the small lot means that parking here is extremely limited, and I imagine that if they were booked at full capacity there would not be enough room to park for each guest. This is particularly burdensome if you have reservations ahead of time and arrive only to find there is no place to park. This almost happened to me.Also, this place is located right off the highway, so is prone to traffic noise. If you're a light sleeper, you may want to avoid this spot. On the plus side, there are lots of restaurants within close driving proximity, and a 24 hour fitness up the way, in case you have membership and want a decent workout on the road. Also, this Hampton Inn offers water bottles and candy to guests, which is something that not all Hamptons do.We came to stay the weekend in Ft Worth and picked this hotel due to its close proximity to the seminary and Hulen Mall. While checking in I felt the lobby area was really cramped. There are plans to expand the common areas, so we'll look past it for now. We had a great room very clean and spacious. The breakfast was the typical Hampden breakfast but nicely done. The staff was friendly and helpful. Will probably stay here again in the future.For the low price, this place was pretty good.  The carpet in the hallways was kind of smelly but that was all I could really complain about.  There is a ton of construction in the area but it did not affect my stay.  Nice room, clean bathroom, well appointed, good tv, free wifi and a decent free breakfast.  Basic, reasonable, great staff and affordable.Stayed here on a cross country trip.  Great accommodations and breakfast.  Staff went above and beyond when they didn't have the room we reserved and my husband left his medicine in the refrigerator.  Definitely recommended staying here.I'm not a frequent er of hotels/motels but for the price i paid the room was nice and clean, the bed was comfy, the ac blew super cold, and the staff was friendly. would definitly recommend.This was the nicest hotel experience I have ever had.  The rooms were super, beds comfortable beyond our wildest expectations and they even called after we checked in to make sure everything was ok and did we need any assistance.  It is close to many great restaurants and a shopping mall, and a nice indoor pool. When I lived in FW, I never knew this place existed.  Now when I go back to visit, it is the only place I will stay.  Thanks folks at Hampton Inn for the great visit.I've stayed here twice on business and wouldn't hesitate to recommend. Breakfast was above average for the Hampton Inn-type continentals. Breakfast nook was very inviting and pleasant to sit in while reading, doing work, etc. Hotel is within walking distance (1/3 mile) to good restaurants and to Hulen Mall, its associated movie theater, Barnes and Noble. Rooms are clean, quiet, and comfortable. Perfect for those seeking convenience to the highway or an affordable stay with no surprises.Ok but nothing special.  Usual craptastic pool and semi functional gym equipment.  Convenient to the usual off-ramp eateries and good if you're coming from Austin or San Antonio because it's on the south side of Fort Worth.Stayed here on Business. Very happy with the hotel. Lobby was small. Room was nice and clean. I would say a little above average Hampton Inn. I would definitely stay there againok accommodations, but completely inflexible when I had to change the duration of my stay.

My wife and I just got back from a night at Etta's Place for our 6th anniversary. It's within walking distance of several great dinning and entertainment spots in downtown Fort Worth. The historic building has a lot of personality and the fixtures in the rooms are antique and comfortable.Breakfast was delicious and relaxing. It's served on a refreshingly eclectic mix of old, miss-matched china by sweet friendly people. There is a nice common room with comfy leather chairs, warm lighting and walls full of old books. If you are looking for a quite escape with the option of easily taking in dinner, a show and local art, Etta's Place is a great spot. We will definitely be going back.Not a real great place. As another reviewer posted the best thing about the place is the location. The hotel as a whole leaves a lot to be desired. Cleanliness and maintenance is not a priority. My wife and I stayed in Maude's, my wife was taking a shower and an open pipe in the ceiling over the shower dropped something in her eye. The baseboards and carpet were worn and a bit dirty and the shower wasn't entirely clean. In the end I wouldn't recommend this place.Stayed in Etta's Attic and was disappointed. As my hubby and I ascended the staircase we noted that it had been a while since the carpet had seen a vacuum cleaner. Entered our room and noted the kitchen floor needed a good sweep and mop. There were also candy wrappers and other small bits of refuse on the sofa, bed, and floor. The guest service staff member shared that house keeping was out for the day and that she was sorry. I get it that a room change in a B&B is not easy but get someone up with a swiffer and a token of your apology. The decor was descent, dusty but descent. If you are ok with cheap blinds and Texas shabby chic go for it. The more I think about it I should have pitched a fit, but it was my birthday and every time we noticed something my hubby looked crestfallen. The location was the only plus, from the hotel you can walk anywhere. Guess what there are other places in the area that may be cleaner and more customer friendly. The breakfast, I mean who does not go to a B&B for the delicious hot breakfast with tea and fresh juices. The food was lukewarm and so was the orange concentrate. We had precooked sausage patties, a spinach egg dish, and over toasted English muffin. Needless to say we picked over our food and left quickly no need to linger. Just paid the pricey almost $300 dollar and made a run for it. Seek residence elsewhere.My husband booked a night in Maude's room to celebrate my birthday. While the location is fantastic, this was a sad, sad hotel. The main problem for us was the cleanliness of the hotel was lacking (crumbs and such on our room floor, for example; peeling pant in the room), not sure the bed had been changed. No one to be seen to ask, since we checked in after 8 pm (!). It was a cold night in January, and the super loud heater ran constantly (on the plus side it masked some of the loud street noise), with no instructions on how to change the thermostat or turn it off. The breakfast was disappointing also. When making the reservation, my husband called to ask them about accommodating my diet restrictions (something good BNBs manage just fine), he was told to put in the online reservation. Imagine our surprise when my breakfast came full of stuff I couldn't eat! After we reminded her (though it seemed she hadn't been told), she offered me "an egg." She did a nice job of scrambling that egg, but I expected better. For those who do eat gluten, I suspect that they would have been disappointed by the breakfast casserole served with store bought raisin bread (on Sunday morning, not even any pastries). Not exactly gourmet as advertised. This seems the remains of a lovely hotel (beautiful library and patios!), but the owners seem to have given up on the place.This place was really cute,  but the WiFi is almost non existent.  Worse than old school dial up.  Don't plan on having real Internet service here! Breakfast was good though.We stayed 2 night in the abundance suite and were very happy. The parking garage is close by and easy walk. There is not a "front desk" but it's ok. The room itself is simple and cute. We got the romance package which included cider, strawberries, and massages. The massage lady was very nice and relaxing. The best thing about the hotel is the breakfast! It is so good! And the lady is so nice. The only downfall is the noise around 7 in the morning is when the streets get busier and construction starts so be prepared but it's expected. It is close to everywhere and ideal location for everything. You have to ask them to validate parking! We will be booking and recommending. Enjoy!Stayed here for one night in 'Laura's Lounge'. I would definitely recommend staying at Etta's Place. AMAZING location in Sundance Square, friendly staff, good breakfast, spacious rooms. There were a number of very minor things in the room that warrants a bump down to 4 stars: broken mirror hinge, very dust blinds, no body wash/soap, a wet book, the bathtub coating was peeling. Still a great overall experience.My wife and I had an event in Fort Worth this weekend. I looked at various hotels downtown and you can't beat the price of Etta's Place. We stayed in Will's Refuge. It is probably one of the smaller rooms but was perfect for us. Clean and comfortable and we never heard any noise from anywhere. This was our 2nd stay at Etta's place and its great. Close parking, free wifi, Incredible breakfast each morning and you can't beat the location. The only problem is picking what you want to do nearby. Four Day Weekend is a must. Great restaurants nearby and great bars and clubs. The only time we left downtown the entire weekend was to go to the event we planned in the first place. I could recommend this place enough.What a great space!! We had the.  perfect stay. Mona and Ryan were overly accommodating.  The common areas were so cozy- courtyard, piano room, library, and kitchen.  Breakfast was delicious! Green chili eggs, peach blackberry crisp. Not drowning in cheese or smothered in sugar. Homemade and naturally TASTY! I'll be recommending Etta's to everyone going to FtW.  Oh, check out Scat's jazz lounge closeby. Former speakeasy, great music.I was pretty amped to stay at Etta's, especially after reading the other reviewer's experiences.  My husband and I lived in Ft. Worth for several years but never stayed downtown so when we came back to attend a wedding rehearsal dinner at Reata's right next door, it seemed like a prime opportunity, but we were extremely let down.  We got to the hotel at 7:45pm, after a minor flight delay, and despite getting their before their proposed closing time, there was no staff to help us, just a small sign that said go to an apartment building (I cannot remember the name, but the name was listed on the small sheet of paper) to pick up our keys.  I walked all the way around the block and didn't see the named apartment building, it wasn't until I asked someone who was walking into a nearby building if they knew where the place was, and they said it was through the double doors, but there was NO MARKING OR NAME ANYWHERE, very frustrating.  Also there was no mention on my confirmation email that there would be an alternate location we would need to go to get our keys - and we were given minimal direction on where to park, luckily we knew the area well enough to know where to go.  Demerit #1 and #2.  We got to our room (Ben's room) which was fine, just as pictured, actually a little bigger than I expected.  It was clean, and had a large walk in closet with robes.  Bathroom was large, fully stocked with amenities, which was nice.  There was also bottled water waiting for us, which I liked.  The bed was very comfortable, the most redeeming quality of the stay for sure.  We found the room to be quiet too, and were not bothered by any street noise.  So that was all good.  There was someone smoking what smelled like illicit drugs down the hall, so that was not cool, but luckily didn't permeate into our room.  Because we had no human contact with any staff when we checked in we had to search the room for info on what time and where breakfast was, which was provided in a tableside guide (not in our check in paper, which I found odd as well, since it is advertised as a B&B).  We got to breakfast and there were a couple muffins and coffee available, and ran into a woman who asked us if we wanted hot food, which we did.  She was nice enough, saying good morning but that was all, she didn't introduce herself, didn't talk to us at all, didn't ask us how our night was...nothing.  Very odd.  We waited about 15 minutes for our meal, which was fine, we were munching on muffins and coffee and orangejuice.  The breakfast was Mexican eggs (a sort of casserole) served cold, with a side of sausage and English muffin, with no butter or jam.  Seriously??  Cold breakfast and no condiments??  The lady disappeared and we didn't see her for more than 20 minutes - so unfortunately the couple that came in after us had to wait for a long time to get their food, infact, we finished eating and grabbed seconds on coffee and they still hadn't gotten anything yet.  We packed up and went to check out, but still no one was to be seen anywhere.  There was another small note that said to leave the keys at the front desk, so we did.  So basically we had the opposite of a B&B experience, with zero human interaction and a mediocre breakfast.  The location is great to be sure, the beds are very comfortable and the rooms are clean, so it is not a total loss, but they definitely need to work on their B&B skills and customer interaction.  To be honest though I would not bother going back, it wasn't worth the price, and wasn't worth the falsified B&B title.For options on Sundance Square, this was great, they really are within walking distance of so many great places to dine. The rooms are spacious and the old building charm is amazing, wonderful patios and views abound here. Really a wonderful place with wonderful charm and amenities.Priced a little steep for the size of the room ($150+), but located centrally in downtown Fort Worth. Bed -- a little soft, but Etta's is my choice when visting Fort Worth because it puts me in the heart of the downtown. Friendly staff, very secure and safe. (Actually, all the downtown area feels safe as local police patrol the area on bicycles throughout the night).

hotel_name: Hampton Inn & Suites Fort Worth-Fossil Creek
review_content: This Hampton Inn is fabulous! We came to stay here for the Cowtown Marathon. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The room was extra clean and the amenities in the room were fantastic! We were leaving the hotel by 5 am and asked the staff if we could get some breakfast prior to leaving and they accommodated us by opening the breakfast early for the basics. Fully supported us! The management here is top notch and I will be back to stay at this hotel again! Thanks for a great experience!This place has a serious problem with noise at night. To many doors slam. All the way to midnight. Front desk takes several calls just to get hold of them. And hey do nothing. No clean towels at the pool. Just a bunch of dirty towels. The noise at night. The doors slamming. Unexceptable. The staff who's works here should be ashamed. Find another place to stay. Anywhere. And the breakfast sucks. No bacon.Oh where to begin! First I think it's important to know that whenever we need a hotel the Hampton Inn is our go-to. We've stayed in several of them! The maid at this location couldn't understand a word we said, (she didn't speak any English), so we didn't get the items we requested, (tea for example). The indoor pool was FREEZING cold so we were unable to enjoy it. Breakfast was ok, not as good as the other Hampton Inn's. BLACK MOLD and mildew in the bathtub, (see the photos I posted). We could hear every single person in the hallway. I was afraid to place anything on the broken desk, (see photo from how the hotel staff tried to fix it due to a previous guest). I wish we would have never stayed at this location, waste of money and they ruined our weekend!Good customer service, extremely clean and a great continental breakfast! I was very pleased that this was our hotel of choice for our travels! I was comfortable and had the opportunity to relax while staying there. My only question is: where do you hide the remote control to the television?Just stayed here last weekend for a concert at the Stockyards and I was very impressed! My room was huge! It was very beautiful as well. Not a bad price for what you get either. The staff was very nice and helpful. The entire hotel was also very clean from what I could tell. The only thing that I have a complaint about was that the shuttle van did not pick us up where he said he would at the Stockyards. I happened to look around and see him down the road and had to run to catch up. Thank God I did or I would have been stuck there. Other than that, everything was great! Will be staying here again.Absolute worst hotel experience of my life.  The management here can not control the noise volumes from the guests.I packed up my children and left the hotel at 12:30 am.Booked my stay over 3 weeks ago..I arrived.. And was greeted well.  After giving her my name..she could not find my reservation.  Asked for my confirmation..I pulled up the saved email on my phone.  Still could not locate my reservation.  After several minutes..she decides to finally just get me in a room ( I had requested the top floor when I booked) of course their were no rooms available on the top.  I tried to pay with my husband's credit card, and was told I could not do that.  I get ready to give her another card with my name, and by some miracle my reservation shows up..and it's pre-paid with my husbands card! And that's okay?? WTH I still don't get the top floor and by the sound of it..they have allowed some baby elephants to stay in the room above meStayed at this hotel numerous times with ok service. Was charged different rates every stay. Tried establishing a set rate and was told no chance. I would suggest traveling a few blocks down for half the price and you are able to set a standard rate for numerous stays. Poor management.For our purposes, this Hampton Inn was great! We came in from Dallas for a show at Billy Bob's. This location offers a Billy Bob's weekend discount of $20. They also provide a free shuttle to and from Billy Bob's, free hot breakfast, and free WiFi. Room was spacious, comfortable and clean. Easy access to 30 for sightseeing in the cultural district. Will definitely stay here again for any overnight trips to Ft. Worth.This Hampton rocks. Manager understands customer service.If you are traveling on business or like to have reliable and fast Internet access, do NOT stay here. Horrible service. You will not get any work done here if you need Internet access. Talked to personnel here and they admittingly said they were aware but not enough people complained to do anything about it. Pathetic service. This is the 2nd Hampton Inn to have this problem. I'm starting to wonder if I need to go to another chai and lose my Diamond status. Hmm?

Rooks are so nice. Clean always have a comfy bed and I totally love the suites. All kinds of room and everything you need. Breakfast is as expected but not too bad. Luke having options and they have a few. Staff is awesome from check in through check out. First rate and always helpful. My new favorite hotel in TexasBottom Line:  Clean and comfortable facility with large rooms but not for light sleepers.I've stayed in about five different Hampton Inns in the last year.  One was totally ghetto while the rest were perfectly comfortable. Overall, I thought this hotel was fine for my business trip.  If you are thinking about staying here, here is some information you may find helpful:- Convenient location to I-35.  Several decent restaurants within a five minute drive.- There is ample, free parking.- Large rooms with a big desks are great for business travelers.- Hotel has breakfast in the morning.  Not gourmet but plenty of variety.- They always have coffee and tea in the lobby.- The staff is pleasant.- The decor in common areas is fresh and up to date.  I found my hotel bathroom to be a little generic but it was fine for a business trip.- Free wi-fi or you can pay $5 and upgrade to a better connection.The biggest downside to this hotel is its loud.  My biggest complaint was the road noise from the interstate but my coworkers also had complaints of elevators dinging and doors slamming.  Luckily i am not a light sleeper, but I did find this hotel to be nosier than most.I had an amazing 4-night stay here!+ Staff was extremely friendly, always greeting me and smiling+ Courtesy phone call as soon as I got to my room asking if everything was okay+ Plenty of parking+ Close access to the highways+ Close to Target / CVS / Gas stations+ Complimentary wifi+ Complimentary breakfast (toast, eggs, sausage, bacon, waffles, mini muffins, yogurt, oatmeal, etc)+ Coffee/ hot chocolate / tea always available at the front desk+ Very cleanThere is nothing great about this hotel. I have nothing against Hampton Inns but this one is particularly unwelcoming. The folks working here are fine but the decor is really bad & the room itself feels cold & in need of redecorating! Upon returning to the room at 3:00pm we find it still hasn't been made up. We left at 9:00am! This is not a mid priced hotel! This is a cheap hotel. I really dislike this place. Yuk!So it's hard to give a budget hotel 5 stars in my book but this one is as close as it gets.  The staff is exceptionally friendly no matter the time of day.  The room was very clean in all aspects.  Pool and hot tub were clean, well chlorinated,   Over a few night stay there was no exceptional noise or large crowds.  The building is well secured and required key cards at all doors except the front 24 hours a day.  The front locked down at night as well.  Parking was no issue, for the few nights we were there the lot was 1/2 full, maybe 3/4 full,  Parking lot does have two ways in and out which makes it a bit easier for locals to smash and grab but on the backside so many rooms look into the parking lot they would have to be brazen.  If you are working on this side of town or within a 15 minute drive I advise this is one of the better hotels out there.My family stayed here on a Friday night because we had an early Saturday morning event and home is just far enough away to not want to leave that early.  We really enjoyed the stay.  The room was very clean and spacious.  They recently had DirecTV installed, so that was a huge upgrade to the typical channel selection and cable quality.  The pool and sauna were well maintained (maybe a little over board on the chlorine).  The breakfast was honestly the freshest I have had at a Hampton (hundred of nights in Hampton Hotels over the years).  They were restocking it even before it emptied.  The biggest thing for me was the friendliness of the staff.  Everyone that passed us had a very warm and genuine hello.  Also, we hit Fort Worth a little earlier than expected (about 9AM) with plans to spend the day outside.  Unfortunately, it started raining as we were getting into town so we had nothing really to do before check-in.  I asked if there was a way that we could get a key to use the pool for a couple of hours until lunch.  Instead, they found us a ready room and let us check in completely for no additional charge.  The only two things that keep this from being a 5 are the price (over $100 after taxes for a weekend night on the West Side of Fort Worth - so nowhere near the airport - was a bit much) and the internet access.  It was miserably slow even by hotel standards.Stayed here for about 3 days. The room was ok. The room was set up as a big studio room with bed and sofa at opposite ends. The breakfast was good the usual. The staff was very friendly. And best of all the hotel is right across the highway from a mall. Grab your Hilton points here.The renovation at this hotel came out great.  Checked in last night and had a great nights sleep on the new mattresses.  Woke up this morning and really enjoyed my workout in the fitness center.  The staff is super friendly and I love that they have Direct TV so I can use the guide when deciding what to watchI recently traveled to Fort Worth to meet with a vendor and I stayed at this hotel. I left my room to go to dinner the first night and I was unable to re-enter it due to some sort of lock malfunction. They parked me in an adjacent room where I spent a fitful night sleeping in my clothes on top of the bed in there. The hotel was not able to re-open the door until the next morning as their maintenance person was unavailable. I was late for a planned 8am meeting the next day.The manager comped the room for both nights, although the front desk needed to be reminded of that and the first bill they gave me included a charge for the second night. They also gave me a $25 gift card to Starbucks since the free room benefits my (huge) employer and my employer wasn't inconvenienced by this at all. I was thinking more along the lines of a voucher for a free night's stay in the Hilton chain, but I guess he wasn't thinking along the same lines.The breakfast was so-so. I am a bread and fruit person when it comes to breakfast and the cut-up fruit had a funny taste to it and a couple of the pieces were well past their prime. The room was clean. The toilet in the room they transferred me to had a problem with the flapper valve, but if I flushed it a couple of times it would eventually seat correctly and stop running. Their maintenance guy was asked to look at it, but apparently he figures that it's ok for guests to flush the toilet a few times to make the toilet stop running.I don't plan on staying at this hotel again should I need to have additional meetings in Fort Worth with this vendor. The manager did what he could to make up for a situation that never should have happened in the first place. It wasn't enough.Great mid-priced hotel. Large spacious rooms, great staff. Free wired/wireless Internet in the rooms and common areas.Nice pool/whirlpool/workout room. Super nice, except I really hate the Philips flatscreen HDTVs that can't preserve aspect ration of standard def channels.

hotel_name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Fort Worth North
review_content: Great rooms, nicely decorated.  Great rates. Pool needs a good cleaning and disappointing you couldn't walk to the pool area without holding your breath from all of the smokers hanging outside the pool area.  Not sure if beds were comfortable I was asleep before I could tell. Blackout curtains did the trick, either that or before bed time swim did bc kids slept till after 8. Breakfast choices were lots of carbs, bagels, fruit, cereal, Texas shaped waffles, juices, coffee, muffins and hard boiled eggs. Seemed to be a nice area, felt safe. Overall very nice la Quinta.The room was nice enough, but good Lord the service is less than I've come to expect from La Quinta. They have these really nice rooms that face their lobby, but what they don't tell you is that almost every night the lobby (it's big and easily usable for parties) is rented out to anyone that might want to put some money down on a place to be as loud as possible until as late as they want. Two nights in a row now, I've asked the desk clerk (different person both times) to break up loud, alcohol-fueled (not speculation-bottles everywhere) parties, not only well after midnight, but after they'd been going on for several hours. Tonight, a desk clerk named Katherine told me, "well sir they rented the area for a wedding reception." Great. Thanks, Katherine. I RENTED ROOM 212 FOR THREE NIGHTS.  DOES THAT MATTER TO ANYONE?! Apparently, it doesn't. It confuses me to wonder why they'd have rooms that are basically in the lobby and allow this to go on. There are only a few (4 maybe? Less?), but they offer absolutely no retreat from tge noise of the appatently rentable lobby. Oh and on the first night, the hotel had to be evacuated for over an hour at almost 3am because of a fire alarm. The official story about it involved mechanical malfunction. If that's true, then I guess it really couldn't be helped and isn't the hotel's fault, but it was very inconvenient. Also, The proximity to the Interstate means traffic noise all day and all night.The breakfast is sub-par too. Every other  La Quinta I've stayed in for the last five or six years has had hot food items like eggs, sausage, biscuits and gravy, bacon, etc. For the days now this one can't be bothered for more than a half hearted, poorly stocked attempt at cereal, toast, dry muffins, and waffles. To be fair, the waffles were shaped like Texas. That was cute. I stay in La Quintas everywhere I go because they take pets and because their rewards system is great. This experience won't change that, but I'll never stay here again. This has been the least restful hotel stay I've ever endured.TL;DR-- La Quinta is great, but you should definitely skip this one.We've had mixed results staying at La Quinta before, but overall they've been decent. This room is not even decent. When we booked the room we were told we'd have a bedroom that was separate from the couch area, but when we arrived we were put into a smaller room and had to pay extra for what we were supposed to have had originally. There were long hairs hanging from the overhead light in the hallway, from the 'do not disturb' sign in our room, in our bed, and pubic hair and soap left on the shower wall. The carpets are stained throughout the room, and the ceiling was leaking, which I found out by stepping in a puddle on the floor. Just when we thought that was all, there were candles left on the rail and collecting rain outside the window, and loose pills on the shelf in the closet. Most of that stuff was found after I turned down the offer to move us to a third room so I've been told that I have to speak to the manager to ask for a refund of any sort. Spend your money elsewhere.This place is in need of a serious remodel. The reason we picked this hotel was because they 1) allowed dogs and 2) were on our way to OK and it didn't detour us.First of all, this place is pretty grungy. I didn't know there are still hotels with the option to smoke in the rooms. You can definitely tell which wings allow for smoking. So gross. The elevator smelled of gas and another patron even mentioned it after I smelled it earlier. The bed was meh. The place sufficed for one night and for our circumstances. The staff was friendly upon interaction. I will say, we called about an hour before we got there to make a reservation and it took all of three minutes. However, they never mentioned that the driveway street to their entrance was being re-paved and unable to access. At a 1:30 am arrival, it would have been nice to know because we wound up getting lost trying to find out how to enter. To the gentleman who answered the phone at 1:30 when we were lost: thank you for your courteous help and patience with us by staying on the phone with us while we found where we were. We are grateful for that! :)Total bummer that the entire highway is also under construction there so it wasn't easy navigating to get back north, even with technology today. It's not the hotels' fault but it was an inconvenience trying to get out of dodge. Hopefully these two hiccups are cured soon. If this location remodeled like another La Quinta we recently stated in, it could be a great spot to stay. The staff is friendly, they allow dogs, and eventually the highway will have a beautiful entrance ramp. If you're looking to stay at a La Quinta, I recommend inquiring if it's remodeled. It makes a huge difference of opinion.I'm visiting my kids and grandkids in FortWorth because the house is so full with 4 adults 4 kids and 3 dogs I got myself a room at the LaQuinta I got a GREAT price and it's very nice free breakfast free wifi my grandkids love the pool... The people that work there are so nice it's really made my trip great... The only downside is there's no restaurant on sight and you need a car to get to any....We have stayed at several LQs from California to Florida since the beginning of this year and this one was the nicest experience so far. The lobby was palacial compared to the others we had been to and the grounds looked akin to a summer resort. The room itself wasn't exceptional in any way but with two windows and a really nice view, it seemed more like a condo than a hotel room. It was quite comfortable. Looking for a good reason to stay another night ...Service declined. Less that LAQ standards. Elite client. This facility is not recommendedI stayed here for a the 4th of July holiday for a little mini-getaway to Fort Worth and had a great time!  We had never stayed at La Quinta before so we didn't know what to expect.  We got a really good rate and the best part is that we could bring our dog with out any sort of fees or deposits.  They just require that you sign a waiver that if anything does happen, you will be liable.  The check-in process was a little time consuming because they only had one person at the desk.  But the lady offered me a late check-out the next day without my even asking for it.  How sweet.  The room was clean and had a microwave and fridge.  It was very quiet.  The next day we went down for breakfast and it all went well.  They don't really have a full on breakfast, but they did have more than your average continental breakfast.  They had a waffle iron that you make your own Texas shaped waffles.  Pretty cool touch.  We also went to the pool which was very clean and refreshing.  They had a sign stating to ask for pool towels at the desk, I waited about 5 minutes to be told there were none.  Bummer. Not their fault..she said people may have brought the front desk towels up to their rooms after the pool.  Check-out process was just as time-consuming as the check-in because there was again only one person.  She was very sweet though so I didn't mind, the persons attitude can make or break a situation.  I will definitely be back here if we decide to stay the night in Fort Worth again!This is a fine hotel, but I'm really glad I got a discount 15% by making reservations over the phone. LaQuinta allows guests to bring pets with no deposit or extra fee so I was able to bring my dog - which was nice. My room was on the "highway" side though & it was super LOUD. Pretty much every motorcycle, 18 wheeler or car with a muffler problem sounded like it was right outside my window. That's the main reason for the low star rating.The facility was clean and looked like it has been well taken care of and for such a low price - it was pretty good, even if I had to listen to traffic all night.I'm wrapping up a 5-day family road trip where we stayed here with a baby and 2 dogs. We got a suite for more space and were happy with that, but that's really about it. Overall this was the worst of the places we stopped (we stayed at another LQ, HIE and Hampton Inn). We love the no pet fees and there was a nice field for our dogs if you follow a path past the hotel. The room was in bad need of a makeover and the shower was gross. Our room was near stairs where I saw giant roaches more than once, but on the plus side, no bedbugs! Stay here only if you're in a real hurry.

Very polite staff, clean room, pretty quiet area next to a bank. Our uber drivers always had trouble finding it because of the weird location. They had a fridge, microwave, and basic amenities. Plenty of space for 2.I'm not sure where to begin with my review.  We stayed one night at another place far from this one. Between the limited parking and uncomfortable bed we searched for something more suitable and accommodating. After having compared it with much newer and more expensive lodging we chose Springhill Suites. We arrived Saturday night 10.31.15. The place was packed with people wearing T.C.U. apparel.  I realized our proximity to the campus was very close. We got to the counter and a very nice lady greeted us. If you have a stay here we hope you get Mrs.Shawntay at the counter.  The lady knows her job and does it with a smile.  She gave my Wife and I restaurant recommendations and I even gave her one she hadn't heard of. The few days we stayed she worked probably 3 if not 4 shifts, sometimes split shift.  My hats off to her & Management if you're reading give this woman a raise in the money department.  We made it to our room and on the way noticed the wallpaper and carpet.  Different than most hotels but not terrible.  The room on the other hand was a different thing. The popcorn ceilings hit you as soon as you walk in. You notice the couch with a drab grey color.  The bathroom needs updating and our tub drained slow.  The bed......ohhh the bed. Well it's your standard hotel room King size bed.  The sheets were okay and pillows decent.  Now here's where I had an issue.  I had a bad experience in Spring, Tx june of 2012 with bed bugs. I thoroughly check walls, bedding and floors for them.  I don't want them on us or traveling to our home. When I enter a room I Immediately check for any signs of bed bugs.  You will see a video of the bed sham were it looks like it was leftover from a bed bug infestation.  I will say that we Didn't experience any bed bugs issues.  The breakfast wasn't all that great.  They seem to have served real eggs.  The Canadian Turkey bacon was horrible, waffles okay and juice decent. My Wife really liked the black tea they had. She took two more packets with her. Although by a main highway we didn't have noise issues.  We got our rest and the bed was cool.  I appreciate the free covered parking as well. We were able to park with no issues.  I hope Springhill Suites puts up 4 million to renovate because the place would benefit from it immensely.  Get showers with no tub and some new loveseats. For God sake take up the stinking carpet and put down some wood or faux wood. I might go back if we are in the area but I would hope for updates.Great service. Free suckers at check-in. Everything was great until I spotted several, either ticks or bedbugs on the couch. I'm up at 3am writing a review now because I'm afraid to lay back down and go to sleep. So if you come, don't get room 214 at least.  Ill update in the morning if I survive the night.Regretfully, management can't fix the way too close proximity of the interstate... Room is noisy from vehicle traffic and even on 3rd floor shakes when trucks go by...  Odor of mildew from the AC unit also needs to be addressed.Reasonable rates! My room was clean. Staff did a great job of meeting my needs. The breakfast is hot, fresh & had numerous options. I love options. Internet was fast.We came for a conference/training with TCU and stayed for 6 nights. The room was great for two people and included a microwave and mini-fridge. There are a few restaurants within walking distance, but we preferred to explore the area. A downside to the facility is they have the smallest pool I have ever seen! Seriously- cannot do laps. The fitness center is quite small as well, but I never had to wait for any equipment. Overall, it was a great stay-quiet, clean, good breakfasts, and friendly staff.I came here for a conference for a few days, not knowing what to expect, after all this was my first time in Texas.   The staff at the front desk was very nice and checked all of us in. We weren't the only conference group that just arrived.  Two other groups of over 10 all arrived with us.  They were patient with us and every gave us recommendations of were to eat around the area.  Parking here is free if you have a rental. If the public lot is full you can use your hotel key and park in the private lot.  The rooms were clean and when I trouble with my tv, they immediately sent someone up to fix it.  There is free breakfast in the morning that usually has eggs, ham, or sausages, and other pastries.  They also have waffle and toaster maker.  My only complaint is that when i wanted to make tea the water that came out was brown. It was probably from the coffee from before.  But again, it was over 107 degrees outside, i guess i didn't need my tea.  Overall it was a great stay!I was staying here while attending the Scentsy 2011 Convention. The people at the front desk were super nice and always friendly. When walking in or out the always say hello, welcome, or bye. I've never experienced this type of pleasantry before at a hotel before. The decor in the rooms is a little outdated but still nice looking. There is a mini fridge, microwave, and tv in the rooms. Be sure to bring your swim suits as there is a small pool and jacuzzi located on the side of the building. There is even a grill next to the pool too :-) The room cleaners come pretty early so if your sleeping in make sure to put the sign on the door so they don't walk in on you naked like they did me. lolThe reason I gave this place a 4 rating and not a 5 is because of the location. There were a few taxi cab drivers that didn't even know where Springhill Suites was located making it a nightmare at times to get back.Great service.  Hotel is great for price-range, especially when booked on Priceline.  This is my hotel of choice when visiting TCU.Great highway access as well as near TCU, Zoo, Culture District, Stockyards & more.  Every staff member I encountered was friendly and helpful when needed.  Makes for an enjoyable stay.Very nice clean rooms with a great modern color scheme. The suite was roomy and the bed was comfortable. The staff was super friendly and the rate was excellent. I'd gladly come here again. The only knock is that while it's in a very busy area it may be difficult to get to.

hotel_name: Hilton Garden Inn Fort Worth/Fossil Creek
review_content: Needs upgrading big time.  I've stayed at least 20 hiltons garden inns this one is on the "help me" side of the fence.  Wifi does not work.  Painters and construction around the property. They think they are improving the rooms with paint... Need more improvements... Furniture, bathroom fixtures, etc Don't get me wrong, it's clean but, just paint to improve?  Hilton.... You can do better.One star because negative isn't an option.  Don't go here.  Gave away 2 of our guaranteed nonrefundable rooms that were represented as not changeable or cancelable when blooded before noon Friday AND AFTER  my son checked us in to all 3 guaranteed reserved rooms @ 9 on Saturday by calling my son @ 1115 pm to tell him to call the rest of us and tell us we couldn't come because the hotel was "overbooked", then called us "crazy for expecting our other two rooms and threaten to call the police is the other guests came to the hotel on both my son in his room and those of us left stranded.  In addition my son reports the bathroom in the one room actually delivered was filthy including had urine and pubic hair on the toilet seat.  I'd skip this and any other Hilton property until the organization cleans up its rooms and its Business practices.Hot water won't heat up, shower door leaked & tile entryway got soaked. Keurig was broken, could hear everything & across from workout room, front door wouldn't shut, could see into room thru crack. Horrible Hilton. By road & lots of noise & construction. Room 142 blowsI'm honestly not one to write bad reviews but I stay at Hiltons and Hilton Garden Inns basically every week and this one was by far the worst. It's in the middle of nowhere, outdated, has a weird smell to it, the water fails to get warm, housekeeping does a poor job, and I had horrible experiences with two different members of the front desk staff. Hilton price for motel quality.Dingy old hotel in the middle of nowhere. Don't stay here unless you have too. Hotel smells like smoke and everything is in need of an update.Hotel service was AWFUL, we had to wait in line over 30minutes just to get checked in! The rooms weren't all that nice either, add in the fact that our ac wasn't working... I won't be staying here again that's for sure!Hmmmm.
