I don't hate it, but it's an inadequately maintained property by Hilton standards. Like most hotels with an indoor pool it suffers from poor ventilation and a general mugginess throughout. The staff is super friendly and the quiet location would be great - 5 minutes drive from downtown Ft. Worth if not for the awful highway construction. Needs updating with replacement doors, etc., not just another coat of paint.Old dated super8 quality and hilton price.  Nothing here worth 200$ a night.Great stay. We had a little trouble with breakfast one morning when they were very busy. Otherwise the breakfast was perfect. We nearly always book the bed and breakfast packages when we stay at Hilton Garden Inns, well worth it!The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was large, clean, and comfortable.Stayed here with the family for an overnight trip to FW for a funeral.  Clean rooms and friendly staff.  Breakfast was good and the lobby bar fine for a quick dinner and few beers.  Only downside is the location, it's right next to 35 in middle of an industrial/business park area.  Not that easy to get to, especially at night.  Also not much around it in the way of restaurants, etc., but it was just down the street from funeral home we were visiting.  All in all it was what I expected from a Hilton Garden Inn.Diamond member so have experience in many HGI have to rate this the worst I've stayed in.  Mold all over the shower, hair on the vanity, slow draining sink, shower handle put on so hot really means cold.  Loud housekeeping banging on doors in the a.m.  Really disappointed in the $169 I spent here really gives Hilton a bad reputation.We initially had a checking in snafu but the way their front desk staff handled it was so great! Amanda was especially helpful. They even upgraded our room and gave us free tickets to Billy Bobs. They made sure we were comfortable and we so friendly.The rooms were clean and comfortable. The breakfast was really good! All in all they made sure our stay was wonderful.Bottom Line - This hotel is NOT clean and has a funky smell to it (I think it's the lingering smell of smoke). Though the lobby looks newer or renovated, you're in for a shock once you enter your room.  Housekeeping here is on the poor side... at check-in, there was a penny on the floor next to the bed, large pieces of lint on the carpet, and long hair strands on two towels (one on a bath towel, and one on a hand towel). Also beware that the hotel's backyard is a freeway, and can get pretty loud. In 2010, I stayed in hotel rooms for 83 nights, 60 of them at Hilton properties... this makes me Diamond VIP during 2011 with HHonors. I'd say it's going to be pretty impossible to have satisfactory stays 100% of the time and you're bound to have awful experiences.... the Hilton Garden Inn Fort Worth (at 4400 North Fwy, Fort Worth, TX) is the hotel that is the unsatisfactory/awful one.The fact that there were large pieces of lint on the carpet floor (as well as a penny) tells me that housekeeping here is lazy... in my case, they did not bother to vacuum the room between guests (I can be okay with no vacuum within my stay, but even that isn't okay), and they do not inspect laundry for hair because there were strands of hair on my "fresh" towels! I uploaded a photo of one of these hairs, just click the link above. YUCK. I booked 3 nights in this hotel.  As I type this, I am on my 2nd night (I checked in yesterday), and have already told the desk staff that I will be checking out in the morning. I should have checked out this morning after the 1st night, but I was in a hurry and running late.  This was laziness on my part. I will be telling the hotel staff about my dissatisfaction when I check out. I also realized this afternoon that I have two small bug bites on my right hand... I can't be 100% sure they happened during my first night, but I didn't have these bites yesterday. Once I get home, my suitcase is going straight to the laundromat and my luggage is going to be vacuumed before I even go home.  *shiver*I plan to take an ambien tonight, get through the night, and get the fuck out of here and into a different hotel. I plan to cross-post this to TripAdvisor.Construction going on until June, wasn't told of this until we arrived.  Mattress needs replaced, sleep in a hole from being worn.  Employes were friendly.  Some 3rd floor rooms have been remodeled, I'm on the 2nd floor without an updated room.  They were working outside my window yesterday until 5:30PM putting stucco on the exterior of the building, quite noisy.  Front Desk told me the workers return around 9AM.  Clean hotel as far as I can tell.  Pool closed.  Diamond Hilton member.I stay here periodically and I'm always pleased.  Front desk staff is always friendly and check-in is quick.  Rooms are clean, and housekeeping staff is accommodating for extra towels, etc.  The outdoor pool is always nice, although I wish there was an outdoor spa as well as the indoor one.  Breakfast here is reasonably priced and Annette in the restaurant is the friendliest, most helpful person we've come across.. always remembers us by name.  Free wi-fi is a nice perk and the beds are SOOOO comfortable!   The location works well for us, close enough to downtown and the stockyards for a quick drive, yet far enough to be out of the traffic and noise.  I read the other reviews, but have never experienced the issues with cleanliness that some have.  No complaints and I will continue to stay here.Reasonable clean is the highest praise I can give this place. The best hotel I ever stayed at was a Hilton Garden Inn, but it was not this one... If all you need is a clean safe room for the night near the highway, there are cheaper places. If however you are looking for something more look elsewhere as well. No free breakfast, coffee or tea, fruit, or any of the other bonuses you can usually expect from comparably priced hotels.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express & Suites Dfw West - Hurst
review_content: When I think of a Holiday Inn, the first thing that comes to mind is a cheap subpar hotel.  This was definitely not the case for this hotel.  I stayed here for 2 nights during a conference that was being held nearby at the Hurst Conference Center.  The great thing about this hotel was the quality of the room and the proximity near the conference center.Upon entering the room, I noticed how spacious the room was.  Our room contained two beds, TV, microwave, coffee maker, ice bucket, and a fridge.  Each bed contained a faux down comforter with four pillows: two firm and two soft pillows.  There were enough plugs to charge your electronic devices.  The bathroom had a modern feel with a large sink and bath tub/shower.  The room and bathroom were very clean with plenty of towels.   Along with the comfortable rooms, they offered free happy hour and breakfast in the morning.  Most cheaper name hotels only a continental breakfast, this was definitely not the case.  After enjoying a workout in their fitness center, I was pleasantly surprised to find hot breakfast with healthy options, such as turkey sausage.  They have breakfast options for everyone's preferences from the traditional cereal and oatmeal all the way to a pancake maker. The FREE happy hour was impressive.  Their happy hour offers a selection of local and domestic beers with horderves.  This happy hour was located in their dining room area and was popular among the individuals staying in this hotel.  Do not pass up this opportunity to enjoy good conversation among individuals while enjoying a beverage with finger foods.I would stay at this hotel again.  I was pleasantly surprised how I enjoyed my stay here better than some Marriott or Hilton hotels.Did not stay here for lodging - but came here for a small 3-day training seminar. Although there was construction going on at the front lobby (guests had to use the side doors), it was clearly marked and the noise was kept to a minimum.  Our conference room was located pretty close to the construction, yet we never heard a sound.  Because the three-day seminar, occurred all day.  I wanted to comment on parking and breakfast.Outside the lobby, there is a table seating area for guests to meet or eat.  In the morning hours, they serve breakfast, which includes pancakes (that are made by a conveyor belt machine - which was pretty cool, BTW), biscuits and gravy, sausage, eggs, delicious and magnificent cinnamon rolls that compare to Cinnabun. I would just eat one pancake and with the cinnamon roll instead of using syrup.  They also offered muffins and other pastries, which I did not partake because the cinnamon rolls is what I spent all my morning calories on.  The rolls are kept under a heating lamp, so they are kept warm and never get hard.  The air conditioning worked great too, although a couple of guests said the AC units were really loud, but I love the white noise of a AC unit, so it would have been just fine for me. The parking was abundant and easy to navigate.  There were plenty of shade during those hot summer months when it makes a world of difference parking under a tree.  If I wasn't staying with family during the training seminar, I would have definitely stayed here.Wow.  I never give 5 stars.For $105 I got free shuttle,  to/from DFW.Wine bar / breakfast with protein / ...and Very new and clean roomThe place was immaculate.I'm from Vermont and I can tell you this room would be $350/NIGHT in VT.  Wow. ...Got stuck next to the elevator and it is LOUD. We can hear all of the mechanical and electrical sounds in the room... we can even hear the elevator ding when it arrives on the floor. ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE. And, the staff won't move us because they are sold out... even though priceline shows 3 available rooms... understandable. What I cant understand is that this is a newer hotel and the sound proofing is non-existent. Totally dissatisfied with this hotel.We booked 6 rooms for 3 nights at this location. The staff was so nice & accommodating. The rooms were clean & the beds very comfortable. Housekeeping was amazing & friendly. The hotel is in a great location - right across from the police station, so there is a great sense of security. It is also close to plenty of great restaurants & shopping. We were not disappointed  with anything!The hotel and staff are great.  I had a VERY clean room(not just the synthetic cleaner smell either).  The hotel was quiet during my stay and the beds was good.  I don't expect it to feel like home for me, but I do appreciate a good bed. Breakfast is the typical HIE fare, and was as expected. I missed the evening reception, but those are always welcomed when I see them. My only negative here is the internet is pathetically slow. Worse than dial up. I travel a lot for work and depend on being able to work in the room, but this is bad.  I even moved around the building looking like a creeper to find somewhere that I could send an email from.  Now I know why the Starbucks down the street was packed. If the Internet worked great(and there is no reason a hotel should be bandwidth limited) I'd give this a 5 star rating.  I actually struggled to give it 4 solely because of the wifi.Great experience!  Doesn't get much better than this for a hotel around $100 a night.  Clean, courteous staff, great lobby, etc.  Only negative is there is so much construction on the freeway.  However, that's not the hotels fault.  I'll continue to stay here when I'm on business in this area of DFW.I opted to stay here for business after reading some of the other reviews here and on Yelp. It is a few minutes away from other Holiday Inn Expresses, but looks to be so much better. The breakfast bar area was pretty nice and clean and quiet, and the food was pretty good. The staff were nice, the rooms were clean and pretty modern. The TV channel selection was huge compared to others I've seen recently. The only concern I had was that the police station or hospital that were nearby would keep me up/be noisy, but it wasn't an issue.Overall, if you are in the area, definately consider this property. Although I didn't go into the other Holiday Inn Express right up the road towards the airport in Bedford, I would discourage people from staying there for now as there is massive construction going on.Only reason this isn't 5 stars is that it isn't a resort hotel on a beach somewhere ;) PS If you stay here, go to BJ's Brewhouse about a mile away. Great beer selection, great service, and the food was good.Great hotel and a good value. Well appointed and in like new shape.  You usually get what you pay for when staying at a hotel but this one gives you more.This place is awesome, next time I get stranded in Dallas waiting on a flight of North and their airports are iced/snowed in I'm coming back here!!! They sent a shovel out for me once I arrive the room was ready to go, great looking room clean smell great looked excellent also from 5 to 7 is their happy hour had plenty of food and beer available. Staff very courteous driver excellent. The pool and hot to of were great as well hit the spot stayed open until 11 PM.I will definitely and I do mean definitely stay here any time... Maybe when NASCAR comes back this year is not that far away from the track.In town for family visit, usually stay a couple doors down, but they were booked, so we got in here.  Our history with Holiday Inn Express in other towns has always been good, so we didn't expect this stay to be any different.  From the moment we walked into the hotel, we knew it would be different! First, I'll start with the interior, very beautiful, clean, staff friendly and courteous.  Our room was spacious, clean, and very nicely decorated.  We had so much room to spread out and after being on vacation for a few more days, this extra space was nice.  Our bathroom had no tub, but then who usually takes a bath on vacation?  The amenities were also very nice, the breakfast bar served both hot and cold items, the pastries were fresh and delicious, the coffee per my husbands comments, was better than most.We didn't swim, but took a look at pool, it was indoors, and completely empty, and although the temps in town during our stay were warm enough for swimming, we just didn't have time.We got clean towels and toiletries daily, however, my husband spilled some potato chips on the floor, tried to clean it up best he could, and we noticed on day three they didn't run the vacuum, as the broken chips could still be seen on the floor. With the location of my family close by, this seems a good location to stay for future trips, and I feel was a "nicer" hotel compared to our previous stay up the street, and so with our future visits, I do believe we'll be back!I stay in a ton of business hotels and travel to DFW often.  If you find yourself near Hurst, this Holiday Inn just cant be beat.  The staff is friendly. The hotel is beautiful and the managers reception every evening is top notch.  Wireless internet is fast.  Its nice to find hotel management that still understands the importance of first rate customer service.  Bravo!Just checked in and am very impressed with cleanliness on the whole place.  Looks brand new.  Rooms are spacious.  Beautiful lobby, business center.  Indoor pool that closes at 10pm.  One problem- had to have keys "rekeyed" several times.  Would open door fine- then wouldn't.  Weird.  May be an isolated problem.As a priority club member, I've seen a few Holiday Inn's.  This one is one of the best I've seen. This place was impressive, lobby was clean, very up to date with beautiful decor, very very high ceilings with custom curtains to the top, wall covered dark wood fireplace with huge tv mantel and sitting area, also adjacent to the sitting area are these huge wooden glass doors leading to what looked like a library business sitting area.  Just seems accomodating for travelers that have to stay longer than the norm. The room was nice, shower was beautiful for a Holiday Inn, tile work and walk around shower feature was wonderful.  Tile work was also seen in pool area, hot tub was great, and rock flooring and decor was inviting.  Business office worked well. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is the breakfast, could've been a lot better, would rather go somewhere and pay for breakfast. Biscuits were hard as a rock, eggs had no flavor...that's with it being an "omelet?", sausage was cold...just not good.  The area is great with it's wonderful mall, huge theatre, cheap gas, and restaurants...speaking of...Sweet Basil Thai Cuisine is absolutely a must!!  Ate there both nights we were in town, and ordered some for the trip home the next day.  That good!

Probably the best hotel experience I've had in a long time. Great facilities, but the staff is what makes it great. Perfect place for kids, breakfast is great, location is perfect. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.My boyfriend and I stayed here for a couple of days for a business trip this past weekend and I promised him that I would write a good review once we got back. Overall we both had a pleasant experience. The hotel is nicely furnished and well kept, but still had a casual vibe and did not feel the least bit stuffy or pretentious. The people at the front desk were super nice and helpful. We stopped by the hotel bar at one point, which was pretty decent. The cocktail list was fairly short. My appletini was alright, but the bartender was nice and friendly, so you can't go wrong there. We ordered room service for food once. It was convenient, but in my opinion lacked options. My 7 in. pizza was pretty good, but my boyfriend wasn't blown away with his chicken fried steak. I guess the menu is a hit or miss. I definitely recommend walking to the Torchy's that is literally right next door since we are both familiar with the chain and know that it would be great no matter what. Anyways...I'm used to having mediocre experiences with hotels, so our stay here was almost like a breath of fresh air. The service was great overall and we had a very comfortable stay with nothing to really complain about. It seemed to be in a good area as well. I would be happy to return in the future.4 stars in relation to hotels of similar brand and prices.  (Not talking the Four Seasons here.) Just a couple of little things kept it from being a 5/5.So, you need a place to stay in Ft Worth?  A place with easy check-ins, a couple of walkable places to eat, a decent lobby with a bar, and a kickin'-A indoor pool for your kiddos? THIS IS THE PLACE.Staff: super friendlyCheck in: super easy (online)Check out: easy, but they didn't have luggage carts available. They were all in use, and they had no idea when they would return downstairs. This was hard on us since we had a baby with all sorts of baby stuffRooms:  Merely decent. Nothing special about the rooms. The shower was nice.Pool: looked awesome. Indoor!Nearby: plenty of parking in an adjacent garage. A Torchy's Tacos was adjacent as well, that has a bar and is open early for breakfast tacos. AWESOME.Highway Access: super easy to get back on I-30. We had easy drives to Shady Oaks Country Club and Joe T. Garcia's.The elevators stopped working properly while we were there, but they had elevator repairmen out first thing on a Sunday morning. This property is well-managed.This is our new place to stay in Ft. Worth. We thought it was a very decent value!Nice place.  Room was comfortable & clean.  The food was so-so, but the coffee was good in the morning.  I ate a hamburger there and it was nothing special - but it did the job to sasiate my hunger.I can only comment on banquet facilities.The hotel is conveniently located near downtown in the western part of the Hospital district. I like that fact that's it's away from the downtown traffic and they provide free parking.The room was very nice, the light was a little dark but maybe that could have been adjusted if we would have asked.The lunch was actually really good and the special touch of the edible flower on top made for a pleasant experience. The wait staff was very attentive and our luncheon was very successful. I'm"m sure we will be returning to this hotel next.Not a bad place. Not a bad place, indeed. As what I could imagine to be a popular spot for parents and visitors coming in to visit TCU students, it serves as a convenient hotel for that kind of trip. Located close enough to TCU and all the action on Magnolia street - it was definitely the place for us lovely Yelp ladies to enjoy our time in Funky Town. It has all the necessities, except complimentary breakfast, but is definitely doable for a quick personal or business trip. With free coffee in the lobby all day long, I knew I was in for a good visit to fuel my late night work hours. Plus, the staff was nice and even willing to extend the breakfast just a little longer for my late-rising self. The rooms were spacious and the beds were comfy. The pillow situation was definitely interesting as there were four tiny pillows rather than two over-sized pillows. I almost enjoyed it more as I could make a whole pillow wall to sleep against. Free wifi for guests was a perk and the speediness made it even more attractive. The showers would be my only gripe as the was no water pressure and not the best toiletries. All in all, Hilton Garden Inn made my Fort Worth trip a successful one!I highly recommend staying at this hotel or just stopping in to meet some of the nicest people! I was staying at the hotel next door and wanted a drink which my hotel didn't offer so I went here. I was greeted by the nicest hostess and server at the restaurant bar. They had nothing but kind things to say and I was having so much fun talking and laughing with them that I told them I would visit them again the next night. The next night not only did I have a grand time I met the best chef, bartender, guest service staff etc... They even went out of the way to help me with printing and scanning things for my work. The food was also delicious, made fresh in no time! I will be visiting them all again tonight because I consider them my friends. Also the hotel itself is kept in immaculate condition and located just 3 minutes away from downtown Fort Worth.I loved my stay here and hope to return soon. My room was filled with art highlighting Fort Worth landmarks. The bed was great and top notch staff. The landscaping was also very welcoming. I highly recommend this place. Clean and quiet. Every staff person I encountered was friendly and the ambiance of the entire hotel was relaxing.Our home away from home when visiting Fort Worth. While the husband attends to business, I shop and do errands and this hotel is convenient for what we need to do. Clean, comfortable rooms with full bar and restaurant with a great menu. Breakfast is fantastic with cook to order eggs, Starbucks coffee and the works. Convenient to the medical center and the zoo. Give it a try!!!I got to experience Hilton Garden Inn while in the area on business, and I was pleasantly surprised. I tend to prefer boutique hotels. And though the rooms were simple, they were clean and the lobby had enough personality to win me over. It's huge and they have a great downstairs restaurant and full bar. Work station, indoor swimming pool and fitness center amenities are offered. Best of all, it's in a great location. Just minutes from the vibrant TCU campus, there are loads of restaurants, museums and other great local businesses in the area. Parking is free and there is a Torchy's connected next door if you're not in the mood to drive around. Best of all, the staff was very friendly and hospitable. This hotel is a fitting choice if you happen to be in search of quality on an reasonable budget in a desirable area of Fort Worth.This hotel is so awesome. The food is spectacular and the service is amazing. They are always asking how they can make my stay better. I'm currently enjoying the Chicken Fried Steak in my room and WOW. I would highly recommend this hotel. Love it.We had never stayed at a Hilton Garden Inn before and decided to give this one a shot since it is close to Baylor Medical Center and John Peter Smith Hospital. Check in was easy and fast, room was very clean and bed and pillows are very comfortable, free parking in the garage across the street, happy hour drink specials between 5-7pm, takes only minutes to walk to Torchy's Taco's or Jason's Deli. There is a nice patio outside with a fire pit. Also has a business center and the lobby is nice to relax in (lounge chairs, sofas, fireplace). There is an awesome indoor pool for anyone with kids - basketball hoop in the pool and play structures. I didn't see any kids or even families during our two nights here - mostly single and group business travelers and couples. Our room was quiet and the shades kept it dark so I could sleep in. There is breakfast and coffee served in the lobby in the mornings but you do have to pay for it. Water and tea are complimentary throughout the day, self served on a table near the entrance which is nice due to the Texas heat! This hotel is also a 5 min car ride to downtown Fort Worth and Sundance Square and close to the interstates as well. There is no shuttle here but we rented a car so not a big deal for us. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay here again.We had a fantastic stay here on a venture to Live Oak to see some bands we like, and didn't want to make the long drive home.  I was initially a little annoyed at the front desk service - one poor guy alone at the time we checked in around 5 - because he was giving such individual service to each person, so I had to wait to check in when we had a show to get to!  Then I realized how incredibly patient this young man was, dealing with a language barrier by taking the extra time to show a customer around so he wouldn't get lost.  Wow.  The hotel was just fine, but that level of caring customer focus won me over immediately!  The same guy and another employee at the desk were just as perky and caring the next day as we were checking out, so it wasn't a fluke.  Wi-Fi didn't work for us, but we weren't there to work, so it wasn't a deal breaker for us.  The rooms are clean, comfy, quiet, have a new feel to them and some really nice local photography on the room walls.  We didn't do breakfast or anything there, but it was crowded and folks looked happy with it.I stayed at this hotel for 1 night for a business trip to Fort Worth. The hotel is clean and new and the front desk staff were pleasant and helpful. The room was comfortable albeit unremarkable, and I appreciated the Keurig coffee maker in the room versus the usual in-room coffee maker that makes completely undrinkable coffee. The restaurant was unimpressive and I would avoid it for anything but the breakfast buffet ($9.95). There is a full bar in the hotel. On the bright side, the wait staff were friendly and helpful.I am not sure I would stay here again.I love this hotel. The staff is very friendly, the rooms are very new smelling (odd, I know, to say this), the internet always works, and it's not too loud. It's nice that there's a Torchy's right downstairs as well. The fitness room is also very nice (Precor machines). I like to stay here over a lot of other places in Fort Worth.Good buffet breakfast reasonably priced. Problem is that the hotel does not clean the snow and ice in front of the entrance and keeps a dangerous condition to exist. I even offered to buy a shovel but 3 days later, still no action. Very disappointing for a HiltonAlways an exceptional experience. Great staff. Great location (for my needs).Awesome hotel! My coworker and I stayed here during a four day training class downtown and we were both very happy with our stay. The hotel is conveniently located right next to I-30, about a 5 minute drive (if that!) from downtown Fort Worth. The hotel is very clean and well kept, with super friendly and helpful staff. Our room (we had two queen beds and shared a room) was very clean and even the hallway smelled nice (you know... sometimes the hallway smells like smoke). They have complimentary coffee and tea all day by the check-in desk. There was plenty of parking in a free garage right across the hotel driveway. The breakfast is not free, but you can get pretty much anything other than made to order items for $4. Not bad for muffins (which were really quite good), cereal, several varieties of fruit, hardboiled eggs, juice, milk, coffee, toast, bagels, etc. And after one particularly long/stressful day, my coworker and I ordered beers at the bar and then sat over in a more "secluded" area by the fireplace and enjoyed the quiet. We even hit up the pool/hot tub one evening and were entertained by all the fun/kid stuff they had in the pool (a whale that spouted water, water flowing from pipes that could be manipulated and played with, etc). Without a doubt, I would stay at this hotel again and recommend it to anyone! Great location, friendly staff, clean and quiet hotel!I travel a lot and the best hotels for my long stays are Hilton Garden Inn because they offer everything I need (laundry room, restaurant, quiet, clean and friendly staff). This hotel was great, all the staff knew me by first name, always very friendly and in a great mood. The chefs knew how I like my dinner and always made sure I was satisfy, the bartender always remember my drink and of the rest guest. Chef Mike always made an effort to check in with the guest and make sure that their meal was good and if they needed something.  If I go back to the area, I would stay here in a heart beat. The only con is that it was build in a weird position and didn't have parking on the sides, so in order to come into the hotel after parking you had to cross the lobby. Sometimes I like to stay under the radar.Stayed here 11-14-14. Very clean well appointed room. Very quiet. Nice polite service oriented staff. Beautiful lobby with complimentary beverages. Good parking in adjacent free garage. Easy access to medical center.
review_content_20: Nice rooms and super friendly service. First time in Fort Worth and it was for my birthday so all the hotel employees signed a birthday card for me and gave me a goody bag with treats! Super super nice! Definitely recommend!Nice rooms and great customer serviceRoom was very nice.  For a newer hotel, this was great.  The king bed in the room was comfy, plenty of pillows and a very nice TV.  The hotel offers coffee and tea all day in a little bar area by the front desk.  They do have a restaurant on premise and the breakfast I had there was pretty good.  The buffet hit the spot.  If you want a little lower priced hotel that is not far from downtown, I recommend staying here!The hotel has been open since April 2012, super friendly staff at checking in and at breakfast, the rooms were very very clean and comfortable, equipped with microwave, fridge and coffeemaker, nice large flat screen TV, very comfortable bed & linen. The lobby is very nice and comfortable, breakfast was delicious! Made to order omelettes and waffles and all the other items available definitely exceeded our expectations. Shops, restaurants, popular venues are just a short drive away. One of our favorites now! Large beautiful indoor pool area and very nice gym with modern equipment, treadmills each have their own individual TV screen attached. Will definitely come back! Top Notch Property!

review_content: Super cleanA little pricy for what you getLandscaping was perfectNice employeesThe rooms were comfortableBathrooms very cleanHotel is in a good location for some posh shopping.  Room is clean and nicely decorated.  First floor rooms have a sliding glass door out to parking lot.  However, there is a loud train that goes by a couple of times a day.  Not a fan.  Also, my bed squeaks on my side.  The toilet seat is a cheap plastic and practically falls off when you sit on it.  Shower is small but water pressure is good.  Not my favorite Marriott because of the train.  Good location though for some great shopping and restaurants.  We would've stayed here longer if they were pet friendly.The Bistro is overpriced. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Initially were put in a west room on level 2. We had to change rooms the second night due to the loud noises from the train switching yard that is located behind the hotel. The drink prices at the bistro are outrageous. Expect to pay $10.00 or more per drink. Domestic bottle beer was $5.50. Double Crown and Pepsi was $23.00. Food prices are average. The hotel and room was clean and the bed was comfortable as always with Marriott.Pleasant stay for a wedding, a little pricy but I suppose it's justified.1) Prime location - close to TCU, museums, and the zoo!2) The lobby is spacious/modern and the front desk lady had great customer service - she even provided some us with some local Fort Worth history.3) The pool was nice - lots of towels, plenty of chairs and tables, and it was surprisingly cool considering how hot it is in Texas.4) The rooms were fine, there's free wifi and the bathroom was big but could've used some upgrades.6 people waiting 20 minutes and only 1 person running the front desk and servinfg at the kitchen too.  Poor lady doing everything.  Although it was during the TCU vs. KANSAS game.  They need a new Management team.Room was nice enough and clean with a good location.Not gonna lie, prolly one of the nicer Courtyards I've stayed at. For some reason, I always feel like these are dodgy hotels....but alas I have been proven wrong. Yay. The lobby area looks like it just went under some MAJOR renovations. The check in desk is sleek and the people are so friendly. The little lobby sitting area has great big couches and a flat screen with scrolling news, weather and traffic. Very handy for the out of towners that don't know there way around. You can also park your car near your room, since its only a 2 floor hotel and you can enter from many different parts. I like this. I don't need to be walking around the hotel late at night after my nightgames....errr parties...err dinner. They have a happy hour in their lounge and a complimentary breakfast every day. Now, this is a plus....they have a 24 hr convenience store right inside! No kidding!!! I think my man-piece made besties with the guy working since he was down there getting munchies at 2am both nights. Le sigh. The rooms are spacious and the bed was surprisingly comfy. The room came with a couch, mini fridge, microwave and a desk with internet connections. The bathroom was large and very clean. The only downside, which I think is common in most hotels, was the shower itself. Ugh, no water pressure, the water literally comes dripping out and trying to wash my hair was such a nightmare. Why can't hotels just man up and pressurize that shizz. It's for the better, trust. Upon checkout, I was waiting for a woman who was on the phone (I don't mind waiting) and a guy comes around the corner and goes "Oh I'm so sorry you've been waiting!" I mean borderline freakout...hilarious. I laughed and said it was no big deal, just wanted to check out. Took maybe 2 minutes and I was on my way. Well done Courtyard. Sweet dreams.The room was clean and the staff was nice but it is not my first choice when staying in Fort Worth. They do not have an elevator and thus if you are staying on the second floor you will have to carry your heavy suitcases upstairs.No free breakfasts.Let me preface this by stating that I did not stay here overnight, I came here 4 days in a row for my Kaplan NCLEX class in their meeting room. Otherwise, I'd definitely give them 5 stars. The service was friendly from the front desk staff to the coffee shop/breakfast bar service person. I really liked how they have the small breakfast restaurant inside their lobby so you could stop by for a quick breakfast before leaving (or in my case, going in). Free coffee is provided for guests. There are two computers and a printer free for everyone to use, and another computer linked to a printer to print out boarding passes for the airport. The hotel really gave us great service. Free water pitchers were provided for us every day and they gave us pens and notepads daily as well. The meeting room was clean and a staff member was on hand to assist my instructor in carrying her items and in any technical issues she had. Location-wise, it's on University and you can walk to Panera and Hoffbrau steak from the hotel. There's a shopping center less than 5 minutes away driving.One of the more poorly managed in the Marriott system. I've 80,000 points in my Marriott account, so I've had some very good experiences with Courtyard as a value play. But the housekeeping, the poor sanitation standards of the kitchen, and general management really ruins the overall nice look of the place. They seem to have way too many "chiefs and not enough indians"--at night they had one person running the whole hotel--no manager on duty, no housekeeper on duty (room was not clean), no engineer when things didn't work, no phone operator, just one person. No bell assistance, but plenty of managers go to lunch for two hours. No way to get any decent service.  And NO elevator. They just fired some of the supervisory offenders, so I may try again in the future, because they are very close to TCU campus, but a terrible representation of how any Marriott should be managed. Enough to send me back to Hilton, and I really enjoy most of my Marriott stays.Plenty nice enough if you are traveling on business. My room was clean and the lighting was great. Free wifi was a snap and the little cafe in the lobby convenient. I walked to the TCU campus to save the hassle of a cab. If ever back in the area, I would stay again.If your companies paying, go to the Hilton unless you like small gyms and the soothing sounds of freight trains in the middle of the night.Keep in mind my review is for a business trip paid for by my company with food expenses so my expectations are bit different than the regular traveler.I was here for a week long stay and booked a single king bed suite.  There are a few decent restaurants nearby as well as the TCU campus.  The lobby here has been remodeled recently and is the highlight of the complex.  It has a modern look with a lot of lounging area, a small bistro bar, and several TVs scattered around.  A cool little hangout for those that don't have time to venture out too far or just want to get out of the room for a few.  The lobby also has free to use PCs with printers, wifi access, newspapers, and a 24hr mini mart for a late night snack or those items you forgot to pack.  Past the lobby however everything steps back about 20 years.  The rooms have been touched up a bit with new decor and a couple upgrades just not the full on remodel the lobby received.  The room was clean and had all the necessities for a business traveler.  Cable TV, comfy bed, desk with chair, couch, network access, alarm clock, ample lighting, coffee pot with comp coffee, mini fridge, etc.  The bathroom was clean, spacious, and water pressure was good.  I found it difficult however to get a good sleep for two reasons.  First, the AC I found to be a tad bit loud when it cycles on and off.  However, if that doesn't wake you the nightly 2am train that rolls by will.  The train is not right next to the hotel but its close by and woke me up every night with its damn horn.  I've been told from some other coworkers that they experienced the same issue when they stayed here.  I suggest asking for a room on the side of the hotel away from the train.  For those looking to get their workout in while on travel, the gym here is 24hrs.  The equipment is fairly new with TVs, adjustable AC, towels, sanitizing items, disposable earphones, and a water cooler.  However the whole thing is tiny.  There is exactly one treadmill, one elliptical, one stationary bike, one adjustable bench, and one set of dumbells that only go from 5-50 lbs.  There's no open space either for any kind of free form exercise.  The adjustable bench is terrible with a large gap between the seat and back.  If all you do is the cardio machines you will be alright as long as no ones on your machine.  If you want to lift weights you better get creative and again hope your the only one planning on lifting.   The best thing I experienced here is the breakfast at the bistro bar.  They serve a full menu of starbucks coffee here including espresso drinks which was convenient for me.  The oatmeal with nuts and dried cranberries was also delicious.  It was a very nice and convenient way to start my morning.  The lobby also offers complimentary coffee in the morning but I prefer espresso.  If it wasn't for the train and inadequate gym, the hotel would be decent.  However, my previous trip I stayed at the Hilton for the same rate and it was much, much more luxurious and in the heart of downtown Fort Worth.Was pleasantly surprised! Nice room, pool and hot tub, continental breakfast, and really close to the zoo. I would for sure recommend.

The Rosen Inn is a wonderful bed and breakfast. Great room, good food, and warm inn keeper. Would definitely recommend to everyone.   They accommodated our dietary needs with a delicious breakfast. They left cupcakes and a bottle of wine in our room and homemade bath salts to use. The bed was warm and comfy with lots of fun antique items all throughout the house. The house is in a great location, close to lots of restaurants.Hubby and I stayed here Friday and Saturday night as we were attending a wedding in downtown Fort Worth.  Upon arrival, we were greeted by the two delightful ladies AND the most amazing chocolate chip cookies.  We also met the puppy, Chloe and the neighborhood kitty, who I dubbed Orange Kitty because I forgot his name.The house is beautifully decorated and guests have full run of the downstairs rooms, including the one with recliners and the amazing old typewriter office room!Three guest rooms are located up the creaky stairs, along with a fridge with sodas and waters, a K-cup coffee machine and snacks, including popcorn.  They thoughtfully included a microwave in this area, so it's an amazing perk.We had breakfast both days and my fave was the eggs Benedict.  Hubby doesn't eat meat, so they dressed his with spinach and tomatoes.  We ate every last bite and left two happy pandas!On Saturday evening, hubby and I visited the pool and just quietly paddled around, enjoying the unseasonably pleasant Texas weather.  Another wonderful touch is the basket of pool towels and sunscreen!Such a relaxing place, so very close to the happenings of downtown and Sundance Square.  It was about $8 for the two of us to take Uber from the YWCA to our quiet hideaway, which makes this an even greater bargain!My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary weekend.  It was beyond our expectations. Kelly was extremely welcoming and wonderful. Breakfast was amazing, and when she noticed I didn't eat because I didn't like a dish she whipped me up a new one. She made us chocolate covered strawberries which were yummy, and left us a bottle of wine in our room.  The room itself was very cozy, we had our own private bathroom, cable, and wifi.  We will be coming back for future celebrations.I enjoyed the stay it had a very comfortable bed and love the breakfast and it was very romantic with my guest.I will back hopefully soon.Very pretty B&B, nicely traditional decorations (but without a chintz overload). Comfortable room, lovely breakfast, and friendly owner/manager folks. Located in a neighborhood that's almost completely made the transition to renovated, with lots of local restaurants nearby. Very close to both museums and the stockyards. The house itself needs some updates - it's 100+ years old and some stuff is broken (faucet, latch, floors so squeaky they woke us up). So treat it as an excursion into the past and not a luxe modern hotel. But it's a fun way to stay in the midst of a very cool, non-touristy area. We'd stay again, for sure!Beautiful old home renovated to host a small number of guests.  Breakfast daily was perfect, served in the main dining room.  It was nice to chat with the few others that were staying there each day.  The one day that I had to leave early (~530am), there was a packed breakfast for me waiting outside my door!  The location is also a plus, just a 5 minute walk from lots of eats/drinks along Magnolia street.  Also, on my short jogs in the afternoons, it was easy to reach the TCU campus and the Trinity trail to sight-see.This is the quintessential bed and breakfast. The owners are sweet and go above and beyond for their guests. The location is convenient, yet tucked in a quiet neighborhood. My friend who was getting married, invited the bridesmaids to join her for breakfast the day of her wedding. The owner generously served breakfast to all of the bridesmaids, even though we didn't stay the night. Next time my husband and I are in Ft. Worth, we want to stay here!We stayed there around Christmas time and the house was all decked out for the holidays! The little touches around the room and around the house made it feel so homey and welcoming. Kelly made a wonderful breakfast! She even heard that we were looking to move to the area and she called around to help us find apartments! This was above-and-beyond kindness and we really appreciated her making us feel welcome, not only to the inn, but to the city.This was my first time staying in a B & B and I'm afraid I just wont be able to go back to hotels/motels.  Everything was top notch which has been stated in other reviews, we stayed in the Fairmont Suite and the mattress was amazing as was the bathroom.  We really enjoyed the pool and conversation with our host, we felt like we were staying with friends.  Kelly's breakfast was amazing, makes me wonder what she could do with other meals!!  We loved this place, I want to come back soon and I want to bring my friends and family.  If your in Ft. Worth then you simply have to stay here!  If you don't have a reason to be in Ft. Worth the Rosen House Inn is a really good reason to make the trip!!Fort Worth's Fairmount neighborhood has a good number of stately turn-of-the (20th) century homes, making it one of the more charming residential areas in Tarrant County. If you're not already lucky enough to live here in a home of your own, then the Rosen House Inn is the next best place to stay.This circa 1910 well-to-do home turned bed-and-breakfast has been extensively restored to something very close to its original splendor and the owners have taken great pains to create a space that very much occupies a specific place and time. The living spaces and dining areas on the ground floor have all been finished and decorated to recall its original 1900s character, while the guestrooms upstairs have been furnished to continue the historic narrative.And while all the hospitality accoutrements might be vintage, the important stuff is up to date, meaning your wi-fi, bathroom plumbing, flat screen TVs and mattresses are all up to your 21st century standards of living. Guests arriving with cars will appreciate the private parking. A pool is available for cooling off during the unbearable Texas summer months and the generous front and back porches are great for relaxing during cooler days. Reserve a stay in the Fairmount Suite if you can, its sprawling bed and cavernous bathroom are well worth whatever you'd pay for a comparable room downtown.Breakfast is served daily by the owner's mother, Deb, and chief innkeeper/owner Kelly is quick to welcome and make sure all your needs are met.To be sure, it comes with the usual old-building tics - thin walls and creaky floors - and the surrounding Fairmount neighborhood is still a few years away from being totally cleaned up. But this Inn is so well put-together, you're likely to be so taken with its restored glory you won't be paying attention to anything else.The Rosen House is a one-of-a-kind historic experience and deserves to be considered by anyone travelling through the great city of Fort Worth.Beautiful rooms, great care, and delicious breakfast. We stayed a night there. It was very comfortable, and we had much more available than expected. Breakfast was yummy eggs Benedict. The tea was great. Kelly and Deb are wonderful hostesses. We will be back. Whether they like it or not.This is a wonderful B&B. Breakfast were so good. The accommodations were very comfortable. There was a refrigerator always stocked with bottled water and assorted beverages. Great hospitality. Will stay here again!A lovely bed and breakfast.  Great location near magnolia street. Walking distance to cat city grille ( great dinner with a groupon).  The inn was extremely friendly and comfortable.  Our room was perfect.  Everything was very clean.  The breakfast was delicious.  French toast with   croissants, multiple types of syrups, potatoes and bacon...along with yogurt and fruit.  The wine in our room topped off a lovely visit...definitely would go back!This is a new B&B venture for Kelly and they seem to have started off well. Opened in December 2011, I believe Kelly said. While a little cool just yet to take a dip they have a rather nice pool which is somewhat unique for B&Bs as a whole, certainly for Fort Worth. They also offer gated parking which is a very nice alternative to street parking. Moat of the rooms have been renovated after a fire a couple of years ago, prior to Kelly's ownership I believe. Yet they've maintained the look of an historic home. Breakfast was a quite a treat - Eggs Benedict and potato hash. That was a another little surprise and a very pleasant alternative to the typical B&B fare of quiche. Magnolia St (or Ave, maybe) is about four blocks away so easily walkable. Lots of restaurants there. Also only a few blocks from Esparanza's (associated with Joe T. Garcia's - see my review on them). When Arts Goggle is going on this is a very convenient location to walk to the event. Highly recommend the place - Go support Kelly's dream!

We went here on accident and it was amazing!THIS IS THE PLACE TO DRINK IN TEXAS!We go to the Dallas Cowboys Stadium every year to see a game and it is now a tradition to stop here to drink.We are fans of tequila and their selection of  tequila is HUGE! They make their own pepper margarita (Anita Rita) that is sooooooo good!The bartenders are always well educated and extremely helpful.The bar is nice and a fun atmosphere to drink in.I guarantee the Best Margaritas in the World!Excellent BBQ Ribs and sausage!  Never expected the food to be this good.   The ribs were fall off the bone with a great smoked taste.  The baked beans were delicious with meat and sweet onions in them.  Corn was roasted and very tasty.Food is fresh & well flavored. Atmosphere is fun & as Texan as it gets. Service is hurried & curt. Would def returnA good 'ol western bar and grill right in the middle of the Stockyards. The decor is, well, look at my pictures haha.  It's very well themed.  Every third bar stool is a saddle- not much for comfort but they do make a good photo op. They have a couple fruit infused tequilas- which I highly recommend! I got a margarita with the mango infused tequila and it was delicious- not too sweet, not too tart.  And no burning tequila.  I got the pulled pork sandwich and my friend the burger- both were delicious- and the fries were perfectly cooked and seasoned.  Minus 1/2 star because the bartender wasn't really quick on the service.Great servers with real personality! Food was very good. Queso appetizer is devine! Awesome decor....worth the stop!Awesome atmosphere. Margaritas (especially the Anita Rita, which is a pepper infused margarita). Bartenders were swamped busy, but stayed on top of our drinks! Definitely recommend trying this out.An entertaining, casual spot in the Stockyards with a little store where you can purchase slngshots, sit at a bull seat at the bar, and imbibe huge drinks. Regrettably the food leaves much to be desired. The corn on the cob was overcooked and bland, the side of spinach was more like a side of ranch, and the fish was tough from overcooking. I can't get over the giant portion sizes. This is not a place to go for healthy eats. But the food is cheap here. Good for a group. Our table of seven with six ordering steak dishes, a few appetizers and drinks came out to only $280. Yay Texas prices!Had a friend from out of town come in and went to Stock exchange. Boogers was a place I have not yet ever been to so we decided to Check it out for lunch. We stood at host stand for probably over a min and was ignored by a few staff. Finally we get sat. Our server was also the bartender. She was very short with her words and not friendly at all. She made the experience not good. She wasn't busy by any means.  When the food came it was less than mediocre. I advise don't get the chicken BLT wrap. Its very dry  and tasteless. All and all it was below par.  I definitely will not go back here again.Love this place! The cheese burger & fries I ordered was delicious! My husband ordered the fried catfish and loved his too! Try the buffalo butt beer, it was so good. Loved the decor, you really new you were at the stockyards! Great atmosphere, great staff (the hostess & our waitress were both so nice & helpful.) We will absolutely be back!Great selection of beers; excellent barbecue; great atmosphereThe classic Texas atmosphere coupled with the great lunch menu definitely was a plus. Going with the Brisket Sandwich and washing it down with Fort Worth's own Buffalo Butt Beer (Amber Lager) was the perfect lunch to fuel my walk through the Fort Worth Stockyard.This is really a fun place to sit and have a drink when in the Stockyard District.  You have the campy, but cool cowboy motif including saddle barstools every third seat at the bar.  The bartenders are super friendly.  The traditional margarita is an in-depth fresh concoction.  Although some might find it expensive $9, it is large and might be the best margarita we have had from Mexico to these 48 contiguous United States.

This review is for the high tea at the Ashton.We hosted a baby shower for a friend at High Tea. It was a lovely afternoon. We had a party of 12. The staff, food and service was fantastic.The tea costs $38 and includes valet parking. It is a good value, in my opinion.You have your choice of tea, and start with a small taste of soup. A variety of finger sandwiches, veggies and deviled eggs followed. These are all small snack size portions. But you will not leave hungry! The tea ended with hot scones, shortbreads and chocolate covered strawberries. The desserts were very large!It was a lovely experience and I highly recommend it!Flew into Fort Worth for a night for business and stayed at The Ashton after finding a good deal on Expedia. Great price and absolutely loved where it was located downtown. We were greeted very warmly and given our room key, which was so unique. I fell in love with the ambiance, the friendliness and the location. The rooms were extremely clean and spacious.Bathroom is well lit and has a stand up shower. Outside you will find the prettiest stand up tub with massage options. Very romantic.The bed was extremely comfortable and the view of downtown through the window was great.Check in and check out process was easy and quick. Will definitely stay here again the next time we are in Fort Worth!Location: Smack dab in the middle of downtown Fort Worth. My wife and I were in town for the ballet at Bass Performance Hall. We were able to park our car at the hotel (valet parked it actually) and walk a block and a half to the venue. We walked to Starbucks in Sundance Square. We walked to dinner that night. We walked to breakfast the next morning. If you're like me and HATE parking in Fort Worth, this is a pretty good deal ... even at $22 (plus tips) for overnight valet parking.Facilities: Great. I don't know what else to say about them. Everything's top notch. Bed's super comfy with high quality sheets. The bathroom's elegant with flattering lighting around the mirror. It's just ... great. We didn't use any of the hotel's amenities, e.g., the gym.Staff: We dealt with two different women at the front desk and they were both delightful. Both of the valets we had were equally helpful and friendly.Price/value: The Ashton is a tad on the pricey side, due in large part to its primo location downtown. We paid $238 (including valet parking) for a small corner room on the third floor, which seemed reasonable to me.Cons: There's only one, and for me it was a pretty big one -- I couldn't sleep because of the traffic, sirens, and drunkards screaming "Wooooohoooooo!!!" every little bit outside my window. Now, this isn't exactly the Hotel's fault, so I'm hesitant to deduct a star, but the fact remains that I paid $238 for a hotel room and couldn't sleep ... which is precisely why I rented the room in the first place. I thought it would be a good idea to pay a little extra for a corner room, but what ended up happening was rumbling car engines coming from FOUR directions into my room since we were nestled between two busy streets at an intersection. The view was great, but once I turned the TV off and was ready to sleep, I laid in bed until 2:05 am when the last drunken "Wooooohooooo!!!" pierced my eardrums. I slept till a little after 5:00 am when fire and police sirens came screaming by my room -- the third time that night. By that point I was done trying to sleep, so I took my three hours of sleep and got up to take a shower. It should be noted that I'm a light sleeper and that my wife didn't have much of a complaint about noise, though she sleeps like the dead. Again, I don't know if it's fair to fault the Hotel, but if I can't sleep due to the hotel's location -- the sole purpose of a hotel room is to sleep after all, right? -- then is it really worth the price?Here's another strange con ... or maybe it's a pro? I don't know. A little after 8:00 pm we got a knock on our door. It was Hotel staff offering us two bottles of water and two cookies. It was a pro because the bottles of water stocked in the room's refrigerator were something like $6.00/ea., so it was nice to have some free water waiting for us in the morning. It was also sort of a con, too, because my wife and I were already tucked in bed (and not wearing much), watching TV, so it was kind of a pain to jump out of bed, throw on some clothes, and race to the door.Lovely boutique hotel with really spacious room and bathroom. Things I loved:1) being able to put the luggage valet in the bathroom2) water and cookies in the room. Really good cookies! 3) lighted magnifying glass in bath4) lots of plugs for electronics5) powerful hair dryer6) Awesome staff!Might be the best hotel in DFW.  It's beautifully decorated. The food is exceptionally good- try the mascarpone omelet. The bathrooms are the highlight. Great tubs and showers. All roomsHave excellent lightning, big windows. Comfortable beds. I added a picture of the gym. I had a hard time finding it. It's in the basement. Now you know. Also, restaurant is not 24/7 and hours are haphazard. Be sure to plan ahead re: food& drinks. Finally, if you need wine, walk 5 minutes to Oliver's. Descent selection also has cheeses, fruit/veggies.I loved my stay here! The hotel staff was extremely nice and professional. The rooms are HUGE, the bathrooms are large and have jacuzzi tubs. Great breakfast and quiet hallways. I will definitely stay again.Great downtown FW location. Really comfy bed and linens, delicious chocolate chip cookie's left for us in our room that night. I loved the Thames toiletries. Hotel is very quiet so if your looking for loud late night bar it is not here and we weren't so that worked out perfect. We will definitely be back.The hotel room was great. The valets were great. The front desk lady, Jazmine was TERRIBLE. She charged us 92.00 for 22.00 parking, and didn't take ownership of the problem. Instead she made it seem as an inconvenience to fix the bill. I guess she assumed because we were younger girls we would take the time to read the bill. From the moment we walked in the hotel she made us feel as if we didn't belong there. It was a special evening for the bride we were celebrating and Jazzy's attitude and customer service wasn't appreciated. Dialing the better business number next.We stayed at the Ashton last night for a bachelorette party and the rooms were great! The guest service on the other hand was not.Jasmine the front desk clerk was rude to us from check in and on. This morning when I woke up to a bill charging me 92.00 for parking instead of the actual 22.00. I called the front desk and she was rude about the mix up. The Ashton was great and so were the bell hops but I will not be returning because of the rude service we received at the front desk.We stayed in room 505 and it was spectacular. The restaurants & bars that conveniently snuggle its prime downtown location make it perfect for an upscale date night. The room was a piece of art. High ceilings towered above us in the suite and the windows peered into the downtown area; we paid the extra $19.00 a night ($219.00 total) to have a room with a view. The bathroom was very well designed with excellent tiling stepping up to the the long bathtub and back down into the heavy glass enclosed shower. Screw the chain hotels, splurge a bit & enjoy this fine one-of-a-kind boutique gem of a hotel.Nice boutique hotel with modern decor and spacious rooms. They balance the mod decor with a pair of fresh, homemade looking baked chocolate chip cookies on your bed. As someone with a major chocolate chip cookie tooth this is much, much appreciated.I've stayed here a few times and the service is typically comparable to the space. Although during one stay they actually checked me into a room that had been freshly painted. Yes, it certainly reeked as such. Low VOC paint they did not use. They first decided to try to air out the room and bring in fans before realizing blowing fumes around was not a way to actually remove the fumes. They finally moved me to another room after I complained again. Sorry, I don't want to join the hotel room death list- especially not by any misdeed on my part!The room service portions are normal size, especially compared to everywhere else I eat in Fort Worth. Serving sizes in the area are astronomical but here, I almost felt like my veggie egg white omlette was too small. It was fine, nothing spectacular. Oatmeal is pretty tasty. If you can, request a room with a tub. Something about the showers makes me dizzy. might be the tiles.A cozy boutique hotel right in the middle of downtown Ft Worth. Customer service was great, and the location worked very well. My room was not huge, but well done with a comfortable bed and spacious bathroom. Older feel, but with most modern conveniences.Very disappointing. Have been coming here since the Ashton opened and loved it. Check in this afternoon only to find it tired, bar closed, no room service and a poorly stocked mini bar.  When asked, the front desk attendant cheerily told me the bar opens tomorrow afternoon, 6 hours after I check out. Sad that this is my last stay here.Do yourself a favor; next time you are in the Fort Worth area and need to stay in a hotel, stay at the Ashton.A date night with the wife was made extra special by staying at the Ashton. After dinner down the street, we wanted to watch the second half of the Cowboys game. We went back to Ashton to sit at the bar, the tv wasn't on and there were a few people enjoying a quiet dinner. We asked the bartender (never got her name but she was great) if we could order some drinks and go sit in the lobby. She did better and told us to go sit and she would come to us for orders and serve us in the lobby. The drinks stayed full and it made for a really nice moment with some dear friends.When we returned to the room, we had fresh cookies from the hotel service team waiting for us on our pillows.Great experience and we will be back next time we are in the area.  The personal service makes all the difference in a world of corporate hotels.The Ashton is quiet, quaint, and full of top quality service. The rooms are modern but retro at the same time sporting high ceilings, large window views, and adorable tiled bathrooms.  This hotel flies a bit under the radar, but has a great location right on lower Main Street. This is a true Fort Worth gem and a must try.Stayed at The Ashton on a recent girl's trip - Highly recommend.The room - King-sized bed in a spacious room for $360/night, including breakfast the next morning. Large suite with comfortable bed, very soft bedding and feather pillows. I enjoyed a plush robe, the in-room coffee, and the complimentary iPhone/iPod dock. Free wi-fi.The hotel - Just gorgeous. Business center, including computer and printer. Fitness center (which I never saw).Breakfast - $50 for two people. The eggs benedict, fruit bowl, and OJ was wonderful.Loved the 4pm house keeping service. The bed was turned down, cookies and ice were brought in. Very nice touch!Friendly and helpful concierge & valet ($20/night for valet).If you need to stay in Forth Worth, then this is a lovely boutique hotel located in downtown. Easy access to the day/night life of Fort Worth. Very friendly staff.  The place is clean, renovated and charming.  I was here for a wedding and the food was fabulous!  It is a bit pricey but you get what you pay for. Positives: - location, service, convenience, foodNegatives- small rooms, pricey, no fitness center, no viewGreat place for an eventLocated in the heart of downtown Fort Worth, the Ashton stands out for it's elegance and beauty. This boutique hotel has been fully renovated and restored, but thankfully they retained its unique architecture. Ladies, the bathrooms are amazing. Separate shower and tubs, huge vanities and an excellent supply of bathing products. Each room is also equipped with full, fluffy robes and slippers. I was disappointed that my boyfriend didn't think to get a room with a dresser for our four-day stay, and an upgrade was not available. The Ashton over delivered when I called to inquire, quickly sending up two rolling carts (the kind with drawers you can find at BB&B) making sure we were able to fit everything needed. The customer service was impeccable.The breakfast of pastries and fruit that I ordered every morning was always delivered within ten minutes and was unbelievably fresh. The coffee was strong and delicious.  The beds were comfortable; the room was equipped with an ipod doc. I would recommend the Ashton to anyone staying in Fort Worth, it is definitely worth the price.**This review would be for SIX 10 GRILLE**Was here for dinner with my vendors for a meeting last Wednesday; party of 7. at about 645p.Place was clean and inviting.  Seated by the window.  Granted it was mid week and it was probably not busy for the remainder of thenight but there was one server.  she took our orders etc but not only did our orders come out what it seemed to be 5 years later... but the rest of the night was the same.  Refills on drinks seemed forever!Food was great though, I had the sea bass and others had the pork.. we were a simple group.  I wouldn't personally come back as there are other locations to eat at that I would think have better attention to detail and faster service...Wanted to do Fort Worth without the touristy trappings.  Chose the Ashton Hotel for its historic designation because I really like that element.  While the hotel is elegant, clean, and quiet with a great accommodating staff, there is very little of the "historic" remaining.  The only trace of historic I could find was the elevator call button.  Guess the "historic" is hiding beneath the modern design renovations. The shell remains but the details have been all but erased.  Breakfast in the Six Ten grill was very nice, and again, service was great.  Would have given 4 stars had the atmosphere been more historically preserved.
review_content_20: This formerly charming hotel in the heart of downtown Fort Worth has new owners, and a new "can't-be-bothered" ethos. We've stayed at the Ashton at least twice before, the first time for Christmas 2006, and we've recommended it to friends as an affordable gem: comfortable beds in contemporary but luxe rooms, warm and professional staff, a very good restaurant and bar, and not only pet-friendly, but pet enthusiastic. This year, we booked two rooms for three nights over the Thanksgiving weekend and it was like another place - our reservation was mixed up and the staff was only mildly interested in fixing it, the ceiling in our shower featured a rusty hinge on an HVAC trap door, not all of the lights in our room worked, and the phones only worked intermittently. I mentioned the latter problem to the front desk - "I'd like to order coffee service for the room, but the phone's not working" - and got no reaction (he directed me to the bar for help, where no one was on duty). The front desk no longer greets guests as they enter and leave - faces are trained resolutely on the computer screen - and the bellman, who's stationed right inside the front door, is far more interested in his smart phone than opening the door, even when guests' hands are full.Worse - if the restaurant hopes to attract the general public as well as its guests - the bartender had no discernible bartending experience (likely the reason the place was deserted by its discouragingly early closing time), and the one meal we had was mediocre. But I didn't get the impression that the staff didn't care so much as they were young, inexperienced, and untrained -- which means it's the owners and management who don't care. In which case they should lower the prices, and customer expectations.What a lovely hotel. It was perfect for our staycation. We had dinner at Grace across the street the first night. Breakfast at the hotel restaurant was AMAZING. Out for live music the second night and it was all walking distance. Service was impeccable and they have all the little extra that you'd expect from an upscale boutique.My wife and I booked the "Summer Stay and Save" package at The Ashton for our Anniversary after I had basically made my mind up to stay at The Adolphus in Dallas. The fact that they upgraded us to a Suite to celebrate our special occasion made the decision even easier for us. The location is perfect. We walked to a fantastic dinner at Grace which is located across the street. The room has floor to ceiling windows larger than most garage doors and the bathroom is extremely nice with a very large jacuzzi tub/shower. We have heard that the hotel's restaurant, Six 10 Grille, is excellent as well however we did not get the opportunity to try it out.  As The Ashton is located just off Sundance Square, there IS some street noise until 1ish in the a.m. but that should be expected. Upon check out, we were being charged for overnight valet parking ($17) and when I called the front desk to point out that was included with the package we purchased it was removed with no delay. We also had a fun event with the housekeeping staff when they knocked on our door while we were getting ready for dinner and when I opened the door to let them know we were "OK" right now the kind lady said "OK" back to me and then walked right in and started straightening up our room for the evening. It wasn't a big deal as we were basically ready to go and the cookies she left us were enjoyed later in the evening.Beautiful small hotel, registered on the Historical Hotels of America, prime location near Sundance Square, this is a fantastic hotel to spend a night or a weekend!We had our brunch the day after our wedding four years ago at the Ashton.  Our guests absolutely loved it!  I have been dreaming about the bananas foster French toast ever since that day!  Today we went back as an anniversary celebration.  The French toast had no taste at all, heavy on cream, but lacking in flavor.  The food was cold.  The service was slow, probably due to two young ladies sitting at the bar who got lots of service...  I hear the management has changed, obviously the chef has too.  Sigh.  Just shows: You can't go back in time  :-(Great location just a block off of Sundance Square.  It is a historic hotel that has been re-done in a nice way that is nice new and clean without taking away from its historic feel but also without making it feel old (if all that makes any sense).  I feel like sometimes historic hotels try to have old feeling furniture and stuff in the room to make sure that you don't forget that they are historic.  This hotel has nice new fixtures, and bathrooms, and free Wi-Fi, etc.  I was also impressed because the rooms were fairly roomy for a histroic hotel.The Ashton is a nice hotel, but I had much higher expectations, especially for it being "historic" and "luxery."When we arrived we asked where we shold parked and were greeted by an older door man who asked, "why are you here?" Well sir, we are checking into the hotel you work at. It didn't get much better from there, The front desk wasn't very friendly either. The room, meh. There was a water damage spot on the ceiling, ink stains on the bed, wallpaper coming up in the bathroom, hair in the bathtub and cheap toilet paper that you could see through. We should have gone to the La Quinta, at least there we could had a complimentary breakfast and saved ourselves atleast $200.A wonderful hotel.  Room, accomadations and service were all perfect.  Wonderful and extremely comfortable bedding, beautiful room, big nice bathroom.  The best hotel I've ever stayed at.

review_content: Stayed here from 1/6 - 13/2016 and loved it.  Breakfast = Great!Customer Service = Great!Special Request = Honored = Great!Late Check in = Great!Enough said!Friendly staff, very clean rooms, close to shopping and freeways for a great rate.Our stay during Thanksgiving was made much easier by the excellent service and amenities of the Hyatt Place Cityview. We didn't have to drive for breakfast, since there was a plentiful complimnetary breakfast buffet available - eggs, fruit, pancakes and donuts - something for everyone. A Walgreens and a Super Target are within easy walking distance, and allow you to grab a necessity you may have forgotten. There are many options nearby for grabbing a drink or a nice dinner, plus basic bar service right in the lobby!Thanks to the kind and attentive staff who didn't break a sweat even with multiple guests' requests at the same time. A very nice stay.Excellent breakfast and friendly staff. The room was a nice size and comfortable and clean. Our room happened to be a little too close to something outside that was extremely noisy first thing in the morning, but that means I would stay here again and just ask for a different room location.Great place to stay!This is an easy 5 star review for me. I booked here because they have free wi-fi in the room. It actually works and there is no problem getting connected. Are hotels finally getting "it" about wi-fi? The location is fabulous. It's near a lot of restaurants and other interesting spots. The room price was very reasonable and you get a fabulous room for the money. The bed and pillows were comfortable. The couch was super huge and comfortable. My son didn't even have to pull out the sleeper sofa. The shower was perfect. My only small complaint is that the soap seems really greasy and you have to take forever to rinse off the soap. They also have an exercise room and a heated pool. Their free breakfast is outstanding with a lot of choices. My favorite was the biscuit sandwich with the egg and bacon. So good!Let's talk about the staff. Courteous and on the ball. Any question that I had they answered. Need a shuttle to the airport just call 1-800-bluevan. There was one mix up where I had a couple of guys create a reservation for me to stay an extra day. All of us blew this one since I didn't read my email that they booked me for Friday night instead of Thursday night. Fortunately I double checked with the desk  before my extra night and the young lady at the desk made everything better and changed my reservation.I will be traveling to FT WORTH more often in the future and will use Hyatt Place exclusively.Friendly staff, modern rooms, huge tv!My stay here has been wonderful, for a very reasonable price.Very very good for the price. I recommend staying here to all my friends and family from out of townIncredibly impressed with this hotel. I lived about three blocks south of this location while I attended TCU, but never knew this little gem was tucked away just down the street.I stayed here overnight to prep for my bridal portraits this past week, so it was a short trip. However, it is a clean, friendly and well-appointed location with an amazing free breakfast. It's a hotel I'd stay at again and one I highly recommend to anyone traveling to the south Fort Worth area!Decent hotel, but HORRIBLE pillows.  Trot on over to Target and buy yourself a decent one - it'll be worth the 8-12 bucks.  Breakfast was tasty!  And so was the coffee!  Roomy rooms!Recommended!You know you are in good hands when you have nothing to gripe about. And that's the best review a hotel can get.Fort Worth Hotel Interior Designer Found Guilty of Killing Romance.   I am a firm believer that the architects and designers of living spaces should be sentenced to at least a year in their own creations; it would make life a lot more livable for the rest of us.   Just looking at this room, in the model or architectural rendering forms, maybe even walking through it when completed, it would seem OK, but within the first hour of occupancy its faults started showing up in a big way.    First and most important, this is Texas and an AC that may well work anywhere else, needs to be bigger here, as even after 16 hours the temperature was barely livable and the gradient from one end of the room to the other was at least 10 degrees, making all the bed clothes superfluous.    Second, the washbasin and huge mirror were almost opposite the bed and not tucked away in the bathroom, so not only was the person in the bed disturbed by necessary ablutions, but they had the bounce effect of a million candle power light in the huge mirror over the sink that was just sufficiently misaligned to be useless for anything else.       Thirdly, the little sitting area had a lighting problem to, in that the separator from the bed was not big enough and there was not a small lamp on a side table, but again a searchlight bright florescent wall sconce that lit the entire room like an emergency room. The little desk and wet bar were of course visible from the bed with their own mirror and floodlight.    Fourthly, why put bedside lights, again bright enough to degrade the picture on the huge flat screen TV, just far enough away on the wall to make you have to get out of bed to reach the switch? Please, I really want an answer to this one.    Other than that there were just the irritating little design flaws, like putting the toilet roll dispenser on a wall so thin and tight it acted like a drum head;    On the up side, and there was one, it had two ironing boards. Seriously, its fixtures were quite impressive, like a patch board for electronic devices built into the wall behind the desk, so you could logon, jack in, power up, input, out put and generally enjoy any device you had the correct cabling for. For a change the blackout curtains almost worked, just leaving a little bright stripe at the bottom.
