I think the other reviewers have coped with the pool, breakfast etc. except mentioning that they threaten 24 hour food and have a strange non-bar in the lobby where you might be able to get a beer and sit and drink it, but there are enough places within walking distance that it was not worth my trying to fathom the method.Overall I like the Hyatt Place line.  The decor is modern and stylish. The staff was reasonably friendly and helpful.  Continental breakfast is included and you can purchase additional hot plates if you like.  Coffee was good but I was bummed to find out there was no half and half available.  They did provide a good selection of fruit though.  The room is spacious and well appointed. Like one other Yelper though we noticed the musty smell which was off-putting.  It seemed like running the AC/heater unit in the window actually made it worse so it could be that they need maintenance.  We mentioned it at check-out so hopefully the staff will look into the problem.The hotel is conveniently located next to the freeway and has plentiful parking (no surprise in TX).  If I were in the area again I'd happily stay here again.Was a little apprehensive, due to the "place" designation.  I have stayed at every other type of Hyatt, however never this type.The lobby was quaint, and that's just the way it needs to be.The breakfast was better than they advertised it.The room was the perfect size, with a nice pull out sleeper for my son.  It was a little divided.  just enough to keep some privacy.Great place to stay, def. recommend.Very nice for the price. Stayed here and really liked it. Big rooms, firm bed, HDTV (though HD channels were really lacking), free WiFi. The continental breakfast is very nice and worth foregoing something in town since its free. Lots of fruit, beverages, biscuits and gravy one morning, and they have some delicious little donuts but you have to get there kinda early to get the glazed donuts. Trust me on that one, the powdered donuts suck. 3.7 stars. Great value, would definitely stay here again.Room smelled old and musty.  Yellow color scheme reminded me of Mad Men - dated.  Staff friendly and helpful.  Complimentary buffet was good but no scrambled eggs.  I asked to try another room but it smelled the same.  I won't stay there again.Had a great stay here. Not much to say (and nothing to complain about, which - in many ways - can be the mark of a great hotel.) Clean, FANTASTIC free breakfast, near lots of options for exploring Forth Worth, and reasonably priced. Would certainly make this my choice again if I'm ever in the area.Great rooms, huge 40" Plasma TV' in every room, but no washer/dryer! The continental breakfast here is pretty good, but sometimes they take the bagels off the buffet... The rooms are roomy and clean with comfortable bed, and a big family style L shaped couch. I have met the sales women here and she is dedicated to customer satisfaction, however, my company has been telling her for years the place needs washer/dryers on site.The entrance is very inviting and modern, which I found surprising for the price. We stayed the weekend of 9-11 for a charity event and needed a place to sleep so here goes: The first thing I noticed was the smell of the room. I am very sensitive to mildew like smells and this room had it. Wasn't smoky or anything...just had that "old" smell. So much so that my nose began getting stuffy. Something just wasn't right. The room was beautifully decorated, and i liked that it had a divider that separated the sleeping area from the living area. Everything was clean, sheets were scratchy (cant complain for the price though) and they had extra blankets and pillows on hand just in case. Bathrooms were clean; could be a little more thorough because I noticed some splash marks of some kind on the bathroom wall. Everything else was quiet peaceful and there is even a target within walking distance. Across the street is a dry cleaner and several places to eat. The mall is also about 3 miles away, if even that. Seems to be in a decent area of fort worth. I didn't notice anything that would keep me away from this place again. I just know to bring my air spray next time.I have mixed feelings about this hyatt place... I am a fan of the hp in general, but this is not my fave. Its not in the most "view" tiful area, as the name would imply. And it was super full when went so there were some key hiccups...... BUT the manager was so nice and helped up reprogram the lock right outside the door to the room. Breakfast was good, thank you for fresh fruit!nice place, GREAT staff.  don't get the neg reviews, maybe hyatt listened and made changes.  only thing keeping it from five stars is the loud window AC unit.  bed was VERY confortable.  will return.This hotel is absolutely amazing!  They recently renovated that place into a modern, artsy, contemporary style that just works!Our favorite part was the hotel room.  Each room contains a 42 inch flat screen TV mounted on the wall.  The room is decorated in such a way that feels more like an apartment, than a hotel.  We just relaxed on the huge couch with a glass of wine, enjoying putting our feet up on a very comfortable ottoman that comes standard with each room.Additional attributes about the room and hotel:super comfortable beddeskrefrigeratorenough sitting room to accommodate at least six guestsoutdoor poolI promise, if you stay here, you won't be disappointed!
review_content_20: Stayed here for 6 weeks due to work. The staff is AWESOME. The hotel, not so much. Almost every other night the fire alarm would go off many times. It's really fun going to work when you have 3 hours of sleep almost every night. The breakfast served has a good mix. Could be better but it is above most. The people working there really are some of the best that I have seen at any Hotel and I usually stay at 4 or 5 star Hotels. I would have given them 4 stars but if you can't fix a fire alarm from going off and it does it every other night you are lucky not to get 1 star. Almost forgot that if you want to watch the TV you better like news or sports because they only get about 14 stations and most are news or sports news stations. The ones that aren't, aren't worth watching. The rooms are nice.great accommodations, big-screen tv, comfy bed, great sitting area and simple wifi service! the pool was a little shabby considering how nice everything else was, but i still swam in it and was satisfied. the morning breakfast was good and the staff was very helpful!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express & Suites Fort Worth Downtown
review_content: We stayed two nights here for my daughter's cheerleading competition. Not a bad hotel. Nothing fancy, but nice.Pros: The free breakfast is very nice. The staff is friendly. The rooms were clean and beds were fine. Pillows soft. They have a free shuttle that will take you anywhere in a 3 miles radius. Just tip the driver. Free WiFi. Check out is not until 1200-so that's nice. Small refrigerator and microwave in the room. Cons: parking is kind of a pain. Limited parking spaces, and the parking spaces are very small! Any vehicle bigger than a 4 door car makes it difficult to park. The elevators are very small and slow... Stairs are a lot faster. I do recommend the hotel and would stay again.Everything we could ask for in a Holiday Inn and at a decent price. Jonathan checked us in and helped call a few bars to find us one with an open kitchen. He was nice and super helpful. Breakfast was solid. We were able to park our uhaul trailer on the street in front of the hotel for free, and Jonathan helped us with that as well. Overall a great experience. I'd happily stay here again.Pleasantly surprised. Free breakfast was great, free wifi was great and the hot tub was actually hot. Rooms were clean, bed was comfortable and hard and soft pillows were offered. The only negative things were the house keeper forgot to replace shampoo and floor mat one night. One caution note: doesn't seem safe to wander at night. Fortunately the hotel offers a free shuttle.I had a great stay at this location. The outside looks a little dates and the room could have higher quality linens but the staff was fantastic. Especially Bobby Bedsole and his team. It is in a good location and I would stay here again.Pros:1. Within a mile of city centre downtown and other hip walkable areas 2. Free self parking 3. Good water pressure in shower 4. Sufficient heat for shower 5. Good AC6. Comfortable bed and pillows 7. Shuttle service to and from locations within 3 miles (didn't use it though so can't say much to its dependability)8. Bath and body works products (shampoo, conditioner, and lotion)9. Responsive to fixing toilet 10. Provided extra lotion at front desk 11. Spacious room with seating area 12. Right next to gas station and highway 13. Free breakfast ( haven't tried it though)14. Fridge and microwave in room. 15. Free internetCons:1. Low water pressure for sink2. Cleanliness is a 3 out of 5. Unpleasant to see hairs in sink and shower when first got here. 3. While parking is free, there isn't much space and it is tight. Thankfully, I have a compact car. 4. Shower head hurts! Only two options and they both suck. 5. Channel selection on TV is limited. For example, only one hbo. 6. TV says HD but doesn't look HD 7. While you're downtown, no views from hotel to make you feel you are downtown. It doesn't feel like you're in a downtown hotel8. No toothpaste provided.Reasonably-priced accommodations in the heart of a city like Fort Worth are not easy to come by, especially if you neglect to make reservations until time is short.The hotel is undergoing a major renovation that includes a total interior/exterior makeover and adding floors with new rooms. The interior of my room and the existing public areas looks to be complete and is modern and stylish. One area that did not receive an upgrade was the elevators, which were a bit slow. Maybe when the new floors are put in, new elevators will be put in also.My room AC was noisy but very powerful. It was a mild summer day so I was able to turn off the AC at night and still remain comfortable.The hot breakfast was simple but enough for me. Eggs and bacon. Cold cereal, yogurt, fresh fruits and juices were also available.The desk staff were friendly, helpful and approachable. The hotel has a free shuttle service that will shuttle to any locatoin within 3 miles of the hotel, which includes sightseeing locations like the Stockyard.All in all, I enjoyed a pleasant stay and would stay here again if travelling through this area in the future.Called reservations the evening of 8/23, for checking in between 830-9am on the 24th, with a late checkout (2pm) on the 24th.Get to the hotel 8/24th checked in between 8:30-9am, was given a dirty room. came back downstairs, they apologized, said they were understaffed, so Joann checked me into another room. Went to the room to sleep. Within 30 minutes, someone opened the door, luckily i had the door latch locked. Left the hotel around 9:45am to go across the street. Then was charged for the night of the 23rd and a "no show". i called the hotel and spoke with the same woman, Joann, who checked me in on the 23rd. I explained to her the situation and she said that the manager would have to "look closer" into the charges. So I go Ashley's voicemail. Then I called corporate and they were less than helpful. So I then called the hotel back to see if I could actually speak to Ashley. Ashley was pleasant but kept asking me to prove that it was agreed that i had requested a late checkout. Asked me if I had the name of the person i made the reservation with. So she could call Reservations and ask that person if they really said that...lol. Seems like a grade school act. Is this typical Holiday Inn treatment?Stayed at this venue for IALHA Nationals as a judge. Staff Manager Lauren was one of the best, and I see minimum 2 hotels/month. She was polite with us and with OSU football team who had just taken a whuppin-challenging.Room was big enough. Bath was totally stocked, and, new towels, etc.Bed was very comfortable, even covers smelled and appeared clean.Breakfast was OK. Since we had to be at Will Rogers early, and many show staff & participants stay here, maybe start 1/2 hour earlier, so there is not such a scramble.Travel by shuttle was OK, but unfortunately, without a car, you are married to the shuttle, since there is really nothing within walking distance.Still---four stars----------------Here on a business trip. This place could be better. The AC is a wet/cold experience. I think you know what I mean when I say wet/cold. It's cold but with humidity. Just horrible. The internet is no better (198 Kilobytes per second download) but then again I shouldn't complain because it's free. The parking is free but it's not really secure. Close to the highway so it's easy for a smash and grab. The price is a bit high for what it gives.As of 10/11/13, the renovation is almost complete. The scaffolding is off the exterior and floors basement through 4 are complete. The only things left are the 5th floor and the parking garage.The rooms:I had a room with two queen beds. It was nice, newly renovated, and comfortable but on the small size as it was not an accessible room. It had all the HIE mainstays (the pillows, Bath and Body Works toiletries, etc). Like most hotels, the walls are pretty thin, but the AC fan covers most of it without being too obnoxious.Oh, and there was adequate internet! The speed was adequate at 4:00pm and at 9:00pm. No issues! The grounds:I enjoyed the fitness room. It has two treadmills, two ellipticals, an exercise bike and weights. However, the Cardio Theaters on the treadmills didn't work. They worked on the ellipticals though. There is one large television in there. One night, some thoughtless idiot turned on THE O'REILY FACTOR. I had to suffer through that for 30 minutes, until she finally left. There should really be a posted rule about not turning on inflammatory television programs in the fitness room on the big tv.The lobby was nice (see photos) and filled with the smell of Otis Spunkmeyer cookies every afternoon. However, parking in the overflow lot across the street wasn't convenient. I wasn't fond of jay-walking across Lancaster in the mornings.Service:Everyone I encountered was extremely friendly and helpful, from check in to check out. They acknowledged my high IHG status and told me about a point promotion I wasn't aware of. All in all, I will stay here again next time I'm in Fort Worth.This location is different from the typical Holiday Inn Express buildings that we've all seen scattered at various points along a freeway. It's an older building, which looks like it was originally a different hotel. It's also right next to a gas station, the properties almost seem connected. Pros:*Friendly staff*Good free breakfast*Clean & comfortable bed & towels*Granite countertops in bathroom*In-room movies availableCons:*Small bathroom*Not a very good shower head - two settings, either stinging water or a stream like a hose*Difficult & limited parking (apparently this is currently being renovated)I would stay at this location again, and I look forward to seeing the parking situation improveWe recently stayed at this hotel for five days. On Wednesday, September 9th, I experienced a terrible fall in their parking lot which was inadequately lighted. I immediately reported it to the staff but did not seek medical attention once I ascertained that no bones were broken. However, the fall was so painful that for several nights I woke up in the middle of the night and had to take more Advil. Of course, my entire right side was badly bruised. Thursday morning I spoke with the manager, Ashlee Heldt, and asked that something be done to correct the situation. She said that the lights were on timers and I told her that I thought they needed to be on 24/7 since the day that I fell was a cloudy day. The next day when we came back to the hotel, the lights were off again and the place where I fell was very dark. I confronted her about it the next morning and she would not agree to do anything about it. I believe that this lack of action is utterly outrageous and irresponsible. One of these days, if not corrected, someone is going to suffer a life-altering injury.Stayed September 2015, traveled as a coupleLoved this place. It's not the cheapest, but the location is awesome. On top of that, you have a nice, big, clean room with luxurious amenities. The tv has double the channels as your average hotel. The sheets are clean, the pillows are comfy, and the bathroom will exceed your expectations. On top of all that, the view is fabulous!I checked into the Hotel for a five day trade show in the area. The room was not available at the time so I left my luggage with the front desk. Upon my return that evening I find out the Hotel gave my luggage to another guest leaving the country.Initially I was told it was given to a group of international travelers from Panama and they were trying to get a hold of them and left messages but there was a language barrier. Over one month later, I am told they made every attempt to contact the guests but the international number they have on record is not a correct number. And now they report the guests were flying to Portugal and could not understand how the luggage could have made it to Brazil...The Ft. Worth Hotel has done everything to try to sweep this under the rug. They were unresponsive to my emails and calls to where I was forced to call the corporate office. The corporate office was little or no help as they would only place me on hold to call the Ft. Worth location to prompt some response from the Hotel. It took 4 weeks for a response from the Hotel with their nominal attempt to resolve the situation. The resolution was minimal and unsatisfactory.My suggestion if you are ever in this situation with this Location is do not leave the premises until your situation is resolved to your satisfaction.If I could give them 3.5 stars I would,,this was a nice hotel,very clean but a little outdated for the price.Service was okay,nothing to brag about.I was told I would have to park across the street and on the second floor of the garage because they were busy.Fortunately I listened to my wife and checked their lot and found plenty of convenient parking available.We were happy with our valentine stay and it was very convenient to Embargo where we partied that night.But the rooms were the same price as our luxury hotel on the riverwalk in San Antonio,,and in Ft Worth our view was off the rooftop ac units and the freeway..I didn't stay here but my friend and her family did. They really liked the hotel. The lobby is very nice and updated. Very trendy. There room was the same. It also had a fridge to keep some food.One thing I was able to experience was they backed some cookies! They really hit the spot after a long morning of shopping!Great location and their shuttle will take you to the stockyard. Or anywhere within one mile. Parking was sparse but it didn't seem to bother the guest.It wouldn't be my first pick, but since I was in town just for the night, the rate, proximity to my work event, and great reviews were enough to allow me to book it on Hotels.com. Parking is free (and some of it is covered), they have fitness room, a very small indoor pool, complimentary breakfast ... and the rooms are equipped with a mini fridge, blowdryer. The few things I didn't like about the place was the seriously bad lighting (even for hotel standards) and the loud fans in the restrooms; there wasn't a separate switch in the RR, so as I did my makeup, the LOUD fan irritated the hell out of me.The good:- clean, modern and safe- priority club welcome + upgrade to suite- fast internet- breakfast area spacious and clean- microwave, freezer, large HD, coffee machine, hair drier, ironing board- nice fitness room- friendly staff- one morning I was late for breakfast and the lady prepared a plate for me.The bad:- standard HIE - quite priceyThis is an atrocious hotel. Awful staff, paper thin walls, expired food at the breakfast, double charge on my card for the room. A nightmare.Good location, friendly people, good price. We ended up checking out one night early and they did not charge us for the extra night. Location is convenient and the hotel it's self is nice, could use some more parking and faster elevators, but no big deal. Beds are a little hard but good view of downtown Fort Worth. I would recommend it.
review_content_20: I had reservations about staying here as I really one choose it because of the low cost. I can say I was impressed in almost every way!  Extremely friendly staff that genuinely seemed to want to help. The room was nice and the only issue was that the ac and the bathroom fan are loud, but really if that is the only issue, it is a win. The free shuttle is what set this over the top. Super friendly and helpful in every way. Went well beyond the normal service level I have been accustomed to. Free and ample parking is a nice bonus as well!I travel to a lot of small towns so I frequent the Holiday Inn brand.   I am starting to see where most of the HI Express hotels are nicer and newer then the Holiday Inn's.  This hotel is no exception.  The lobby had great decor, great breakfast and business areas and a store.  The rooms were very nice and the beds were comfy.  The location was also great for all the places we wanted to visit in the area.Not impressed with the staff.  I know friendly customer service isn't that hard and they need to work on it.  The elevators were INCREDIBLY slow and twice we had staff take over an elevator in front of us, instead of letting us have it first.  I guess they don't have a service elevator?  The walls in the rooms are very thin so any outside noise is super loud.  I'm glad we had to be up early because I would not have been able to sleep late due to the screaming kid next door.  Parking was also tricky.  We got back to the hotel at 12-1am and there was only one spot left.  Overall the good and bad aspects made me feel like this place was just a "maybe" if I was thinking of places to stay in Ft. Worth.I was only here one night while visiting FtWorth but it's worth reviewing simply because tehy accomodated four of us in one room. Ok, so maybe they didnt realize tehre WERE four of us...but the fact that we could all fit in a regular room was pretty neato. Two on the giant bed, and two on teh queen mattress we blew up and put on the floor. I'm sure we violated soem fire code since couches and such we wedged every which way elsewhere, but we all got a good nights sleep.Props to covered parking, overall cleanliness, and a free hot breakfast. The coffee was good, and they had eggs, breakfast meats, and fruit for us non-cereal/oatmeal/pastry paleo freaks. The highlight of this experience was hearing Pitbulls' "Hotel Room Service" on the way home and signing along, "Ho-tel, Mo-tel, Holiday nn (EXPRESS!)"My wife and I spent the night here while visiting Fort Worth for the weekend.  We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel.  It looks like Holiday Inn is really updating their appearance.  The lobby was very nice, they offer a free hot and cold breakfast and they also have free wi-fi.The room we stayed in was a King Suite and it was very spacious, it had a king size bed, sitting area with a sofa bed, desk and a large LCD TV.This hotel also has an indoor pool and fitness center, although we did not use those facilities.  Overall this is a very nice hotel and I would stay there again.  FYI:  The beds are very hard.As far as HIE properties go, I've definitely experienced better.The parking situation was tight - there isn't much to start with, and if you get back to the hotel late, you are likely to miss out on getting a spot. The elevators are very slow. There are two elevators, but during checkout, they were constantly filled with house keeping carts, towels carts, maintenance carts, etc. I waited over 10 minutes to get an elevator on one trip up to our room.The shower water had a distinct "fish tank" odor coming from our shower water. I don't know what else to call it....algae maybe? But it was stank! And then there was the fact that the shower curtain didn't contain the water. It was literally pouring out onto the floor no matter how we positioned the curtain.The breakfast area was extremely busy. In general, it was just a busy, overworked property.They didn't do any of the "little" touches that I expect from a thoughtful HIE (which we have stayed at many that do these things).Clean, modern and a free breakfast... not much to complain about here. Stayed at the hotel for a quick weekend getaway from Austin and was pleasantly surprised. Centrally located, basic but nice gym and a clean pool/spa.I stayed there for 7 days last February. The hotel is OK, my room was clean, spacious and well equipped (microwave, freezer, large HD screen, coffee / tea machine, hair drier, etc.). The check in didn't take too much time, and check out was extremely fast, as I just had to sign the invoice that was dropped in my room the morning I left. This hotel has a 24/7 fitness room with running and biking machine, and a small swimming pool with a spa. Breakfast and Internet connection are complimentary and both of good quality.The only "cons" is that the hotel is quite far from Fort Worth Downtown (30minutes to go by foot) which can be annoying if you don't have a car. In a few words, not excellent, but not bad at all either.I stayed here for 3 nights after staying 1 night at the Embassy Suites in downtown. This hotel is a lot cheaper than Embassy, but still pricey considering it is not city center. The staff was friendly and the hotel was well kept. If the hotel was a little cheaper I would recommend staying here, but if you have the money I'd say you are better off staying more in the downtown area where you can walk to all the shops and restaurants.My first stay at Holiday Inn Express, my flight arrived at 5:00 a.m. the staff was really wonderful about getting us into a room early.  I was here for a training and stayed for three nights all were pleasant.  Nicely appointed rooms and common areas.Great remodeling recently done. I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived. Staff was friendly and was knowledgeable about the area. The rooms were very clean, spacious, and free internet! Lots of complementary toiletries, plus a nice selection of items downstairs just in case you forgot something. Very nice lounge area and wide variety of items for breakfast. Rooms had new coffeemakers and fridges.

review_content: I needed to find a place to have a large group dinner and Leah was so helpful. I had a group of 40 plus and we ended up renting the banquet room and bar/patio area. I opted for some appetizers and a cocktail hour followed by a buffet dinner. The food was good and the girls serving us were great. Plates and glasses/bottles were constantly being picked up. My only complaint was how long it took to finally close out our bill. I would recommend it if you've got out of town guests and want the authentic Texas feel.I loved this place! The room was spacious and clean and the staff was extremely helpful. We were originally booked in a room that opened into the atrium but once we got in found it just kind of boring. We called the front desk and they gladly switched us to another room facing right down into the street where we could watch the cattle drive and nightlife. The adjoining bar and restaurant are awesome!  The valet and bellhops were some of the most helpful I've ever seen, I'd gladly return.We had a great stay at the Stockyards Hotel.  We chose the Geronimo room and boy did we love it.  The decor was authentic Texas and the service great.  Its proximity to the attractions makes everything walkable and part of the charm.  It is close to restaurants, the Historic District, and shopping.  We only wish we weren't just driving through as a few more days here would have been great!The first time we stayed here we had a great experience.  This time....not so much.  My nieces room had a leak in the bathroom ceiling (room 214) from the time they checked in.  They reported the problem that day.  A maint main came to fix it the next morning, but whatever he did, it did not work.  So the kids had to listen to the constant dripping all weekend.  Told they couldn't change rooms because there were only king rooms left and they needed two beds.  So by Sunday morning even the carpet was wet.  Management said they would take care of the problem and never did.  They said they wouldn't charge for the room but still did.  To add insult to injury, the girls had a $50 lottery ticket go mysteriously missing Sunday.  In my room, I forgot my flatiron, an expensive one.  When I called to ask to have it shipped to me I was told housekeeping didn't come across it.  I know for a fact it I left it in there. So someone in housekeeping is not honest.Very disappointed in this stay considering we had such a good first experience.  After these experiences, we would not stay here again.Great location.....across the street from White Elephant Saloon. The historic hotel has a Texan theme throughout the building. The Texan Suite includes a king size bed, a separate living area, two restrooms, and masculine furniture, shutters over the windows, two televisions, and two entrances to the suite.Charming hotel. Perfect location! Staff was exceptionally helpful and nice. Not too spendy. We would stay again if we are in the area.ROACHES!!!!!  Do I need to say anything else?!  See posted pic.I didn't stay the night, but I spent several hours here with some friends who did.  Even though was I wasn't staying overnight, I was still able to valet with the hotel ($9 for non-overnight, $13 for overnight).   We about 7 girls up in the Geronimo suite for a mini bridal shower/bach party.   The room itself was a great size - two double beds, a pull out couch, and the toilet/shower was separate from the sink vanity.  We appreciated this so we could all get ready without being squeezed into a tiny bathroom!   The room could easily and comfortably sleep 6.  The hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful.  We forgot a wine opener and we were able to just take the bottles down to the bar and they opened them for us.   The bellman also offered filled our coolers with ice.  What a guy!The hotel was lively with guests both in the restaurant and the lobby.  This place is in a great location and you can walk to everything.    I left the hotel around 10:00pm and valet was a breeze.   Great time here, and I will for sure be back to spend the night!Loved this historic old cowboy hotel nestled in the old cowboy town of Stockyards Fort Worth. I was so annoyed that I didn't bring my entire cowgirl wardrobe, as everywhere you look there are guys decked out in full garb as are some of the ladies. The hotel is an old 3 story building with great comfortable huge beds and is kept very clean. Nicely decorated. Well worth the visit. Downstairs is the H3 Restaurant where my husband who is 57 had the best ribs of his life. Also go to the downstairs bar and sit on one if the saddle barstools! Loved itFirst! You gott'a remember how old this hotel is.......that said; friendly staff at front desk.  Upon arrival it is a fight to get bell service and parking place on street.  Ended up handling bags myself car to lobby and lobby to room (checking out,too).  Valet parking area is a good ways away so plan on a wait to get vehicle.  We stayed in Bonnie & Clyde suite......on 3rd floor corner of Main and Exchange; right over party district.  Just saying!  If you are looking for good nights sleep on Friday or Saturday night bring ear plugs, good drugs and eye cover!  Or get another room on backside of hotel.If you are early riser forget any coffee service or room service.  Restaurant only open for breakfast on weekends; and does not open till 9 a.m.!  First morning I came down looking for coffee; front desk rang restaurant to refill self service, no answer.  So I was told "just go through double doors toward kitchen someone will be there..."  REALLY!Place is clean; to include room.  However, it was old time period tub/shower with 3 or 4 nobs just to get shower to work.....my wife gave up and just took a tub bath, each night.In the end I wish I had known there was a Hyatt Place 2 blocks away......newer, less street noise and same price points.....Bonnie at the front desk is the best! I found myself stranded in the Stockyards area and she helped me figure out what to do even though I wasn't a guest at Stockyards Hotel - she made me feel like a guest anyway.  Basically what happened is the Uber-like cab driver that the hotel I was actually staying at near DFW recommended, hiked up the fare to an outrageous amount that I am too embarrassed to post when he dropped me off and I was just too shocked to defend my wallet. Let's just say it was three times what I was expecting and although the Stockyards are definitely a point of interest I decided it just wasn't worth paying anywhere close to that again and I didn't know my options on how to return so I felt overwhelmed and stranded. I know, I know - dumb traveler mistake to not ask the price up front. Lesson learned. So let's get back to how awesome Stockyards Hotel is. Bonnie came up with some transportation ideas and said not to worry, she would look up some information and I could come back after the rodeo. So I was free to enjoy the show with peace of mind that things would work out. I returned to Stockyards Hotel and Bonnie found me a great option on the Super Shuttle, let me use the phone and provided me with pen and paper for my reservation, the address to the hotel, etc. She thought of everything!  Then when I got off the phone she offered for me to wait safely inside the hotel lobby, pointed out the restroom and set me up in a nice comfy chair with some tea. I have heard about legendary hospitality in this area but I was so pleased with the kindness and customer service I received at the Stockyards Hotel that I will definitely be coming back again - this time as a true guest at this pleasant hotel.This is a great Historic hotel right in the heart of the stockyards.  The "Celebrity Room" is an amazing place to stay in.  It has two bathrooms, a parlor, and a private patio with the required hot tub as well.  The staff was extremely friendly and polite.  They were able to meet our every need.  There is no real parking lot for the hotel though.  Valet is offered at $15/day, there is free parking lots and on the street, and there are some pay lots for $5/day.  That's the only downside of the hotel, but to be honest, if you're staying here its just worth it to pay the valet expense.  Plenty of history surrounding the hotel that fascinated me.  Bonnie & Clyde stayed here amongst others.   Also, the lobby is attached to (personal opinion interjected right......now) one of the best and probably top ten of my restaurants the H3 Ranch.Yuk!We chose this hotel because it was old and we wanted a hotel with that old west charm.   There is nothing charming about this hotel.  Upon arriving we were looking for the parking lot and could not find it so we call ed the front desk and were Told that they only had valet parking and it costs 15.00 a day!  We got to our room... We were shocked!  The room was in the shape of a triangle, had six windows three overlooked a wall of air conditioners the other three had a view of a fire escape and a roof.  The rooms had no refers. No coffee makers. The bathroom was SO dark a candle would have had more light!  We love old hotels but this place needs some serious help.  We were going to stay four nights but left the next day... At and additional charge of 50.00 for and early departure.  We went to the Hyatt and had a wonderful rest of our vacation.First of all, the staff is unfailingly nice, the rooms were comfortable and the hotel itself is very pretty. BUT, it is LOUD if you get a room facing the street. I don't mean a little loud, with a few bumps or some background noise. I mean people screaming, laughing, at least 2 live bands, motorcycles revving constantly--noise so loud it drowns out the TV in your room. I read the reviews and saw other people complain about the noise. PLEASE BELIEVE THE REVIEWS! Saturday night was the worst and then Sunday--beautiful silence. I guess everyone was still hungover from Saturday. Unfortunately, the AC was out that night so my room was a toasty 80 degrees. Monday was not as loud as Saturday but the live bands were back. (The hotel was full and I was there with others or I would have stayed in a different place.)The only other downside was that the rooms were dark. Even with every light on, it was dim at best. The bathroom is especially dark. Luckily I was there alone so I could leave the door open and get some of the light from the dressing area.  If you're a partier and you're going to be out late anyway, you shouldn't have a problem. It would be a blast to stay here and just walk around the Stockyards area. Billy Bob's is close and so are a lot of great restaurants and shops. I'd certainly go back and just make sure I got a room in the back (although someone in my party did have a nice quiet room--with a view of the AC unit!)Pay for the valet parking (just factor the $15 in to the room charge). The Stockyards area was crazy crowded on a Saturday afternoon and it wasn't worth trying to find parking and then schlepping our bags through the crowds. Overall I'm kind of ambivalent. The staff was great and the room was comfy and it's in a great location. Just wish there was more light and it was a lot quieter.Extremely hospitable staff and a great location. Easy walk to good food and boss bars. Rooms were clean and comfortable. This was our first time to Fort Worth and we really enjoyed the area. If we stay in Fort Worth again, we're certainly staying here again. Had a great meal at the hotel H3 steakhouse. Flaming tenderloin and the steak with the mop sauce were perfect.Old school kind of place. Big, but awkwardly shaped rooms. Not great in terms of parking -- the Hyatt Place is better with its own lot. Still, an interesting experience. Heard rumors that it's haunted.I loved the hotel and the staff was GREAT!!! We got married there this weekend. August 7th 2010. It was HOT but the reception room was cooled down well enough for when we came in to eat! The food was GREAT and the drinks were too! The street and hallway noise was a little rough which is why i gave 4 stars!! I will be using a diff side of the hotel for later uses!!! It was loud loud loud!!! Wish I could've slept longer.

Is it the newest....no. Is it the the nicest.....no. But if you need a place to stay downtown without breaking the budget, this is it. We stayed on a Saturday night before the NASCAR race, clean rooms, hot shower, no problems. After reading other reviews we were a bit nervous, but the guy at the desk was nice, even after dealing with a lady who cussed him out because SHE couldn't find her room. A little old and out dated, but for the money ($80/room) you can't go wrong, especially, considering you are right across the street from the Fort Worth convention center and every where else is $150-200/ night.  A short 5-10 minute walk from lots of bars and restaurants and only 15 minute cab ride to the historic Stockyards. Parking is a little tight and tricky, but hey, your in downtown so it's better than parking on the street.Where do I start...-Arrived and none of the light switches worked, went back to front desk and had them come up and get them to work.  None of them were plugged in and it was night time. -Sheets had stains and so did all towels.  -Although it was no smoking there were cigarette ashes in the top drawer of the night stand.  -Coffee  pot was disgusting and so was fridge.  -Water leaked from tub 24 hours a day and the tub was stained.  -Shower curtain was gross and rings were missing. - Pillow sham had a LARGE  crusty stain that looked exactly like what you can imagine it was.  -Had cool air on and returned to room being 90 degrees mid day and reported it.  Was told it was switched to heat for everyone because it was going to be 30 degrees.  It was not ever close to 30 degrees and had no air movement in our room ever again unless we wanted all heat.  Was told it would cost $90,000 to fix the building issue that causes this.-Phone in room did NOT work and front desk told us that none of them do.Despite all this the staff were courteous, kind, and did help us where they could.  Location was great and convenient.  Price was decent.  If you don't mind yucky sanitation issues and a bit of uncomfortable things that might occur at a motel then go right ahead and book at this place.This Motel not Hotel is not only unsafe but also comes with great deal of unprofessionalism. The way of dealing with client concerns is to call police. Problems* Towed our rental car after paying $45 for parking in their parking lot. Pictures & Video In possession for proof. *Hotel will not take ownership of mistake and blamed next door business. *will not credit $300 for towing.*Place is dirty.*The pool belongs to the dentist next door and hotel guest are not allowed to use as advertised. *Roaches and grasshoppers in motel room. *Staff said they are new and don't know how to clean??  Please be careful if you stay at this place especially if you park in their parking spaces. Motel runs with kids that have not learned how to deal with problems & do not understand customer service. Please check your bed for bedbugs and other insects that can be bad for your health since this place is not cleaned at all. We would had made a change but other hotels had no vacancies since city was hosting 2 conventions that week. This place is across the street from the convention center in beautiful downtown Fort Worth and it's a shame as it does not match the rest of the city.This is a low-grade quality motel that tries to sell itself as a hotel with four-star prices. This is the biggest dump of a "hotel" I have ever stayed in. As far as motels go though it's average but as its trying to be a hotel, I'm gonna grade it on the scale of hotels. Bed had light stains, noise cancellation is non-existant (I could hear the cleaning lady sweep the walkway today), and they charge $15 to park in a basement which looks like a scene of your future death from an ax murderer. You're right in the square which is why I'm even writting a one star review (b/c they dont even deserve that otherwise), but what I'm trying to say is spend $20 more to stay in any other hotel b/c this is such a waste of anything you spend.Well, this hotel is a shithole. I gave it 2 stars because the staff is friendly and accommodating. It's actually a motel. The pool was closed in the middle of may (not sure we would have used it anyway). My nonsmoking room smelled like someone had smoked in it for 10 years and then quit last month. It was relatively cheap for the location. If you're only planning on sleeping here it might work for you. Keep any nice clothing in a garment bag or your suitcase to avoid it taking on the smoke smell. I did not have a noise issue as some others have mentioned. I was on the opposite side of the building and on the 4th floor, which may have helped. Overall I would not stay here again.DO NOT STAY HERE!!! Luckily it was right downtown Fort Worth so I could walk to the bars and drink as much as I could before I had to stumble back to this 1960's hell hole that they called a hotel.The AC was off so my room was 80+ degrees. Very very outdated. refused to sleep under the blankets or take a shower. Extra $15 for parking. NEGATIVE 5 STARSThis hotel serves it's purpose. It's walking distance from all the bars downtown and is way better than a DWI! My friends and I have shared rooms here a couple times and it's fine. It's not luxury or modern, could definitely use some updating, but for a place to crash it was okay.Probably the dirtiest, most outdated hotel I've ever stayed at. I didn't even want to use the shower here. It's good if you only care about location; it's very close to Sundance Square and downtown. However the dive bar downstairs is VERY loud and bands play until 2am. This place wasn't restful at all.This was by far, the absolute worst "hotel" experience we've ever had in our entire lives. I apologize in advance for ragey all-caps. Literally 20 minutes in, I was checking to see if there were any other rooms in the area, but everything was booked up because it was a trade show.PRO:Check-in & out was fast and the staff is friendlyCONS:OLD & DISGUSTINGBathroom was like a PUBLIC BATHROOM. Meaning, it was literally a toilet straight out a public bathroom. Big pipes in the back with the huge lever and NO toilet seat cover. The toilets in the convention center were less disgusting!!Towels had HOLES in them!Roach motel. Yup, I found a big, fat cockroach our first dayNo Wi-Fi in the room, which is just great when you're on a BUSINESS TRIP! By the end, I didn't give a crap that this was down the street from the convention center. Yes, it was super convenient to walk 1 minute and be at our booth, but my god it was not worth it. We didn't sleep the entire trip and I honestly think it affected our business. I'm not exaggerating, I looked and felt like sh*t and this is a trade show where you need to be ON all the time.DO NOT STAY HERE. You won't even save very much money! This place makes Motel 6 look like the Ritz-Carlton.Nothing.  We walked out of this hotel.  Our reservation and room we we're given was occupied.  We walked in on someone's room.  Then apologized to me and moved us to a smaller room.  We pre-ordered a Suite, but were given a tiny 2 twin bed room.  We complained again and then we were moved to a larger Room.  1 bed and futon.  TV didn't work. Pool was closed, due to owner sold the property, but not the pool.  Huh..?  WiFi Sucked.  Found used razor in bathub.  We left.  When Momma's not happy, Nobody is happy.I really wish I would have read Yelp before staying here. The first room the TV did not work. So they moved us and then the AC did not work in the second room. It was so dirty I almost did not want to sleep in the bed. I asked for change to get drinks from the vending machine and they told me they do not have any change. The bath tubs were dirty, the floor in the bathrooms were also dirty and heated for some strange reason. Do your self a favor and pay a little more and get a different hotel.This hotel blows. No ac, awful service. Don't stay here. If I could jump off the balcony and get my money back I would.Horrible hotel, very dirty, out of date furnishing, cockroaches every where. Bedding made of burlap, and smells like goat cheese. Really low thread count towels. Also has the toilet paper of a cheesy truck stop, bring moisturizer for after you wipe. Will never go back again, especially for the over priced rooms. If I wanted to stay at a motel 6 I would of booked one, instead of a hotel in Downtown Fort Worth where some expectations of higher class hotels should be meet. I guess there's a reason they leave the lights on for you, to keep the roaches away when you walk in.This hotel is absolutely disgusting!!!!nice staff but I needed a detox by the time I left!Old.  Staff is very nice, but the hotel itself is extremely old and needs serious updating.  Beds are horrible and lord only knows how long those mattresses have been in those rooms.  I was there for a convention which the convention center is right across the street, so it was extremely convenient, but the restaurant and bar were not capable of handling convention mass business either.  Sad with some updating it could be a great place!

We were fortunate to be visiting downtown Ft. Worth on a warm January weekend. We stayed at the Marriott Blackstone and it enhanced our experience. We had a corner room on the 15th floor overlooking downtown, the square and courthouse, it was fabulous. The hotel seems classily old with a historic feeling.  The staff at the front desk were friendly and welcoming. Yes it's a drag to have to pay to valet park, but we accepted that it comes with the territory of staying downtown.  The valet drivers were prompt with getting our car. Breakfast is not included but the hotel is attached to The Corner Bakery and they have a good breakfast. The hotel has a pool, it's super small.  The location of the hotel is perfect. We were in town for an event at the convention center, a quick walk away. For the rest of the time we enjoyed seeing the sights downtown, shopping, and trying a couple new restaurants. It was a wonderful weekend and a great downtown area.Nice large room. Clean place, has been modernized thoroughly. Historic building in a great location. The parking is strange, but I suppose they can't do much about being landlocked from 100 years ago. Everyone was friendly and helpful. I enjoyed the Corner Bakery that was on the corner, accessible by the hotel. They do charge an additional $25 per every vehicle. My wife and I had to meet there, so on top of the premium price, we had an extra $50 charge. If you don't mind the price and odd parking situation, recommended.Not a bad hotel for the price and location. There is a parking garage with a valet only option (watch them put your car on the car elevator!). The hotel is walking distance to most anything in downtown Fort Worth. The rooms are spacious and well furnished.Only complaint is the loud noises that the elevators make at all hours of the night.In for the week and Bf is sick. It will be nice to rest up. The room is fine. We did get to doubles so that's ok since he is sick he he. Nice computer area and extra plug ins. Just wish tv had a few more options since we r holed up in here. Does have HBO tho so that's good. Nearby is the AMC movie theatre and lots of restaurants in walking distance. We remember going to a few of these last time here. Downstairs cafe & bakery good thru the hotel here. Got some arugula last nite for my coffee in the morning! Yum. Nice remodel.Fantastic location in the heart of Ft Worth downtown. Very close to all the steakhouses, the sundance square and the bars.  Parking is an issue, but the valet will help you.This Courtyard does not have a concierge / executive level. Nor does it provide the free breakfast that is standard with other Courtyards.  The wifi is free tho.The rooms are large, but it does look dated. The beds are great but the TV is tiny because the room is large.  Overall, a great place to stay in Ft.Worth due to its proximity to everything. I moved from another hotel to this hotel because of its location to all the restaurants.  If you've been to Ft.Worth downtown,  you will appreciate the fact that you do not have to get into a car and go somewhere. The lack of parking in the down town area is a major pita.We LOVE this hotel...Historic building which has been remodeled and completely modernized.  My favorite part of the hotel are the patio rooms at the corners.  It's so lovely to be in the heart of the City, near Sundance Square, and be able to go outside in the evenings, look at the lights, have a cigar with a glass or wine, or just sit outdoors and talk.  Where else can you do that in Fort Worth?  The fact that it's a Marriott hotel also allows you to use your points to stay.  They have a very nice bar in the lobby, and the indoor parking is interesting to say the least.  Who knew there were elevators for cars?  Also, Mallory and Renee take such excellent care of their guests!  If you get hungry it's attached to a Corner Bakery restaurant, which is awfully convenient.  I think you'll be most pleased with your stay here...we always have!Pros:- Location, location, location! It's located right on Sundance Square which makes it convenient for everything in the area and within walking distance of all the best restaurants!- A fun semi-retro decor. The hotel is historic but has been updated and modernized for a pretty cool atmosphere.- Corner Bakery is on the lower level of this hotel. And Corner Bakery is awesome. I do so love their muffins:)- The beds are pretty comfy... And that's important!Cons: -  Valet sucks. No, actually valet REALLY sucks. Just before you check out be sure to call down and notify them to get your car ready... Because they are slow (not really the fault of the workers -- but the garage is operated on an elevator system) and you will wait a while for your vehicle to be returned to you-- especially on a weekend at checkout. - To park at the hotel, it's $25 per day! - The hotel is old and, therefore, it's noisy. There is a lot of street noise, the walls are not insulated well, and you hear city noises all night long. I did not sleep well here - and I was 10 floors from the street level. If you are a light sleeper you may struggle.Overall, I would recommend this place and I would be willing to stay here again in large part due to the awesome location.Ok hotel, deceptive advertising.Called here, made a reservation. Upon check-in, the very nice attendant mentioned the pool on 5th.The site advertised the pool as did the person who took our reservation over the phone.However, the pool is out of order. Go somewhere that has a pool if you can't get free parking from a hotel downtown. Don't go here. Who goes on vaca to a hotel with no pool?Nobody, that's why we were deceived.Free wifi is slow unless you pay for a boost.This is a really cool hotel, situated right next to Sundance Square at a fantastic location close to many attractions in Fort Worth. We've had upper floor rooms and always enjoyed them (on our two stays). The staff are friendly, and they have a small bar in the lobby as well as an attached coffee shop. If you're checking out at a busy time, it might take 15 minutes or so to get your car (it's an elevator system to get the cars into the small main garage areas, and with two elevtaors only it can take a while), so word of advice: call them first. If you do happen to be waiting, they do provide you with complimentary bottles of water, while they do their best to get your car out asap. I highly recommend this hotel!My husband and I stayed here one night to celebrate my birthday and will never stay here again. After leaving the hotel we soon realized that the front bumper of my car had been significantly damaged. My husband called the garage and was told they would review the video from the security cameras. After giving us the run around for several days we were told there was nothing they could do since we left the hotel before making a claim. What?!!! So they can just wreck my car and hold no responsibility for it?! DO NOT LEAVE YOUR CAR WITH THIS VALET SERVICE!! Sadly, the hotel is nice, but because of this experience and no one taking responsibility, we would never stay here again.The Blackstone has  a beautiful, historic exterior and is in the perfect location. We spent a weekend in Ft Worth recently and enjoyed it.  Our room was very small, but ok for one night. We walked everywhere and being that we were exploring Ft Worth for the first time, this was a big plus. Front desk staff were very friendly. -It would have been nice to know from the front desk that street parking is FREE. We parked in the attached garage and it was $25. This should be a MUST piece of information at guest check in. -The exterior is so lovely, that I expected this aesthetic to translate inside, and that just was not the case. Other than the lobby, our room was a basic Marriott room and included popcorn ceiling and no period details at all. Shame. -Strange furniture arrangement had the TV to the extreme left of the bed, making it impossible to comfortably view in a relaxed manner. -The tap water was absolutely undrinkable - beware. Smelly and dreadful. -The bar downstairs is cute, but is seriously limited in the beverages that they carry - especially wine. -The pool area is on the 5th floor, but lacked any charm. The interior Jacuzzi might as well have been in a local gym. No ambience at all - sterile and smelled like Chlorine. -The interior courtyard terrace on the 3rd floor has the potential to be cute and cozy, but again, no attempt has been made to do so. Other than furniture and high cement walls, there is nothing. I'm grateful that the Marriott has preserved this hotel, but I'd like to see them take the next step into turning it into a place to be remembered for more than just it's location and Art Deco exterior.This is a grade C property and the rooms are tiny!! $200 a night for this !?!NOT. We walked in saw and walked out !No way !!!Plus the pool is closedWe booked a block of rooms for my son's wedding in July.  The location is great in Sundance Square.  Lots of fun things to see and do around downtown and close enough for a quick ride to the Stockyards.  I had family in from out of town that enjoyed going to that.  We had a large group and we were able to hang out in the lobby area. The valet's were pleasant, but getting the car took a while since they use and elevator for the cars, which is actually kind of cool.  The only downside was that the pool was closed, however we knew that going in.  The Corner Bakery downstairs was fine and we really enjoyed breakfast at Jakes across the street.  I got a kick out of walking around Sundance square on Saturday morning and seeing about 50 people enjoying a Zumba class.  It's a really fun area.  I would recommend the hotel and great location to others.Very clean and large rooms. Excellent service, inexpensive, and great downtown location. The staff made some great recommendations on restaurants and places to visit. My biggest complaint was that the gym was really small.When the valet brought my car around, it smelled like someone had been smoking.  Or something.  I really did not appreciate that.  The car was brand new; I had purchased it 24 hours before.  Also, they had the radio on, not on one of my stations.  I suspect something.  And there's not much you can do about this, short of installing a secret nanny-cam.  I don't trust the boys they had working there.Historic hotel located in the heart of downtown Fort Worth. Booked this hotel for New Year's Eve so I can be in downtown for all the New Years activities. Checking in was easy but the valet service was horrible. I had to drive around the next block and wait for the valet guy to park my car. The wait was at least 44 minutes and this was an inconvenience. I wanted to just go to my room and have valet park my car. Maybe because it was New Years Eve and the hotel was too old to have normal parking accommodations. My room was not spacious at all and the thermostat did not work. My room temperature was 67 and it was 30 degrees outside. I literally slept with my hoodie on because the room was so cold. Fortunately I only slept 4 hours here after being out for New Years. The hotel does not offer breakfast or coffee at all. This is the only Marriott I have stayed at that does not offer breakfast. I will probably not stay at this location anymore.With a family of four visiting Fort Worth at the end of July, staying at a place with a pool is a must. The pool described at the blackstone is an outdoor heated pool.  Unfortunately, at this hotel, their pool does not work.  This was not told to us while making the reservation, nor was it told to us during check in. There are no signs or notices anywhere in the hotel, with the exception of directly in front of the closed pool.  The "alternatives" given to us were a) next door at the embassy suites- whose pool is 3 feet eight inches deep, the size of a large jacuzzi, and is ice cold or b) the pool at the renaissance which is 3 blocks away. Fun.  We feel.we've been lied to.  To top everything off, the front desk was flippant and sarcastic about our complaints.Centrally located and the people are nice. Parking is an issue. Beds are WAYYY too soft. TV is local and not a good system. Bathroom was the size of a phone booth. This looks like an old independent hotel that Courtyard has taken over. I would bet that Courtyard does a much better job than would be done independently. I would prefer, however, a Courtyard a little farther out. I know what to expect. This place will do in a pinch or as a cheap alternative to the Worthington or the Omni.Upturned face.Very nice hotel for a building established in 1929. Nice modern renovation. Clean, nice little perks and friendly staff. Centrally located in the heart of the historic section of ft worth. Keep in mind, this is a valet only hotel.Amazing! Stay here. A staff that is dedicated to the comfort of their guest. From valet, front desk, amazing housecleaning, exceptional guest treatment. Clean, well furnished, comfortable, safe stay. Rest assured when stating here.
review_content_20: I like this hotel, located 3 blocks from the convention center and all major food venues. People working here was very friendly and knowledgeable. Pool was a little small, and so the gym, but location is perfect to run to the river and park near by (about 6 mile jog) Parking attendants were really awesome, I love it when my car is ready when I call ahead...seems these type of basic service become foreign in some cities.The only downside was my colleague and my key were deactivated by 11:00 (we had Marriott status and should've given us access until noon), so had to get keys reactivated...other than that, all went well. I also recommend not eating at the food joint downstairs, they are kinda expensive and food wasn't that good. I'd recommend the venue across the street, they have much better food and service.This is a beautiful older hotel. We were very impressed by everything. The staff was amazing the room was beautiful we had a nice view it's proximity to everything in downtown Fort Worth is wonderful. For an older hotel you never really know it I would definitely recommend this hotelThe staff was top notch from when the valet took my car to checkout.  Room was clean and had everything you need, Comfortable bed, shower pressure with consistent Temp, reliable Wireless connections, and quiet.  Lots of dining & Entertainment choices within walking distance. The only complaint is the cost to park a car without many alternatives in the area.I'm sure it would've been a better experience if the hotel wasn't under construction/renovation... We selected this hotel to hold our meeting; meeting space, food and sleeping rooms but wasn't informed that they were under renovation.We arrived and they pretty much just had a front desk; no hotel bar or lounge area... just some couches in front of the elevator.  Although we were greeted pleasantly, I wouldn't have booked here if I had known.They charged me $229 a room... and again, for a location under construction, I would think that was high.  Renovated rooms were nice though but again, $229.?  Meeting space was set up accordingly but have to say, it was a bit snug for 38 people.  Breakfast, breaks, beverages and lunch were pleasant and for the most part on time.  During our meeting, there was some construction noise which was quite annoying; they couldn't find the source so it would come and go during the meeting... again, annoying.Location is centralized in Sundance Square which is a plus.  Staff is on point and very accommodating which was definitely a plus.I would come back to see the final product of renovation but not for $229.This is the best court yard I have ever stayed in. (I stay at least 50 night a year at Marriott, so I would know) What made it so good. Was the staff and the location. Everyone from the parking staff to the front desk were outstanding. I even found a Red SoX fan with the parking staff. The location down town was awesome. A real fun area to hang.The hotel also has a great history to it, if you take the time to learn.I had to double check the address to make sure I was reviewing the same hotel as some of the others. My family stayed here 4/20/2013. We came to town to attend the opera at Bass Hall. When we checked in, they didn't have one of our two rooms ready. We gave them a phone number to contact us when the room was ready and proceeded up to our one room. No one ever contacted us about the room. Two hours later, we checked at the front desk on our way out to eat and the room had been ready for a while. The person claimed the phone number didn't work and apparently didn't think to call us in the adjoining room they had already given us.The quality of the hotel and rooms was mediocre. The furniture on the outdoor terrace on level 3 had burn holes all over (and there were 3 staff members laying on the couches smoking out there even though smoking was markedly prohibited that close to the door).But the overshadowing experience was that the staff didn't care about us or much about anything. The best part of the whole experience was the valet parking staff, who were on their game.Overall, I would not come back here. We saw a couple hotels nearby that we will try next time , the Ashton and an Embassy Suites.One last note -- I know this will not apply yo many, but I generate a lot of body heat when I sleep, and they use those memory foam mattresses that trap heat in. Not everybody has this problem (everyone else in my family slept great), but I ended up sleeping on the floor because of this.There's my two cents, hope that helps.Don't ever leave your car with these people.  Mine was missing the lens cover from the side mirror and the broken part was INSIDE the car when I checked out.  Even though no one had access to my car except garage personnel, the hotel denied responsibility, yet could not explain how the  broken part got inside the locked car.  The garage manager told me "not to say you are lying, but how do I know you found the part inside the car?"  Let me just say, I am not normally a complainer:  In spite of paying the rack rate for my room, I did not complain about being given a room across from the elevator and hearing the door ping until 1:00 a.m., nor did I say anything about the broken thermostat or having to wait until 3:00 p.m. to have my bed made.  Failing to man up and leave a note or call my room to let me know there was an incident is simply inexcusable.Good location and quality staff. I would stay here again.Comfortable and clean rooms, free Wi-Fi, and walking distance to the convention center and other places of interest. If you need a place to stay the night. I would recommend this place. The only downside is that all hotel parking is valet for $20 a day. See if you can find parking somewhere else if you need to park overnight.The Marriott (Courtyards) are my hotel of choice and love them all. But the Blackstone in Ft Worth is at the top! I spend 5 weeks there every summer. Couldn't ask for better accommodations and service. The staff is amazing!Yes, request a room away from the street if you want a decent night of sleep. Otherwise a great location at a reasonable cost. The location is within walking distance of many things in downtown Fort Worth. The staff is friendly and helpful. The room is spacious enough and the amenities are just fine. The shower is a bit weak but otherwise OK. I wish they offered breakfast like the Embassy Suites but outside of that, I like this hotel. I do like the free Wi-Fi.This hotel is in a great location if you are visiting Fort Worth for business or pleasure. Walking distance to a lot of cool places around town. The staff is very friendly...they were quite apologetic about there not being any cookies for us to eat when we first arrived on Friday. They also gave me a toothbrush because I had forgotten mine.The rooms are big and the beds comfortable. The lighting inside sucks and the alarm clocks can't be seen well during the day time because of the angles or something.The showers sucked. The pressure was inconsistent and the heat also wavered at times. Nice pool (too cold to go in for even us Northerners), it is 4 feet deep around and is about 10-15 feet long. There is also a whirlpool and a workout center.Nice place to stay other than the showers and cheaper than the Hilton for us.Not as nice nor as voluptuous as some Hotels, but for the price you get a damn good deal.  The people are always helpful, the rooms are always clean and the location for this hotel is directly in the thick of Downtown Fort Worth.  I will definitely return.  Just be mindful of the conventions that are occurring as this place fills up and sells out fast and frequently!I agree with other reviewers.  On the street side you will be annoyed with either street noise on the lower floors or nearby live music on the upper floors.  I had the pleasure of staying on the 5th floor, and didn't hear any of the live music, since it was blocked by a nearby building.  My brother-in-law stayed on the 15th floor and they said that the music kept them up till after midnight.Meanwhile, don n the 5th floor we (my wife and I) were annoyed with the motorcycles on the street -- something that they didn't hear on the 15th floor.  There are positives.  We were in town for a convention, and the hotel is close enough to the Fort Worth Convention Center for an easy walk.  I personally liked the Corner Bakery which is the lobby level restaurant in the hotel.Our room was on the small side, but the bathroom was nice, however there was no exhaust fan or vent.  The bed was AWESOME!  The employees were friendly and very helpful.Didn't try parking, as we took a taxi from the airport, but did notice a bottleneck with the car elevator.All-in-all, I was happy with our stay, and will stay again.  I will however request a room on the other side of the building.Little tidbit...when requesting your room, if you want to actually SLEEP..make sure you request one facing the courtyard and NOT the street.  My boyfriend's parents were on the street side and had to move our second night due to the bump bump bumping of music from cars down below and from the local bars.Beds are comfy enough...I slept well.  I thought the bathroom could've been a little nicer in that our room had kind of a funky mildew-y scent by the tub...nothing strong enough to deter me from staying again, just noted.The hotel is walking distance to all sorts of bars and restaurants which makes it kind of nice and you can get delivery to your room from Chili's and the Corner Bakery.Parking can be a pain if you're going in and out frequently as they have to take your car down below via a lift/elevator...so if you're in a hurry, find parking outside on the street.Free coffee and fruit in the lobby at all hours...The city lights twinkling at me from two walls of windows open to downtown below this 18th floor room persuaded me to add a fourth star. I am not sure when the hotel was last remodeled and while it's not sparkling new, it is clean and nice. Rooms are spacious, with lots of outlets and comfy beds. The hotel is right in the middle of downtown Fort Worth, which is great for walking to area restaurants, shops, Bass Performance Hall and area bars. My personal favorites for food include the Reata, the Taverna, Piranha Killer Sushi and for a greasy burger and a beer, Billy Miner's Saloon. Valet parking is not reliable - call and call again to double check that someone is getting your car and while they say it will only be five minutes, beware - they have an elevator garage system and can only load in/out two cars at a time. Valet is $10/day and self-park is only at minimal street spots or surrounding pay lots. Staff is incredibly nice, but seem to get overwhelmed when there are several impatient people around at one time. There is a Corner Bakery attached to the lobby which I'm sure is great for a quick breakfast, but today I'm going to check out Lucille's on Camp Bowie, which I heard is great.

review_content: To echo others, the staff here is excellent. The breakfast room is very clean and the selection of fruit was first rate.One of the best deals in Fort Worth!  The Staff makes the difference!!For starters, it's one of the least expensive hotels in the city!If there is construction, they put you on the side away from it (quiet).If you arrive late, they leave the fruit, snack bars, oatmeal, and tea out.Indoor pool as well!If you are looking for clean, safe and inexpensive you might have several options.If you choose this one, you will NOT be disappointed.5 STARsI've stayed here at least a couple of times a year for up to 10 days at a time for several years.  Staff is always nice.  But...  like all Fairfields they start out nice and then just slowly decline.  It's not the place it used to be.  I've had my last stay.  2 roaches in the bathroom before I went to bed and then one running across the bedside stand when I woke up.  I told them at the desk and they were horrified.  They asked if I wanted to change rooms and I said no, it was my last night and DON'T FUMIGATE THE ROOM.  I got back to my room and the sicky sweet minty fumigation was worse than the roaches, one of which ran across the bed as I walked in. They gave me a different room and I drug all my stuff off to the other room for my last night.  I got an apology letter under the door that night.  I really expected a better response.  Just not what it used to be...Stayed here for a brief night while visiting dad in the hospital nearby. Since all my other visits consisted of only interacting with my parents who lived there, this is the first time I truly experienced the warm hospitality of Texans. The staff is approachable, warm and incredibly efficient. Upon seeing I'm just a solo traveler who has booked for a double room, I was offered to be upgraded to a king bed suite. The room itself is comfortable and immaculately clean, with a living room area and a bedroom area. The staff was also very willing to help when I asked for directions to certain places and pointed me to the most direct way of getting there, patiently with details. The breakfast was good with pastries, hard boiled eggs, make your own waffles and variety of oatmeal and fruits.Even though it was a brief one night stay, Fairfield Inn made my rather stressful trip very pleasant with its professionalism and hospitality.Parking and breakfast is complimentary.If you're ever in Fort Worth, stay here.This hotel has the best customer service and I would stay here over and over again. During my stay, there was a guy named Rain who worked at the front desk. He was patient and very kind. I work in customer service and I know how trying some days can be. He was awesome! I hope his boss is reading this so he can get a raise.The customer service from the front desk associates is the reason I am giving them a 5 star rating. Customer Service is everything. Their hotel was also, clean and comfortable.If you are looking for a nice place to rest, you should definitely stay here.The Staff makes the difference!!OK, most Fairfield Marriotts are similar, right?  Well this one, with one exception, has a staff that makes it a very enjoyable place to stay.  They remember you or recognize you from prior stays.  Front desk staff is helpful as to suggestions and meeting a traveler's needs.  Last recent stay (allowed me to check in early so I could leave some things in the room since it was ready).  And even though I was waiting in line for a woman to ask the front desk person a bunch of questions, I appreciated the service they were giving her.  They were full or booked solid.  She offered to help the lady find another place, as she had no reservation (made calls) and gave her advice on cabs and cab fares to a convention or meeting she was going to.  Very friendly even though the lady tried and TRIED to get her to find a room for her at the full location.........LOLMy only exception was the lady who was handling the breakfast situation.........she seemed a little overstressed.  Would not assist with getting a tray for bringing back food to the room even though I was open to using anything makeshift.  Not the usual lady that has been there who was helpful.  But it wasn't THAT big a deal; just stuck out in my mind since everyone else, including housekeeping staff is friendly and helpful.Now that winter has started rearing it's head, I think the inside pool is a nice feature.  I don't think you would go wrong by booking this hotel if you have business in the area or Fossil Creek area of Ft. Worth.Stayed here from June 28, 2014 thru July 1st.  We had the suite with the lounging area and considering our stay, was a nice feature, because we didn't have to sit on the bed, when the room & it gave the room a bigger feeling. We found the bed & pillows very comfortable, so much so, it was easy to fall asleep and sleep in on the one day we had. The hotel does have a washing machine & dryer, which was great, because we just came off of 3 days on the road then being in a hotel plus we would be another few days before our moving truck would arrive.  (We were relocating from CA to TX) The hotel had complimentary breakfast and the lady monitoring the breakfast area during weekend was actually servicing the area, and was helpful.  However, the weekend day lady, could only be bothered with a "good morning" and then standing there watching "her tv show" flip this house, or some show of that nature, as she told another guest,  she was not concerned if there was coffee, if the muffins needed to be replenished or anything else of that nature.  But she was good at holding up the wall and watching tv.  Wow what a good paying job she had!!!  My biggest complaint was that the hotel hallways, were is damn hot.  I glanced at the thermometer one day as we walked down the hallway and it was 82!  It is quite a shock to go from your cool room, into a sauna like hallway.  It would be nice if the hotel could set the thermometers a little lower is the hallways are cooler. The ice machines put off a lot of heat themselves and I'm sure the hotel isn't thinking of that,,,,or maybe they are, The staff at the front desk are ok in friendliness.  There was ONLY one older woman, with long whitish hair that greeted you every time with a nice smile and said hello, as you came off the elevator or in the front door!!  She  always acknowledged your presence.  Kiddos to her. I would recommend this hotel & I would stay there again..... But I think the hotel could make some minor improvements & get the "wall , tv watching person" out of the way!!OK, don't get me wrong, this is not the Ritz, but for value, the rating is true.  The staff here is amazingly nice, always trying to help you.  They are kind.  The breakfast is one of the best I have seen for type of hotel this is.  We stayed here for one week, visiting our daughter in Ft. Worth, and it was a wonderful place to stay.  The beds are Marriott beds, so you know you get a good sleep.  The place is clean, well maintained, put that together with the staff, and it gets 5 stars in my book.Oh, forgot the warm choc chip cookies at night along with the coffee always there for you.  Never seen that before.  Papers for you every morning, the list goes on...Stayed here for two nights with a group of my students for a field trip. It was my first time in the area and I was impressed with the specific directions the hotel gave to get around the construction. They gave me a room in proximity to both of my student rooms (as requested) so that I could keep an eye on them; which was very nice. When my students realized a few of them forgot toothbrushes, they had some for them to use at the front desk.
