The people who worked the front desk for our entire stay were great -- even giving awesome directions to the workshop we were headed to and helping out if we got lost and needed to call them. They made check-in and out very simple and the breakfasts they served both days we were there were great and always fully stocked even though the hotel was very full! I would highly recommend them if you're looking to stay in this area.Really good place, only bad thing is the highway is getting worked on so you kinda need to know how to get around the back roadsHere with a soccer team. And what a great stay. Lovely staff. Great room. I requested a micro wave - no problem! Fridge in room actually gets drinks very cold! Wish all our soccer trips used this hotel.Here for a night or two. And I can't express how friendly and courteous the front desk person is. Would definitely stay here again, and would recommend this hotel....Sure, a Fairfield Inn is a Fairfield Inn, but the little touches make all the difference.  Such as leaving the fruit, snack bars, oatmeal, and tea out in the breakfast area for late night arrivals.  Soft cookies at the front desk are very nice, too!Clean and safe and plenty of free parking.

A very clean and comfortable stay.I came across a deal for a suite at this Microtel and decided to give it a shot. The suite came with a small kitchen, a jacuzzi and a couch. The room itself was very roomy and not only clean, but fresh as well. The jacuzzi was shaped like a red heart, as shown in the photos. The only minor gripe was that the jacuzzi didn't work at first, but after some time it finally kicked in.For amenities, there wasn't much more you could ask for. A large, flat-screen TV, microwave, extra sink, free wi-fi, full-sized ironing board, plenty of cabinets and several chairs for additional seating. There was a good variety of breakfast options in the morning.The standard prices for rooms are a bit steep, but if you can take advantage of a special offer, then you may be able to grab a nice room for a great value here. Check your third-party apps for a deal. Expedia offered rooms for 40% off, which was outstanding.This Microtel could have gotten five-stars if it were not for a few other minor complaints. The toilet paper was on the opposite side of the bathroom from the toilet, meaning not within reach. The room door didn't close all the way unless you forcefully slammed it closed. As mentioned, the jacuzzi was temperamental and that seems to be echoed from other reviews as well.All in all, I would come here again given the overall experience and value.Been traveling the U.S. For the past 3 weeks and I can only afford Motel 6s. And this one is by far the best I've had. Big rooms. Decent price. Modern building. Free WiFi. Spotless rooms. I'm coming back.Stayed here as a last minute booking for a funeral.  I booked it online through Expedia.  PRICE: The price of $72 a night was good for a double queen room.  STATE OF ROOM/FACILITY: The room was clean though a little outdated with decor.  The shower took a really long time to warm up and I didn't want to waste water so a cold shower is was.  The breakfast area was pretty clean & organized.  The juice machine did have a lot of extra juice in the drop tray but that was all. STAFF: I had a late check in and had no issues.  The staff was great & got us the extra items we requested. LOCATION: The hotel is surrounded by other hotels & businesses.  Right off the freeways so very easy to get around as needed.  Very quiet & I felt safe.As part of my road trip, I headed down to the Fort Worth area to meet up with family from Austin.  My cousin booked the hotel, because it was close to things we wanted to do, close to I-35, and cheap.While I would typically stay in a hotel slightly more expensive than this, I can't really complain about anything.  You get what you pay for.  The hotel was clean was clean.  Rooms with two beds were crowded, but again, they were clean.  The staff at the front desk were not overly friendly, but they weren't rude either.Location was good.  Right on the 820, and close enough to the 35.Free wi-fi was good too. My only real complaint (and I guess I can't blame this on the hotel) is the other guests.  It was New Year's Eve, and this was the place to be if you were a 20 something.  People were bringing in cases of beer and other liquor.  The lobby was bustling with cowboys and cowgirls ready to party. My cousins and I stayed up til midnight with the kids, and then I went back down to the first floor where my room was and passed out.  I didn't hear much that night, but I was rudely awoken by my neighbors, one of whom felt it was necessary to ask his friends "WHAT DAY IS IT" and annoyingly shout "HUMP DAY." The walls are definitely NOT sound proof.  Be warned.But if you're looking for a cheap and clean place to stay.  This will suffice.If budget is only concern then this hotel might suit. Would prefer not to stay here again but it's the chance you take using a third party booking service on price alone.Hotel staff is rude compared to most hotels  and hotel though rather new is already dingy and odd smell.Room colors are too bright and they stimulate rather than help you relax and the lighting is too bright and only options are overhead. The mirror is a huge distraction and would be better without it.Side entrance doors did not work creating a security risk. Pool and spa were closed.No welcome guide in room and uninformed response from staff led you to believe there were not many dining or entertainment options nearby.I go to the Ft. Worth area a few time a year, and decided to try this place based on reviews at a hotel site.  I tried to check in a little early, 10:30, as I had to work late that day, and was told they had nothing ready yet.Once I did check in, the room was clean, which is critical, but older and in need of some repairs - old tube tv's and the amoire had hinges broken. The best part of the trip was their elevator breaking down, and having to go up and down 3 flights of stairs each time I wanted to go out.On the plus side, the room had a fridge.I have to go back to this area in June, and have already booked a different hotel.Also the area the hotel is in, is a little iffy. On the way out to work on the second day, was able to witness the police cuffing a guy they pulled over.  It was like watching COPS.The start was a very unpleasant experience with checkin {see tip} and the when we finally were able to check in they said that they no longer took pets!  I told them when we paid {we use Hotels.com} they took pets.  After confering with everyone she called the Manager who said honour it {duh!} and charge them $25 for the night.  That proved to be great insurance as the night clerk wanted to charge me the $150 penalty for having a pet in there motel!  My advice? There are a dozen cut rate motels within 10 minutes.  Pass up this one and go elsewhere.The hotel was whtat one would expect in staying in a decent non slezy budget hotel. I staying in standard queen suite which consisted of a queen bed, a tiny microwave and small fridge housed with a wet bar sink and in a cabinet that jutted out from the wall. There was also a sleeper couch, which had cushions that didn't even extend to the end out the couch to sit on, and I would rather sleep on the window seat/bed than on the mattress. However other than that, everything was great. The front desk was courteous and helpful, the elevator was quick, there was no problem being on the 3rd floor either. The location was nice. The breakfast was what I expected. The computer was nice to have if needed. I like this hotel chain, you get a decent hotel thats cheap on the wallet. In short if your looking for an inexpensive but decent hotel and you are not too picky about the little things, then this hotel is for you.Sheets were used, floor was dirty, bathtub was clean, towels were those thin mini-me ones, breakfast was ok, but hey - it was a free meal.  Overall, it's a good 'budget' hotel for a quick stay.My family stayed one night here when in town on business.  We booked the hotel through Priceline (last minute), and got a great price!  When we arrived (at almost 1am), we were very pleased with the lobby and quick check-in process.  The gentleman at the desk (which I believe to be the same one as the previous reviewer described) was very competent and helpful, even telling us that if we needed directions anywhere to let him know about 15 minutes before we planned to leave in the morning and he would print them out for us and have them waiting.The room we were in was nicely appointed, with a pull-out couch and coffee table in the sitting area, a kitchenette/island that divided the sitting area from the bedroom area.  There were no sheets on the pull-out couch, so I did have to return to the lobby to get sheets & pillows, as well as extra towels.  I was helped quickly and courteously.  The room was clean and efficient, definitely happy with it for the price.There was no wireless internet, which was a disappointment; however, there was a computer in the lobby for guest use.  It was available all but one time that I was in the lobby (I went several times, as I was printing out information most of the night).  There were really only two drawbacks to our stay.  One - this is an entirely non-smoking facility.  I had not realized that until I requested a smoking room upon check-in.  Two - the lack of wireless internet.  The breakfast (included in the price) in the morning provided a good selection, including fresh danishes, muffins, cereal, fresh fruit, coffee, cocoa, and more.Not my usual type of hotel, As long as rates don't break the bank. I try to stay in better hotels. Hotels near the convention center were 250.00 a night.  No thank you! So I choose this hotel crossing my fingers and praying that I didn't make a big mistake, at 32.00 a night my expectations were low. The room reminded me of my first  nice little studio apartment. No frills but everything was clean and in working order. Front desk was helpful and friendly and location was decent. I absolutely received  bang for my buck and had enough money left over to rent a car for my business downtown. This hotel is worthy of four stars because it exceeded my expectations. Heck I've stayed plenty of nicer luxury hotels and have been more disappointed. If you are looking for a room on a budget this place could fit the bill.My dad wanted to come with my husband and I to Texas to visit and look at potential houses. He made travel arrangements on Expedia, not really knowing where hotels were placed in accordance to everything else.We got to the motel after a long flight and driving from the airport. We are greeted half heartedly by a man who had a thick Hindu accent. We were told our reservation was no received, even though we had confirmation from them and even printed out the confirmation itself (good thinking Dad). So we're checked in after 30 minutes, which was ridiculous. We then headed to the elevator, which looked like it was haphazardly installed into the hotel, and even though we were staying on the 2nd floor, made note of the sign taped to the inside of the elevator doors warning those who were staying on the 3rd floor that there was a broken tile and to not trip...nice.The hallways were hot and stuffy, absolutely no attempt at ventilation was apparent. The room was small and cramped. There were two beds, an armoire, a desk and a rolling computer chair with some sort of brownish-yellow stain on the seat. There was a tiny TV on the desk and the room looked like there was too much furniture. Oh, did I mention the oh-so-classy tinted mirror on the wall where the headboards were? Very 70/80's "bow chicka wow wow"...yuck. The worst thing? They have a "tech center" which is comprised of ONE (yes one) computer, which was occupied ALL. THE. TIME. I literally went to see if it was available 5 times in one day to print out our boarding passes to go home only to finally be able to print them out at 10pm after the two people who had been hogging the damn thing all day decided to give it a rest. When I went to the desk to ask if I could possibly use another computer to print the boarding passes, I was told "Just tell them to leave" WTF?? The "breakfast" consists of week-old cereal (corn flakes), stale muffins, and coffee. Don't stay here...you WILL regret it.For the price...if you only need a shower and a bed...it's the best value in the country.  I didn't know you could get a room for under $50 anymore.  The lobby is depressing..clean just really tired.  The rooms are clean, the bed was very comfortable and we had no noise or other guests issues.  We were there for a school event and the arena was less than two miles away.  We went into Ft. Worth for dinner both nights which was less than a 15 minute drive.  We were very pleased.  The coffee and breakfast are worth passing on...just get dressed and go to Waffle House across the parking lot.

I didn't want to believe the reviews but after our stay I had no choice but to leave this review.  The checkin went smooth but that was it.  Our room cards kept getting deactivated which was a minor annoyance. All these things I could forgive and still would have given at least 3-4 stars but one thing happened that has NEVER happened to me before at a "upscale" hotel.  I left a nice shirt I had bought for the wedding we were in town for and in the rush to get out I left it in the closet, well I called at 1pm our checkout was noon and I was polite and was only greeted with rudeness and smugness I have never received before.  The so called "manager" who told me his name was MR MILLIONS was so rude and pretty much refused to even ask housekeeping if they had my shirt.  He had the nerve to say (being manager) that he didn't have the authority to speak to housekeeping and that he "may get to it another day" I have never been so disrespected especially at a so called nicer hotel.  My wife and I will not stay at this particular As an update: I did get my shirt back from a different customer representative Mrs.LING and she was very nice and everything that should've been presented to me the first time aroundExtremely disappointed.   I'm paying over $100.00 a night and the air conditioner will not cool below 65.  Someone in the Marriott organization made the EXTREMELY STUPID decision to keep the air conditioners from cooling below 65, even though I AM PAYING FOR A PROPERLY FUNCTIONING AIR CONDITIONER.   ALL of their air conditioners should work as they are designed to, none should be disabled so hat they cannot cool as they are designed to cool.  All Marriott has to do is charge 3 or 4 dollars more per night and that will more than make up for the use of the AC.  The window AC unit in all of these rooms  will not use very much electricity in an 8 hour period.   The fact is, that an AC actually cycles on and off during each hour of use so they do not run continuously.   In an 8 hour period an ac probably only runs for an hour or so and once the room temperature is reached it is very easy to keep it at that temperature.  Only a minimum bit of electricity is used to keep a room cool.     Furthermore,  only a very small percentage of their customers will ever run an ac below 65, but their lame brained decision to keep the ac units from doing their job affects ALL of their rooms.  They could have some rooms available in each hotel where the ac units are not disabled.  If they really cared about their guests they would have a system in place that met the customers needs and expectations.   Either set some rooms aside where the air conditioners are not disabled, or charge more per night, or do what most hotels do, and just don't disable the AC's to start with.  Years ago certain organizations charged people to use the toilet, usually it was 5 cents to 20 cents.   That turned out to be a very stupid mistake.  People, if they didn't have a nickel or dime, would use the bathroom outside of the stall on the floor.  Marriott's decision to disable their air conditioners is an  extremely stupid decision also.    Marriott has lost all of my future business,  and I am certain that it has also lost the business of many of its other valuable customers.  Just because they want to save 3 or 4 bucks.  If i was not paying for the room then i would not have a legitimate complaint,  but i DID pay and did not get what i paid for.  I feel taken advantage of and ripped off.   If i stayed at motel 6 i would have been treated better. Now that is irony.Excellent experience due mostly to staff.  Very friendly and helpful.  Clean rooms and great dining options nearby.  We stayed as a family and everyone loved it.  Would definitely go backI am giving this location a great rating for service! My company had a 2 day event location, Frank and his staff were attentive and catered to our groups every need! They recently remodeled...had Christmas decor and music! Love it. Bathrooms next to the lobby area were clean, offer computers with printers. They even faxed off some items for me! Service A+....I recommend you book your events here.stayed 6/28-6/29. I'm 6'4" tall. Hit my head on Exit sign on 3rd floor. All other signs are lower. During shower, took off wedding ring and left in soap dish. Forgot it. Called 4 times and talked with staff. Was told they would call back in 15 minutes. They never called back. Called 5th time. Attitude of staff was not caring or showed concern for my problem. Stated that room was inspected before/after cleaning. Stated they talked with room inspector & maid but no ring was found. I'm a Mason/Shriner and would not lie about this. Their staff has my wedding ring. Sent complaint on their website, was not called back. Front Desk Clerk Sunday morning was hanging out at Breakfast area (no free coffee or breakfast) and was mocking me and having fun at my expense due to my back being out.  Worst experience at a hotel EVER.They are undergoing renovation and in truth they warn you....but....I wasn't prepared to be at the Baghdad Marriott.  Jeez they didn't do one wing or floor at a time so the workers and the dust was in all the halls. My room was "new" but the door to the bathroom and its hinges were preserved from previous decades.  Maybe a nod to the old west??? On a good day this was an average suburban low end Marriott. During my stay it was lower lower end.  ps nearby restaurant included one called "redneck heaven"...I wish I was joking. er...just whistlin' dixie!They try and offer extra Marriott points to keep guests but truthfully they need to do a wing at a time or just shut down and knock the renovation out.So, I arrive at 5:47 PM (I looked at my watch just to make sure) with my boss' boss. Pleasantly, I was informed that, as a valuable Platinum member, my and the boss' rooms were upgraded to King Suites. However, the rooms weren't ready. That is where I liked at my watch. How can rooms not be ready at 6 PM?  I did say rooms. So, we sat in the lounge for a drink while we wanted 20 minutes for them to prep the rooms  When I got to my room it was pleasant enough, but no trash cans in the entire suite. I got back downstairs to meet the boss, and there he is the front desk. His room still wasn't ready. We're not just talking that the bed wasn't made; the shower curtain was laying on the floor and a tool belt was draped over a chair. The desk clerk now comes up to verify the statement, but i guess he doesn't believe my boss, cause he didnt bring another room key. So, here is the boss carrying his luggage back to the front desk, and to his new room which is double beds, when I reserved a king. Now, back to my room. Pretty nice, but the bedroom door doesn't shut. Newly remodeled room, but no one checks that an interior door doesn't shut? Oh well. So, Courtyard...you get 5 stars for first impressions; but, you lose 1 star for not having rooms ready at 6. You lose 1 additional  star for My boss waiting 20 minutes for a room that was habitable. You lose the third star for doors not closing, not trash can in the room and just general attention to detail.Older setup.  Old TV's.  Place needs to be updated.  The people there are very friendly and the location is good for where I need to travel to on business.  I also get a business rate so the price is real hard to beat.  Please update the place!I stay at this hotel a lot.  It is what it is - a room to sleep in.  This time I took my wife and was a little embarrassed by the overall poor experience.  It seemed like something went wrong every day.  1st day our room wasn't made by housekeeping, 2nd day our room keys didn't work, 4th day our room keys didn't work.The worst thing happened on the 4th day.  One of my pet peeves is when people use their cell phone while they are in the middle of completing a financial transaction (at the store, the bank, a hotel registration, a rental car desk, etc). I was next in line at the hotel registration (when my key stopped working for the second time) and the person in front of me decided to take a call. At that point the transaction was over, the guy behind the desk was just waiting to thank the person before attending to me.  I asked him if he could start helping me while the other person completed their phone call and he proceeded to call ME rude.  Seriously?  The person in front of me takes a phone call in the middle of the transaction, holds the line hostage, and you're calling me the rude one?THis the worst hotel that I have stayed in! I came here for a second time for one week just to give it the benefit of the doubt, however I was not impressed at all! The room is clean and the bed comfortable, INTERNET CONNECTIVITY IS WORSE THAN DIALUP!!! So if your trying to business I hope you have 3G!!! The gym is extremely small, I tried out the Hot tub both times I came here and the water was Luke warm and the jets barely work in the hot tub. The only reason I gave such a high score of two stars for this hotel is that the Breakfast bar was great and the service there was extremely good! And I ONLY mean the service at the dining area for breakfast. I don't think I will be staying here anymore, I might as well stayed at an economy motel, because the price is not worth it at all!!! Good luck!I stayed here for 3 week due to business. I flew out on the weekends and would be back by Monday. The hotel was clean and safe which are my biggest concerns. If your looking for the little extras such as internet, gym, or SPECIFIC toiletries this is not your hotel. GYM:The gym is very small, allowing little if no room to stretch. INTERNET: The internet connection is hit or miss because it really depends on the location of your room. At one point the modem in my room was not working, and instead of giving me a new one for the night, I was told I could go into another room and use that modem and they would replace mine in the morning. Although maybe they were just having a bad 3 weeks with their internet provider. TOILETRIES: I called the front desk asking for a shower cap and was told, "I'm not sure if we have any." and asked if the employee could go look and was soon told, "yes we have some" and was not offered for one to be brought up. Although it sounds like I wasn't happy with the hotel, it really was very clean and very safe as well being conveniently located to the company I was doing business with. It also had a really GREAT breakfast buffet with amazing service. The buffet is not included in the room. Also the hotel did offer 1 washer and 1 dryer for $1 each and provided detergent and fabric softener. Check in and check out was also very fast.Ok so after a horrible plane ride/night to the Dallas/Forthworth Airport (I didnt make it the first night and I ended up staying the night at the Houston Airport) I really expected to be disapointed again. I had to cancel the meeting at my job because I couldnt get there. And my business associate was stuck as well but she got to get stuck in LAS VEGAS....uggggggghhhhh  So anyway I get to the hotel and check in and was pleasantly surprised that not only was my room paid for but they upgraded my room. I still dont know if my company did that or they felt sorry for me because I spent the night sitting on the cold floor at the Houston airport. My room had its own jacuzzi/huge bathtub in it and i was done for the day. I think I spent most of my time in that tub that night. It was pretty flipping awesome. Luckliy I didnt really go out to check out the town because there was nothing to check out. There was a highway and then the hotel and thats about it! The nearest store was walmart and it was scary driving all that way.Its too bad that I had to leave early because my family was waiting for me and they are located in McKinney which is like and hour from the Hotel. But i truly enjoyed my short stay there. I would definitely go back. Oh and although I missed it they had a complimentary mixer dinner the night that I got there. That was a nice touch.There was plenty of parking and people were very nice. Oh and the entire Hotel was inside and so was the Gym. :)There was something about this Courtyard that seemed a little shabbier than the others I'd stayed in.Maybe it was the little things: - one room key vs two, - the oh-so-common AC unit that was poorly placed so it blew into your face as you sat at your too high desk for a too low desk chair,- maybe it was the cheap white Fridge cube, looking like a refugee from the Goodwill, that seemed to freeze everything solid even at the lowest setting- or the prominent insert with my room key stating" Please be advised. This is a major metropolitan area. For your safety and security, please do not leave valuables in your car." [now I fear for the safety of the car windows or the trunk being opened like a sardine can]- Or maybe while the cost of the room was reasonable, the normally complementary breakfast buffet was added instead [fair I guess if you don't eat breakfast]- Maybe it was the free wired Internet that was wonky (up & down) for two days.- Or the show water diverter that stubbornly resisted budging to give me my shower--so much so that you could see the faucet downspout was sporting a fresh caulk bead covering where the spout was pulling from the wall.So I am left oddly uneasy about this hotel. My spidey senses are detecting multiple things that made me not quite pleased with my stay here.This Marriott is down at the heels and the service was not what I'm used to. When we arrived, we had to wait over 5 minutes for the desk clerk to arrive. She said she had been in the bathroom & seemed a bit miffed that we were wondering where she was (we were wondering aloud when she appeared). Humorless is a word that come's to mind when I think about her. When we got to the room, the balcony door wouldn't lock (uneasy feeling), so we called the desk. She said they would give us a new room. Rather than meet us up there (which is what normally would happen at a Marriott, but probably didn't because she seemed to be the ONLY staff there at 4pm) and walk us to the new room, we had to go back to the front desk for the new key. The new room was fine - just fine, but I didn't like having to interact with the lady again. On the plus side, the bed was delightfully comfortable and we slept very well.We only stayed one night. The morning desk clerk clerk was friendly (a great ste up!), so we left on a higher note. I was a bit disappointed that there was no continental breakfast and that the coffee provided in the room was only enough for 1 cup of caff and 1 cup of decaf. That seemed odd - why not have 2 servings like most hotels? It just didn't FEEL like a Marriott. I felt a bit like a motel instead of a hotel - lackluster service & a bit run-down.

hotel_name: Residence Inn Ft. Worth Cultural District
review_content: It was kind of a waste that I only stayed in this location for one night. It was definitely well set up for a long term stay with a 2 burner stove and a full kitchen area (with plates, pots, etc) and a breakfast bar. You could even get the hotel staff to do your grocery shopping (except for alcohol and tobacco).My room was clean, the bed was comfortable and the floor was really quiet. Breakfast was fine but nothing fancy. I did like the fresh fruit option. Check in and out was really easy and there were dinner options within walking distance, so that was great.Yikes. This place sucks and my experience sucked.- There was a lizard in our room. Wtf?- Gym is horribly stocked. It's so cramped it seems like it used to be a maids' closet that was hastily turned into a "fitness center." Missing several dumbells like the 25 lbs, which make it impossible to do symmetrical exercises..who wants to do Flys with a 25 and a 30?- Front desk staff is unprofessional. Bad attitudes, wearing jeans? No thanks. They were generally unhelpful.- Crazy ghetto neighbors... the conversation went something like this..."Yo b*tch, ima get a pizza""Who you callin' a b*tch, ni##a?" *indistinguishable yelling ensued* I know the hotel can't control that, but maybe check IDs and make sure those people didn't commit identity theft. - Next to an apartment complex which attracted some interesting characters to the pool area.- Lobby smelled like fart half the time..... my final contribution to this stinkhole ;) Overall we were so unsatisfied that we cancelled our last night and booked the Hyatt at DFW airport which made this place look like a cardboard box. I was looking forward to checking out the cultural district of Fort Worth, but this unpleasant stay definitely put a damper on an otherwise fantastic trip out to Texas!! Perhaps on a different night, this place would be a different experience, but it just was not enjoyable and won't feel the need to visit again..Pretty decent little hotel, for the price.With all of the amazing local restaurants, I'd probably skip their "Happy Hour" food (it wasn't impressive anyway).The rooms are clean, and the service was good.Free parking.Spacious rooms with kitchenettes (but again, you should be eating out - so many great places within walking distance from this hotel).Newly remodeled rooms and dining area.  Also, Lucy continues to provide excellent check in and customer service.  My family looks forward to our extended stay.Yeah, yeah.  It's a nice property and the location is good.  But there is an abundant amount of thoughtlessness when it comes to the details.  In other words, there were way too many corners cut for my liking.Here are some examples:-The bedside lamps don't have outlets in them so you have to move the large nightstands/dressers to plug something in. -The hotel internet not secured. I'm sure apartment dwellers use it and take up bandwidth because it was very slow. -Beds very low (think IKEA beds).-There was nothing in the shower to provide traction at the bottom of the tub, making it VERY slippery and quite hazardous. -Brian, the GM, didn't ask me a floor preference. The people in front of me got asked, but I guess I wasn't afforded that luxury, being the lowly state employee I am, on the government rate. Brian, you really shouldn't put young, single females on the ground floor next to a construction site.-The fitness room was tiny for a hotel of this size and there were no sanitizing wipes.  So gross. Do you see what I mean?  I travel a lot for my job so the details matter.  Needless to say, I don't think I'll stay here again.Great location. Some cool bars and restaurants near by. Also shopping very close. Rooms are good and plenty of room. Free breakfast is actually really good.Only thing I didn't like was the strong ethnic food smell in the hallways. Couldn't smell in the rooms but in the hallways it was strong.I was lucky enough to stay here 1 week for work! Great hotel!Breakfast was better than most hotels I've stayed at.Wifi had some slow moments but I was able to work from hotel when I needed. The location was great when I wanted to go to the river trail to exercise or check out downtown.Great location & awesome rooms. I usually stay here once yearly for a conference I attend. Very clean with always a professional & friendly staff. Beds could be a little softer, but otherwise the rooms are well appointed.The only negative here is their "Activity Center". It's about as big as a closet and consists of 2 miniature sized treadmills, a bike, and 4 small dumbbells. Last year they offerred free day passes to LA Fitness (On Crockett Str - 1/2 mile away) but not anymore. I purchased a 2-day pass for only $15; it's a phenomenally nice club. Bring your own towel though.We reserved a two bedroom a month in advance and we ended up getting only a one bedroom. The restroom lock didn't work, the toilet was a terrible low flush, and coffee maker wasn't cleaned, only thing done right was we had enough towels.Great hotel! I use to work for Marriott and as a result am extremely picky about where I stay. This hotel made me feel right at home. Everything was clean and in order. When I requested extra linens, no one fussed or complained and they were promptly brought to my room. My only issue was at breakfast... it appeared they had a full house so I tried not to think too much about it, but the serving area was a mess! There was cereal all over the floor and waffle batter on the wall. There was no fruit when I went to get some (that was all I wanted since I had somewhere to be). I hope that is not a normal scene...This hotel was very pleasant to stay at. It is nice and new and of course offers the free hot breakfast. The selection was decent and the waffle maker was in the shape of the state of Texas, which was a fun touch. The service was excellent. There is a hotel shuttle that will take you places around Fort Worth within a reasonable distance. The driver was very flexible and if you tip him well, he'll "take care of you."The rooms were nicely acquainted. We had a 2 bedroom suite at the corner. They would refill our bag of popcorn every day if it was eaten. The 2 bathrooms were nice and they are located in each of the bedrooms, so no common area bathroom. Of course the full kitchen and small dining area were nice to have.This place went above and beyond by letting us use a conference room at no charge for a surprise baby shower. They even provided us with drinks at no charge. The only reason this isn't a 5 is for the extremely small gym, but this is as close to 5 stars as you can get.We stayed here November 23, 2014. The hotel was very clean, nice rooms and in a convenient location to the places we wanted to go in Fort Worth. We had a suite with two small rooms, a kitchenette and two TVs, which was nice. A good continental breakfast was included in a very pleasant, light-filled breakfast room. We only stayed one night so did not get to take advantage of the kitchen or other amenities, but I would stay here again.Nice hotel, rooms were clean and well stocked, complimentary breakfast buffet was really nice-biscuits and gravy, eggs, bagels, fruit, yogurt, waffles, etc.  The fitness room worked for me-it is small but they offer a complimentary 3-day guest pass to the LA Fitness right down the street if you need a little more space.  The pool is a nice plus as well.  The beds are really the only thing that could use a bit of an upgrade-not the most comfortable mattress and pillows, but overall a good hotel.My go to hotel in Ft Worth when coming in town for TCU football games. Location is great. Not far from TCU campus. Also close to downtown F Dub. Tons of bars and shops within walking distance. I also like to run outside and the Trinity River trail is right out the door. So nice to be able to run with scenery versus the standard hotel workout room. Rooms are nice and spacious, typical Residence Inn style. Free parking. Staff is also friendly and fast at check out. Rates are reasonable too!Nice hotel - staff was very nice rooms and hotel are very clean. Very solid value. Pool is open till 11pm and rooms are nice.  Great hotel if you plan to bring kids.Exceptional!  You can't beat the value of this hotel!  It is clean and the people are so nice and helpful.  Parking wasn't a problem for us, but I can see how that might happen.  Trains do pass, but you can't really hear them.   This hotel was designed with business travelers and families in mind,  we were here for a week and had no problems the rooms are spacious and very clean. You can walk to the park, restaurants and shopping they also offer a shuttle to downtown.  We are looking forward to returning.This is one of the nicest Residence Inns I have ever seen. The hotel itself (lobby, halls, etc) looks more like a full service Marriott than a Residence Inn. There are plenty of shopping and dining options nearby, and noise was not a problem. My only problem with this hotel is parking. Upon returning for the evening, I was directed by a hotel employee to park along a curb adjacent to the hotel because all of the spots were taken. My car was fine the next morning, but I was nervous about it getting hit by another car or possibly towed.Great hotel, close to shopping and quiet. I recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area.

hotel_name: Texas White House Bed and Breakfast
review_content: I had the pleasure of staying one night at the Texas White House Bed and Breakfast this weekend. I enjoyed my stay so much that I did not want to go home. It was so relaxing! Check in was a breeze and we actually were upgraded to another room because it was vacant which I really appreciate. Cindy was so welcoming and hospitable. You can tell she takes special care to make sure her guests are comfortable. She mentioned turning up the heater so we wouldn't be cold (as the weather has gotten chilly recently) And made sure to tell us where the extra blankets were. Parking (located directly in front of the property), wifi, and breakfast were included with the stay, which is a must for any bnb or hotel I will stay at. Our room, the Tejas room, was just lovely. The bird motif was apparent through out, and the room boasted bright yellows, warm browns, and some reds, oranges, blues and greens. The room accurately gave off a New Mexico vibe. The two chairs in front of the tv were perfectly comfy and great for lounging in. The vintage desk had magazines, cards, a book about haunted hotels and Babs in Texas (oooo!) and suggestions for places to visit. The bathroom was spacious, with a soaker tub and natural bath products. We used the thick robes to dry off after our baths . And the bed! Oh man! Armed with 6 pillows and the thickest and comfiest blanket and mattress I have ever felt, I could have easily gotten lost in the comfort and never ventured out into the world again.There is a happy hour from 4p-10p with wine and small snacks downstairs in the main house. There were little bins with suggestions for outings and restaurants in the area and some fun board games. We loved sitting near the fireplace and admiring the art on the walls, made and sold by local artists.Upstairs in the hallway is a mini fridge, more wine, carafes of filtered water, and a Keurig. We loved that. I almost feel like I'm spoiling the surprise for potential visitors!If you stay in the suites behind the house breakfast can be brought out to you. Otherwise you can dine at the dining table, which we did. Breakfast was served and tea and coffee as well as small breakfast pastries were offered. We had the signature dish, the breakfast nachos and a small bowl of fruit salad. It was delicious, authentic Mexican food, (and that salsa was to die for) but it was not as filling as I would have hoped. Based on the website description I was expecting more for breakfast. I booked on hotels.com because I have the hotels.com rewards, but it is a good idea to book with Cindy- you never know when a deal may pop up!My favorite part of staying, besides for relaxing, was getting to know Cindy and the other family that stayed at the bnb. We actually hugged them goodbye! And during breakfast, Cindy talked with us about some of her cooking secrets which was so sweet--she's a chef!!! I have worked in Fort Worth for three and a half years and I loved staying here. Getting to know the city even better, from a different perspective as a traveler/local was exhilarating.I cannot wait for my next visit!First, the place is just plain beautiful. The architecture, the fixtures, the rotation of museum-quality art on the walls -- and we haven't even gone upstairs to the room yet.The Lone Star Room walks a careful line between tasteful and kitschy, but that line is -- like everything else -- bigger in Texas. It features a bear-claw tub, a real longhorn steer skull on the bathroom wall, and a king-sized bed with the softest sheets I've ever slept on.The owner and manager, Cindy and Mindy respectively, are both charming hostesses who go out of their way to accommodate guests' requests, whether it's a special order for breakfast or permission to lounge around the parlor long after checkout time to wait for a ride.If you're visiting TCU, staying at the Texas White House is a no brainer. Do it! If you're staying downtown, you'd be well-advised to consider it. Sure, you could be a couple miles closer to your client site, but this is worth the short trip. And by all means bring your significant other!This is a weekend get away we will repeat. We stayed in the Tree House room. It was beautiful and quiet. The sauna and jacuzzi tub were a huge bonus. Breakfast on Sunday morning was delivered to our room and was delicious. Thank you for creating this amazing space.Was looking for a cheap hotel for a three day stay in Fort Worth . Since the stay between flights was, I decided for the Texas White House Bed and Breakfast . The hotel is located centrally , with approximately 30-minute bus rides from the nearby airport bus station is relatively easy to get to Santa Monica / Venice, UCLA Area and Hollywood. Was by bus in the Getty Center, to achieve more complicated, here really lends itself to a rental car, as well as for Downtown. The rooms were straightforward, decorated the hotel clean and typically American - wooden furniture and decoration. Friendly staff. But the pool is at the back does not deserve the name, much too small and way too much concrete around it ...I was a vendor at a convention in Ft. Worth. The staff was so accommodating to assist me with all my needs to get ready for my show. The rooms were charming and very clean. Breakfast was lovely. There is no comparison of this property to a chain hotel. The staff is at your beckon call to provide you with the best experience possible. Free breakfast and parking with a clean charming room? That is not at all what you get from a chain hotel.This my first time staying at a B&B and I don't even want to stay at another hotel ever. Cindy made me feel like home. When I first got here I was worried about not being able to find a parking place but don't worry they have plenty of parking spaces. Cindy made an awesome breakfast this morning. During the week she makes breakfasts at times requested by guests. On the weekend breakfast is served at 10 am. I highly recommend this B&B.I can't say enough good things about this B&B. Granted, I haven't stayed in one since I was a kid, but it delivered everything I expected for our 10th Anniversary overnight. We stayed in the Treehouse, the second story of the guest house. A queen size bed, a small sitting area, an ample closet, a wooden Sauna, and a nice bathroom with a large Jacuzzi tub. The bed was very comfortable and plush, with loads of pillows. The sauna (dry, with water and hot rocks for steam) easily fit two people. With a tall bench about 5 1/2 ft wide and a more narrow bench below, more for your feet sitting up and not as seating on its own. Jacuzzi tub was larger than many I have seen. I'm 6'4", and I could sit in there with my wife and still be underwater. The outside stair landing has a couple chairs and a small table, and was private enough to sit out there in our robes and enjoy he perfect weather. The grounds are covered with tall, mature trees and the fence is lined with tall shrubs. Nice lawn with a gazebo, and flower beds and sitting areas. The flowers were in process of being planted during our spring stay, but I'm sure they are very nice. Breakfast was two tostadas, one with chorizo and eggs, and one with red bell pepper and (Hatch chilies?), some guacamole and fresh berries. Very tasty, if not the most inventive menu. The room also had a split of Asti Spumante, a growler refilled with sparkling water, a Keurig with coffee and tea, and a few biscotti and chocolates/cookies. We also got a couple homemade scones when we checked out. We checked in at four so we could enjoy the evening there, since checkout is the standard 11am. They asked when we wanted breakfast and they delivered it to the room with some orange juice. It's about a five minute walk two blocks up to Magnolia Ave. which offers bars and restaurants mostly with a few shops. We had dinner at Ellerbe, which was phenomenal and the recommendation of Cindy, the owner of the TX White House. If you're looking for a relaxing place to spend a night, this place is a great spot.My fiance and I were long term guests at The Texas White House so I feel we have a pretty good knowledge of this B&B. For starters, the location couldn't be more perfect. The B&B is walking distance to some great local restaurants. The neighborhood is safe and we frequently walked around early in the mornings and later in the evenings and never felt uncomfortable. If you aren't sure of where to have dinner the inn keeper, Cindy, is more than willing to make some great suggestions. Speaking of Cindy, she is wonderful! She treated us like family and was so welcoming. Her breakfasts are delicious and she always has tasty treats out in the common areas for a quick snack. We stayed in the carriage house (a small house in the back of the property), which is perfect for a quiet, cozy getaway. The bed linens are AWESOME...I seriously need to purchase a set because they put my $300 Ralph Lauren sheets to shame. I truly can't think of anything negative to say. It was the perfect extended stay and anytime we are back in the DFW area, this will be our B&B of choice.My wife and I wanted a special place to stay the night of our wedding, and the Texas White House did not disappoint! The owners of this property are excellent, and they offer a certain amount of flexibility you just can't get at a hotel. Also, anything we needed they were able to accommodate - their customer service is top notch.I particularly liked the breakfast they brought to us, everything was cooked fresh and tasted delicious. We also loved the fact that the room had a sauna in it (very unique) and that the business was locally owned. We will be visiting again soon!My stay at Texas White House B&B was wonderful! The Land of Contrast room was like staying in your own bedroom. It was roomy with soothing colors, bed was very comfortable, and bathroom was huge. My favorite part of my stay was relaxing in the clawfoot bathtub :)My stay was peaceful, relaxing, and quiet. The whole house is really cute. Cindy was very accommodating. I would stay again, absolutely!My boyfriend and I had such a great experience at this B&B! Both the owner, Cindy and the woman that helped at the house were so charming and knew how to create an amazing breakfast! They are also amazingly flexible and exemplify great hospitality.The rooms are all decorated with a unique sense of style and they don't skimp out on the little details but really make you feel at home. It is also located within walking distance to shops and restaurants on Magnolia street.I highly recommend this place and hope I have the chance to visit again.All I can say is AMAZING! Our anniversary weekend started off with bad traffic, having to turn back home to give the car seats to the babysitter, and more traffic. But Cindy was so kind and so hospitable. She met up with us at the BnB at 730, gave us a quick tour, and checked us in. Even gave us a bottle of bubbles, totally unexpected. She made our crazy weeks heading up to this weekend all disappear. The place is beautiful, and the garden is gorgeous. Breakfast was amazing, and so was everything else.I never thought of a BnB in DFW area, but this place is definitely a gem. I will come back, and will definitely recommend this wonderful, relaxing hidden gem to anyone and everyone.I travel three times a month for work and while I enjoy the perks of hotel chain points, it gets exhausting after a while so I finally decided to try something different last month. I booked the Tree House room which was exactly what I needed. Peace and quiet, a relaxing room within a relaxing environment and wonderful hospitality. I returned this month and plan to frequently. Highly recommend this gem. Great food, great location and the Tree House room is perfect for R&R for one or for a couple. Thank you Cindy for a wonderful first B & B experience.We greatly enjoyed our stay at this quiet, classy bed and breakfast. It's close by for restaurants and shopping - several places are within walking distance, including a nice coffee shop. The staff and owner were very friendly and accommodating. Breakfast was delicious both mornings and we were surprised by the extra wine, coffee and tea provided for us throughout the day. We stayed in the Land of Contrast room, which had a huge bathroom, comfortable bed and claw foot tub. We definitely will be recommending this place to friends and family and hope to visit another time ourselves!I stayed at the Texas White House Bed & Breakfast in April while attending a workshop at Texas Christian University. Everything about the experience was wonderful. Grover and Jaime McMains were so hospitable, and one of them (or perhaps both) is a great cook. For breakfast, I had sliced pear with cinnamon and sugar, freshly baked pear bread and a sausage and egg souffle-type dish. And I know to whom to attribute the decor: Jaime. She has great taste. My room was decorated with carefully selected antiques and all the comforts you could ask for. And the bed, oh, the bed. So comfy!The location was also great. For dinner I walked to a restaurant on Magnolia, TCU was just a five-minute drive away, and the B&B is pretty close to I-35 (and you don't have to go through downtown if heading south), so I was able to miss a good chunk of the rush-hour traffic. I would definitely recommend staying here.Just stayed their over the weekend for a wedding reception. It could not have been better!!!! To start, the food was exceptionally good, filling, genuine home-style classics prepared with the absolute freshest ingredients and a lot of love. The presentation and platting were perfect. Never too sweet, or too fatty or salty. Very nicely balanced and delicious! The service was amazing. The new owners, Javier and Cindy, are lovely and really make you feel right at home. They were very engaging, very polite, and really really love what they do, which comes through in everything they are doing! From giving great directions and ideas of places to see, to telling great jokes, they were always there with a wonderful smile. They are laid-back, and yet you can really see how hard they work to make your experience the best it possibly can be. The room was spectacular! It was exceptionally clean and very tastefully decorated; a mix of modern simplicity and eloquence with a flair of traditional Texan/western themes. Think modern luxury meets longhorns and spurs. The room amenities were great; flatscreen tv's, cable, DVD player, i-pod player, refrigerator, a spacious bathroom complete with Jacuzzi bathtub, and a really awesome AC/heating unit. The bed was incredibly comfortable! I get lower back pain from sleeping on too cushy of mattresses. The bed was the perfect combination of comfort and firmness, allowing me to sleep the whole night through and play the whole next day with zero back issues. I highly recommend the Texas White House to anyone, and would love to stay here again.Beautifully decorated, super comfortable bed, really peaceful and serene place to stay. Lots of really tasty and highly-rated restaurants that are just walking distance from this place, too. I highly recommend this place to anyone who doesn't want to stay at just a regular hotel. I stayed in the Tejas room and it was perfect. Big kudos to this place!Before our daughter was born, we stayed at the Texas White House on our anniversary nights. In fact, we even stayed here when I was pregnant. On that trip, I fell asleep around 7:00 p.m. and can attest to the comfort of the bed since I was five months pregnant and slept all night! We have stayed in two rooms at this bed and breakfast; each one is unique and comfortable with their own bathrooms. Of course, I have to mention the food. They cook a filling, multi-course breakfast that is served in the main dining area. They will accomodate vegetarians or people with other dietary neeeds. Even though it's located directly across from Baylor, we always had fun kicking back with a glass of wine or a nice microbrew on the big porch. The Texas White House is a bit of an unknown secret in Fort Worth, but it is so worth the visit.I live in the neighborhood and whenever I have friends in town they stay here. The Longhorn Suite, has two beautiful rooms decorated in luxe-ranch stye. This seems to be the favorite! This is NOT your over- lacy, kitschy, antique-bomb just went off - Bed & Breakfast. Just tasteful furnishings and extremely comfortable. Kitty-corner to Finn McCools Pub, as an added bonus.We Stayed here back in September and had a wonderful experience. The rooms were very comfortable and clean and the breakfasts were delicious. The owners were very friendly and accommodating. We will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Fort Worth University Drive
review_content: I am a laid back traveler. I don't over plan. My bestest, however, is the absolute opposite. It works well for me because I know I'll be very well cared for and all I need to do is know where to show up and when and it'll be kick ass.A "road trip" to Fort Worth meant we just HAD to spend the night, right? Of course! So Megan found this hotel close to all the fun stuff we wanted to do this time, booked and all I needed was to plop down 1/2. This was a great little hotel. The room was clean, modern, and spacious. The bathroom was clean and perfect. We had more towels than we could use and the shower was hot and strong.Sometimes you just want a clean spot to rest your little head after a fun day, and really that's all we expected-- but this turned out to be way better than we imagined. Woot!Checked in late last night. Jamie at the front desk, was fabulous & friendly even given the late hour of my arrival. Room was clean, besides the trains horn blowing, I had a good nights sleep. Breakfast in the morning is very nice. Wearing my Eagles hat in Texas...I was met with nothing but Smiles, Good Mornings & How are you? Very impressed by everyone I came in contact with this morning. Compliments to the management, as well as the staff. Customer service is never easy...making people happy is sometimes harder than it should be. I will be back! Well done! Keep up the Good Work!My review is for a young staff member called "AJ".  I was at this hotel in March when it was snowing. I asked this guy at the desk, "Do you have anything I can use to scrape the snow off my car windows."  He immediately went outside to his OWN car and got the scraper. He was nicely dressed in shirt, tie, overcoat. He got soaked in snow while clearing my car. I kept saying, That's good enuff !  Go inside !  I tried to tip him $20 and he refused, saying, "I just want you to be safe, M'am"This guy was awesome. You wouldn't get this kind of treatment at the Ritz Carlton.So after this whole ordeal the manager, Tammy, emailed me saying how sorry she was and she told me she would add 10,000 points to our Rewards account to make up for our experience. It has been several months now and we have not received the points and when I emailed her about it I was ignored. I was willing to give this hotel another chance but that willingness is gone now. I would steer clear of this place!We were told they had actual suites, but that wasn't the case. We booked the hotel for my God sister's bridal party because it was across the street from the venue. Wish we hadn't. Its too small!! Next time we will ask multiple times to make sure we're getting what we're asking for....:/When I stay at a hotel near home, I'm usually only using it for the bed.  This means I don't really pay much attention to amenities and I'm all over finding a good price.  Because of this criteria, Marriott is the first brand I check.  And this version of Marriott went way above and beyond my need for just a bed.Despite being $20 more than normal thanks to the Cowtown Marathon, this Marriott brand brought the fancy.  From the welcome gifts of a bottle of water and a tissue paper sack of Hershey's kisses for a Marriott Elite member (nice touch, y'all!) to the fantastic continental breakfast options (oatmeal *and* fresh fruit in addition to the cold cereal, doughnuts and make-em-yerself waffles - seriously!) to the make-up remover wipes in the bathroom, this Marriott impressed the hell out of me.Marriott staff is usually very friendly and accommodating and the employees at this location certainly lived up to my expectations.  I'm also a fan of the front door only being accessible by a room key after a certain hour and that's SOP at this location.In short, the Fairfield Inn & Suites was exactly what I expect out of Marriott and it's exactly the reason I'm brand loyal.  Thanks for the hospitality, Fort Worth!Comfy and clean suites, located close to the main attractions  and restaurants but not a good location for daylight naps or light sleepers because the trains are in the front of hotel. Trains work around 5am-7pm Monday-Sunday.Stayed here for a conference nearby. The hotel staff was superb. When our shuttle to the conference was late the GM took a group of us in her personal vehicle to the conference so we wouldn't be late. From the fresh cookies to luggage storage...I was glad I landed here!Superior staff!  Was a pleasant suprise. Clean...friendly...comfortable. Will stay again next time in area.  Oh..and close to everything 'Ft Worth'This hotel is not good. Let me start by saying it is right next to the highway and a train runs behind it throughout the night. There is a lot of light in the room as well that are bright when all the lights are off. For example, the microwave, the smoke detector, the huge gap between the main door and the hallway, the TV, the clock radio. Rooms are too tight. We got no sleep. The rooms and bathroom need updating, as well as the pool area. Carpet looks bad. The breakfast area is super compact. We just grabbed food and left it was so crowded in the mornings. The one thing it has going for it is location, right next to the river and close to TCU. We've stayed here on two occasions and I will not be staying there next time.You may want to know that construction of a major building is going on 10 feet from this motel. We were awaken at 6:30 am Saturday by bulldozers, drills and hammers. If you stay here make SURE that you are guaranteed a room next to the river....unless early am wake up is ok for you. It was not ok for our teenagers on west coast time.Liked this place. I needed a last minute room out-of-the-blue and they delivered. Nothing fancy, but really nice and friendly. Quality rooms. Plus you can walk to Ol'South! :)Cozy night sleep for the money! Would stay there again.3.5 stars would work better for this rating.  Despite the age of the building and drab outward apperances, the interior was modern and comfortable.  As with a lot of hotels, common areas and bathrooms were hard to describe as completely clean.  I stayed in both a king executive suite and a standard room with two queen beds.Staff:The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful.  The housekeeping did a quick, bang-up job.  One thing I did notice, though, was that, despite there being a sign saying to conserve, the housekeeping did not comply.  The sign informed guests who wanted to reuse towels to only place those on the floor that you want removed.  Not above using a towel more than once, I always hung it up, but the housekeeping still took it, replacing it with a fresh towel.Indoor Pool / Hot Tub:I went down to the indoor pool area for a couple of nights during my stay.  The area was nearly always empty, perhaps because of the time of the year.  I did laps in the pool and then retreated to the hot tub.  The pool was clean and cold, but the coldness wore off once I began my laps.  The hot tub appeared dirty and in need of renovation.  The chlorine burned my eyes once the jets were turned on.  I did not return to the hot tub after my first time.King Executive Suite:Roomy and on the 4th floor (top floor).  It was nice and quiet.  Living area with couch, coffee table, large flat screen TV, digital A/C unit.  Nice big comfy bed with dimmer lighting above the bed - I particularly loved this feature.Standard 2 Queen Beds:Standard room on the 2nd floor with 2 queen beds and no couch or living area.  No dimmer switches above the beds.  Flat screen TV, though not as large as the king room.  A/C unit not digital, so it was more difficult to regulate the temperature.  Being on the 2nd floor, there was a floor above me, and it was LOUD.  I mean, I couldn't sleep it was so loud.  Whoever was in the room above me seemed to compulsively pace the floor all day and night, and I could hear every last bit of it through the creaky floor / ceiling.  I hated it, and if I return, will request a 4th floor room.Location:I really loved the location, as it was near a lot of nice places to eat.  The University Park Village, featuring yummy places to eat and fun places to shop, was right across the street!  The Botanical Gardens and Fort Worth Zoo are right down University, as well.  And it was just a hop, skip, and jump to downtown Sundance Square.The rooms here are surprisingly nice for being a Fairfield - I thought they were particularly great for a business traveler.  Nice separation between working and living space.  The staff was incredibly friendly and patient with helping me find directions in the area.  The location of the hotel is not in a aesthetically pleasing area, as it is immediately off the highway.  However, it is incredibly convenient to tons of shopping, restaurants, and TCU (only 1 mile away).  Breakfast is free for all guests and the staff does and excellent job of keeping the food stocked even when there are conferences and large waves of people in the morning.  The hotel does not sell wine/beer in the market like many Marriotts do - which is only slightly a downside.  There is a Macaroni Grill 30 seconds away so it's not too disappointing.I booked this hotel through Priceline, wanting to be in the downtown FW area, and I totally lucked out! My boyfriend and I just wanted a place to hang out for a get-away, and this was perfect. We were close to all of our favorite haunts: the Botanical Gardens, TCU, Spiral Diner, Sundance Square. It's located right behind Ol' South (which is an awesome local restaurant) and Macaroni Grill, so if you get lost in the vicinity (since it's set off University), just look for those landmarks. Yes, it's right by train tracks, but I didn't hear any at night (thank you, A/C) and actually found them quite pleasant. But maybe that's just me.The rooms were cheery, comfortable and clean. (The photos are accurate and give you a great idea of what to expect. No surprises.) Mini fridge and microwave in the room. Free outdoor parking was also a plus. I found the desk attendants to be appropriately friendly, nothing over the top. I was on the 4th floor, overlooking the parking lot, and didn't have any problem with noise/hearing other guests.We were just looking for a place to lay around and relax, and this hotel definitely served it's purpose!Great hotel conveniently located off of University Drive and I-30.  This hotel is tucked behind several restaurants but provides walking access to great food, the Fort Worth Zoo, and a great shopping center right across the street.  It's also located directly on the Trinity River, providing super easy access to the Trinity Trails (over 30 miles of nice jogging/biking trails).The decor of the hotel was modern and very comfortable - TV's in the lobby weren't too loud and there were lots of people just hanging out and reading the paper at breakfast, enjoying the lounge area.  My friends and I booked a King room and a King suite and both rooms were excellent - beds were SUPER comfy, something I'd expect in a 5star hotel.  The hotel even provided great makeup remover towelettes, something that most hotels don't have.  The staff was very attentive and friendly and it seemed like everyone was in a good mood!  Dave Moran is the general manager - you could tell he takes pride in his hotel and made us feel very welcome and at home.  I would probably prefer to stay at this hotel rather than hotels downtown from now on because of this hotel's great customer service, prime location, and comfortable rooms.  Highly recommended!!Ahhhh perfect stay as always I have been here for many years and as always great place

hotel_name: Hyatt Place Fort Worth Historic Stockyards
review_content: Wish my wife and I were not passing through just for the night and that we could have stayed longer. The Hyatt is smack dab in the middle of all the Stockyards action and an easy short walk to whatever you want to see there. We arrived just at sunset on a quiet Thursday weeknight and snagged one of a handful of parking spots right out front. I am told they have a  much larger parking area out back. Check-in was quick and easy. The front desk staff were super friendly and helped us with directions to our nearby dinner place. They also filled us in on all the activities including the twice daily cattle drive that we would unfortunately miss. It had been a while since I had stayed at a Hyatt Place. I found the room very comfortable and enjoyed the little living room area. You can tell these rooms went through a lengthy design process as everything seems to be in the perfect spot with opening doors clearing furniture by like an inch. The room was fairly quiet but there are freight trains coming through there all night long. They do supply ear plugs in the room but we didn't need them. On our way out we grabbed a few things at the included breakfast buffet. They even had some hot items there as well. Nicely done.Came here for a conference. Really great hotel that is located in the stockyards. There is a shopping and dining plaza on one side of the hotel and a barn on the other side! I thought i'd be kept up by the noise but didn't hear a thing. The rooms are very spacious and clean. My favorite thing is the bed. Holy moly, I slept so well... When my alarm went off I literally thought I was at home for a second because the bed was that comfortable. Second favorite thing is the amazing water pressure in the shower. You know how most hotels have that soft water or drips where it feels like your showering in mist? Well here you're getting a proper shower.Staff is very attentive and they are on their A game with customer service. Great experience.During our 2 week stay in Texas this was the absolute best hotel we stayed at. I would recommend anyone who is going to the Stockyards to stay here. Hubby and I decided to take a very rare (once in 3 years) night alone when we were in TX. You walk outside the front door toward the street and you're in the middle of all the action. Basically you get to see a few cowboys get a bunch of long horns down the historic street. Afterwards there are several people on the side of the road with trained long horns taking money from tourists so they can take a picture with a long horn.There's also plenty of cute little shops nearby with unique Billy Bob's logo on it and interesting places to visit. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting Billy Bobs!Don't come to Ft Worth and miss the albeit touristy Stockyards, but such fun.This is such a fabulous property. Get a room overlooking the stockyards high floor. This place appears to be brand new in 2015. Very modern and yet with a nice cowboy flavor. FREE WIFIFREE BREAKFASTFREE PARKINGALL SUITES? Clean & modern.And they even sell drinks and food and StarbucksRooms are a bit small but beautiful.  Great bar with food & everything else you'd expect from a hotel.I remember it was one of the best night sleep I have had at a hotel. The location was great walking to the bars at the stockyard the service was great and food was very good at the bar in the hotel and they had a saltwater pool which was better than most.the only item was the rooms were a bit small besides that everything was greatWe stayed here one night before heading to grandparent pick-up/drop-off for some summer visitation. The first thing we noticed and loved about this hotel... they have a saltwater pool. HOW COOL is that! As the others reviews state, they are smack in the middle of stockyards and walking distance to a lot of things. The hotel is decorated to fit the area. I find it funny that someone wrote a review and complained about the leather smell... Paalease dude. You are in the historic stockyards what would you expect. You are staying in Giddy-up country. Hotel was great. Staff was not as yee haw friendly as other Texas Hyatt's but I wasn't expecting perfection. The rooms are great, the beds are comfortable and we LOVED the saltwater pool!I am staying here for a conference downtown. I love this hotel and its location is so convenient to the stockyard attractions and a quick drive to downtown. Great breakfast and I don't have to walk to a Starbucks, it's here! Love the pool. Free parking. The only negative is that the hotel shuttle, which does take you downtown, does not run until 8am which is no good if you need to be at a conference downtown at that time.This hotel is located in the middle of the the stockyards. It is within a couple mins walk of many attractions. The hotel has a view of the stockyards or downtown Dallas Fort Worth. The hotel was fun and the staff is very welcoming. They have complimentary disposal headphones in the gym, which is awesome! Another perk is a large complimentary basket of personal items in case you forgot to pack them. Otherwise they allow you to borrow items such as phone chargers. Breakfast is also complimentary. They have a hot and cold menu. And you can't go wrong with a Starbucks cafe there. Parking is behind the hotel and requires a key card for entry.I stay here every couple of months and I am particular.  The location is the best part of this hotel.  It is in the middle of the stockyards area.  Walking distance to any place in the stockyards.   The hotel has a western decor.  Love it.  The rooms are your basic Hyatt ace rooms.  They have upgraded the bedspreads to very nice white cotton coverings.Great location, but always an issue here!  This time it was housekeeping issues and A/C problems.  Really nice hotel, but they need to get their act together with maintenance and housekeeping.  We stay in Ft. Worth every 6 months or so and I think it's time to find a new hotel.Nice place, staff were really good although at check in, she couldnt muster a smile.  come on, its your job to be friendly. if you arnt a friendly person, dont do that job. room was good, clean and everything worked as expected.  i forgot toothpaste and they gladly provided it. my favorite was the location in the heart of rodeo land.  i got out of my car and smelled horses!  enjoy!My wife and I stayed here last night...it was our second stay....I think they do a good job and the location is good...if you enjoy cowboy stuff and good steak your will enjoy.Smack dab in the middle of carnivore heaven- the Stockyards.  Within stumbling distance of all the restaurants and lil shops.  If you're a light sleeper- forget about it!  The train tracks are within a stones throw and the trains run randomly till the wee hours.  So unless you pass out from a drunken stupor I would not recommend staying here.Normally, I'd give this place three stars. However, I deducted a star b/c every time I stayed here, and walked through its doors, a smell of leather/cowhide would just punch me in the face. Gross.That said, the staff recognized me after a few stays (not sure if its b/c I'm probably one of few Asian regulars), and they were always pretty nice. Not the quickest of workers, but, still, pretty nice.This place is clean and has easy check-in/check-out. Important things in my book when traveling!  Plus great location and all of the staff that I encountered where very polite and helpful. Breakfast is exactly what you would expect for a free continental breakfast.  I did like that they had someone in the area assisting and cleaning up as the people grabbed their breakfast... definitely a plus that you don't always see.This place is ok. They have free apples.Great hotel, friendly staff, great and clean rooms.

Great hotel with great staff. Hotel is very clean and room was spacious. We were traveling in for a Cowboys game and the staff let us check in early so we could rest up for the game. That was greatly appreciated. The only reason I am giving 4 stars is because the breakfast wasn't all that great. I would recommend this hotel.We stayed here recently for a few nights. It's hard to write reviews when I have a mixed experience. The housekeeping staff were great - our room was cleaned and organized each day and I felt like they did a good job. For the most part, our stay was quiet, with the exception of an occasional slammed door. The elevators were pretty quick, granted we were only on the second floor. Breakfast was really good - there were lots of options, including breakfast sandwiches and oatmeal with plenty of toppings. Everything that I tasted was good. The highchairs were hidden, but I just had to ask and someone got one for me right away.For some reason, they have spotlights directed straight up in to the windows of the guestrooms. It wouldn't be that bad if the curtains closed all the way and didn't leave a gap in the middle for that bright light to shine in the room all night - no blackout for us. The thing that really upset me was when we came down to breakfast and sat next to a couple with a young daughter (she was maybe 2, but probably not even quite that old). The family themselves were fine, but when they left and their toddler had of course left a bit of a mess, an employee (whom I assume was a manager based on how I saw her interact with other staff) walked over and audibly said "Oh my God!" And then loudly called over to another employee "Look at this. That is so disrespectful." 1. Super unprofessional. There are a number of better ways she could have handled the situation. 2. It was a mess left by a toddler at a table there for eating at. It happens. It could have easily been my kids. In fact, I'm sure my kids probably left a mess. And I bet she griped about that out loud, in front of guests, to another employee, too. That really put a bad taste in my mouth for this place.Solid hotel at a solid price. Some of the design feels forced, and also as if this were a cheapo hotel that got a face lift and new name. The elevators are obnoxiously slow. Even the elevator doors seem to open slower than a castles gates. The breakfast the 1st day here's was on par, but when we hit the sellout weekend dates it lost quality and flavor. Parking is ample. Rooms are big enough. The staff cleans well. Overall it's hardly the best or worst hotel I've stayed in. Also the doors slam hard and loud. Thank god my daughter can sleep though anything.Some good points,  some bad. I wouldn't recommend and wouldn't stay again.Bad - Internet was 0.2Mb. Basically third world status and front desk didn't care. Completely unusable. Eggs and overall continental breakfast were disgusting and inedible.  Worse than any I've ever eaten.Good - Rooms are clean, spacious, and up to date.  They also have panels to plug in devices to the TV.  Bathroom is very tight but clean and nice.  Common areas are well decorated and up to date as well.Unwelcome stay at the Hyatt. Made a reservation for a king size room and got a two full size beds instead, when we brought this up to the front desk all they did was brush us off. Room smelled like urine and breakfast was mediocre at best.Very clean, and very comfortable!  A colleague and I stayed over night while we were in town for a gig at the adjacent convention hall.  The staff was very friendly, and the rooms come with free wifi and a breakfast buffet that was really pretty good!My family lives  in Hurst, this is a central location to all my relatives. Within fives minutes I can be in someones home. So of course it makes since to stay here! Easy to book, easy checkin and out, great rooms, very spacious, clean and fresh! We had fifth floor this time with a view, very nice! There is free breakfast, news papers, and for late nites a snack bar in lobby with fresh stuff!Staff is friendly, clean rooms, cental location.My family and I spent 2 nights (9 & 10 Feb 15) and had a great time. There was a total of 17 of us in the group. They managed to get us on the same floor and our rooms grouped together. While we were visiting with each other, the management noticed that the lobby area was a little small for our group. So they opened up one of their meeting rooms and provided some snacks for us. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The food from their 24/7 menu was great! The breakfast that they provided each morning is the best I've had at a hotel. The rooms were roomy and clean. I really liked the sitting area in the rooms. If I'm ever in the Ft. Worth area, I would definitely stay here again.I had the pleasure of being the first guest in a newly renovated room.   The new couch has a sleek look, and the new tile design is fresh and clean.   This was a larger room and had a cafe table inside, and enough room next to the couch to store luggage for six people.    I love Hyatt Place anywhere, and was perfectly happy to be on a floor with lots of nice construction workers around...Nice rooms but DO NOT let them put you in the room 4 steps from the elevator and on the front side of the hotel.  The police station, construction, and the people talking coming out of the elevator make for 2 nights of no sleep.  Staff knew exactly what room I was in without even looking when I said "thats a horrible place for a room."  Did nothing but agree with me that it was a bad location.  Will not stay here again.I travel a lot. The Hyatt place hotels look identical on the inside. So far I have not found one different.Just spent a couple of nights here and was very impressed!  The room we stayed in was very roomy and very nice.  Breakfast was delicious and had a nice variety of foods to choose from :)Room was very average.   Hotel hallways were dirty and we stayed several nights.... they were never cleanedBreakfast was horrible. .. down right nasty.  Dirty dishes.... blehStay elsewhere.  There are two hotel right next door.Very Impressed.  Outstanding value.The hotel and rooms are clean, updated and quite modern.  Really like the separate seating area.  The breakfast bar was good quality with fresh fruits and decent selection.Service was also very attentive.
