We will stay here again when in the area.I've had the opportunity to stay at multiple Hyatt Place's in and around the US. I've had the opportunity to stay at the one in Hurst/Fort Worth twice and cannot say enough about what a fantastic hotel it is.Both times have been before the Cowtown Marathon - although it's within 45 minutes to an hour driving distance, we prefer to get a good nights rest and get that extra hour of sleep. It's located off of 183 and 121, within 10 minutes from Downtown Fort Worth. All Hyatt Places were previously other Hyatt hotels that were completely renovated. All HP's have the same layout - walk into a nice plush lounge on the left side. The concierge desk is straight ahead, with a small bar and food area to the right. Rooms are fantastic - great leather L-shaped sofa in one room, that's also a pull-out bed. Small mini-bar and a desk also adorn this adjacent room. A 46" flat screen adorns the middle of the room - visible both on the couch and the beds. A barrier wall separates the couch from the beds, just enough privacy if you're trying to get enough sleep. The beds are comfy, pillows plush. Nice granite countertops in the restroom with nice hardware. The soap is a step up above the usual hotel soap, as is the shampoo. It's not what you have at home, but it beats the awful normal hotel stuff that dries out your skin. The toilet and shower are in the same room - slightly smaller than one would like, but then again, you're not spending very much time in the bathroom.What sets the hotel well above any of it's competitors in terms of cleanliness, modernness, and amenities - the price. Regardless of where it's at, rooms average around $89 a night. I've spent a lot of time traveling for work, and stayed at various Hilton, Marriott, and Choice Hotels - none of them in that price range come close. Even their comparable hotels are at least $50-$70 a night more expensive. Hell, it's barely a another $20 a night over a cheap motel. You cannot find a better, newer, nicer hotel anywhere for this price. Regardless of where I go or stay now, I always look for a Hyatt Place. This place rocks!I just completed a three night stay and I wasn't overly impressed. We stayed Thur-Fri-Sat. The first thing I noticed is that the parking is quite good and the staff is quite friendly. My first impression of our room on the fifth floor was quite good. It was a fairly large and set up as a two room suite. It included a nice desk, small fridge, large sofa, big enough for comfortable sleeping and a nice coffee area with a sink and small stainless fridge. Quite a good first impression. However, as time passed we noticed issues. The carpet was dirty. The fridge couldn't get really cold but more than anything else the air-conditioning was loud and obnoxious. The bathroom is small, really small by American standards and the TV has too few channels. Then the breakfast Friday morning was almost inedible. Actually the worst I've ever had. Could it be that the "good food was gone by 9:30? All the while we found the staff very friendly and very helpful so I think they are doing their part but I wonder of management or owners are trying to skim to much profit or have too much debt and don't spend enough money in some areas. Still there must be better choices.Very nice and beautiful hotel. I highly recommend this hotel. Very clean and comfortable.Excellent rooms, lobby, 24 food service, complimentary breakfast! It feels like a vegas hotel. Big screen TV, very very clean!! Love this hotelThis was the first Hyatt Place I have stayed at and I must say it is a really cool concept.  I've stayed in fancier hotel rooms and bigger hotel rooms but this was the coolest room.  Very modern furnishings and a large flat screen tv.  The staff were very friendly and helpful also.We were in town for a  reunion, and I was looking for a place that was close to our family. The staff welcomed us warmly and quickly checked us in. The room was decorated modernly and was plenty spacious. Breakfast is served every morning and is your typical cold cereal/bagel variety. Given that this is a medium priced chain, I was impressed with the atmosphere and level of service.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott  West at Cityview
review_content: This hotel beats all others in the area on decor, customer service, and amenities. We had to stay for one night and enjoyed every minute of it. The beds were plush, the rooms were exceptional and the hotel had activities such as miniature golf to add excitement to your stay. I would stay here again any day of the week.Been staying at this Marriott while in Fort Worth and so far it's not bad. My room was clean and bed is comfortable. Now the pillows, that's a different story. For me they are too soft. I like some kind of firmness in my pillows. I just sink right into the pillow. Makes me feel like I have a big head. LOL The place is clean inside and freezing in the hallways as all hotels are. The one thing I do not like is their thin walls. I mean I could here the person from upstairs walk around, or they have a heavy ass feet. OMG it was annoying. It started to irritate me because this person wakes up at 2, 4, 6 am and stomp stomp stomp. UggghhhThe people here are friendly. Always greeting you and they serve Starbucks products. Quite frankly I'm not a fan of it so I go to the real Starbucks. They also have a patio in the back for you to enjoy. You are surrounded by so many choices of restaurants and there is a mall near by. Not the best mall but I'll save that for my next review. If the Hilton next door is not available, I will def be staying here again.Very clean. Great parking. Friendly staff. Putting green with a beautiful outdoor sitting area with ponds. The pool was heated and comfortable indoors. Our room was the executive king that had a sitting area with a pull out sofa. Bed and sofa sleeper was comfortable. The bathroom was a little dark however was a great size and very clean. Would stay here again.I'm somewhere between A-OK, and Yes, I'm a fan; but I don't have an option for 3.5 stars. So let me explain.The hotel staff are uniformly courteous and helpful. The facility is generally kept clean*. Parking is convenient and the location works because of proximity to my son's residence.Here's the "but." But, second to location I shop for hotels with hot tubs. This hotel's information lists a hot tub, but in three visits over six months it's never been hot. In the prior two visits the timer didn't work, but since has been repaired. I take credit for the repair since my previous correspondence to Marriott listed, among other things, the need for this timer to be put back into service. If not for me, for some other schmuck who might stay too long and have to be dragged out. The timer, i know, doesn't force the guest to use common sense, but is a reminder he or she has been in fifteen minutes.During last week's visit I again had to visit the front desk because the key card, following check-in, consistently would not open the door to the pool / hot tub area. Yes, in January, February, and now July, the key card opens other doors with card readers, but not the pool area. This is not necessarily a reason to look elsewhere, but why can they not get this fixed? It's likely a hardware issue with the card reader on that door, or the encoder at the desk, or perhaps, training. It's a nuisance and upon entry to the pool area reinforces my disdain for the non-properly functioning spa.Back to hot tub. I finally located a thermometer mounted in the drain cover on the opposite side of the hot tub from a sign reading "Do not use spa if temperature is above 104 (degrees) F." I was therefore able to confirm my suspicion of the spa's temperature being mid-90's via the "hiding in plain sight" thermometer's reading of 94 degrees. I suspect it's been no hotter than mid-nineties during the other visits as well.This past Sunday I again gained entry following the obligatory visit to the front desk whereby the very helpful desk attendant didn't go with me and provide access with his key card; he reprogrammed both my key cards (yes, I took both just to have a back-up). Reprogramming didn't work which forced another visit to the desk where this time, he gave me a third key which did provide access. The spa set idle with no working jets or timer. Visit the front desk a third time which resulted in a circuit breaker reset and the jets sprang to life, churning some fairly sudsy water.*After a few moments of watching suds I noticed bubbles with a gray colored spooge migrating to the top. The spooge grew proportionally to the increasing size of the bubble field, so at this sight, I left the area.I say all this to say I'll probably look for accommodations elsewhere during my next visit, and will encourage Marriott, if asked, to remove the spa from this location and fill it with concrete. Because ninety-four degrees does not a "hot" tub make, and whatever challenges are inherent with this equipment, it's too great for the resources of the all mighty Marriott Corporation to surmount.Also, fix the card access!Even though I had many questions Benjamin was very friendly and courteous and did his job with great ease. I would definitely recommend to a friend!I had a one night in/out business stay here. As others have noted the rooms can be noisy and I swear I could hear the person next door snoring. They do have a nice updated lobby, with daily drink specials and a Starbucks which is key. They must have also updated the rooms as everything in my room looked brand new. The room came equipped with a nice mini fridge and a new big screen TV. Their fitness center was clean and well equipped. Staff was helpful my check in/out was a breeze. One thing that did bug me was their Internet and business center network, both sucked lemons. Luckily I have a MiFi so I was able to work as their network access was slow. Their business center computers are running Windows Vista and I swear they are all infected and loaded with span programs. It took me about 10 minutes to pront out a boarding pass. I ended up just downloading my boarding pass to my phone. Hey Marriott clean up your network access and lobby PCs.  If you do stay here make sure you request a room not facing the Hwy. I have to return to this area later in Sept and will stay at this Marriott property again.In typical Marriott tradition they've renovated the lobby and did nothing with the guest rooms. I could hear the TV in the room next to me all night. The water smelled terrible. If train horns are not your thing you may not want to stay here. The staff was friendly.If you stay here go to the WoodShed across the street, great food.Clean, nice rooms. The foyer just had a makeover and the continental breakfast isn't too bad.. For the price Id come back here...One downside, the last time I stayed here the internet was dead slow. My 3g worked faster than their free useless wifi.I was here for a two night stay.  Perhaps my neighbors were just quiet, but noise was not an issue.  The room was clean and  had updated contemporary, comfortable furnishings in restful, attractive colors.  Excellent bedding.  Appealing lobby/bistro area.  Pleasant personnel. Attended a small conference.  Banquet food was tasty. Shopping conveniently located nearby.Minor quibble is that the in room information sheet states there is complementary morning coffee in the lobby, but that has been discontinued.  I felt for $99 it was a good value.Courtyard City View.  Great new format and nice new rooms.  Love the "backyard oasis".  Close to shopping and a free pass at the local gym.

hotel_name: Residence Inn Fort Worth Fossil Creek
review_content: We stayed here during the Thanksgiving holiday to visit our daughter at TCU.  It is not close to campus, but most of the other properties close to TCU were booked, expensive, or not habitable.Overall a great experience.  The rooms are sized well, the living room, and "kitchen" area are clean and laid out well.  The bedroom/bathroom are sized well, and there is plenty of closet and storage space if you are going to be staying for a few days.The staff is friendly and efficient, there is a pool and small gym area.  The breakfast is not over the top with variety, but enough to satisfy everyones taste.There is are several restaurants and a movie theater within walking distance, and freeway access is very good.Highly recommended for business, family or leisure visitors.I booked a suite because I'm an early riser and my husband is not. I like the idea of being able to get up and move around without disturbing him. The room is nice and clean. A couple of drawers in the bathroom area are broken. It does come with a full refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave, coffee maker and a tv in both rooms.  Plenty of parking. Kara, at the front desk was very polite and helpful. There is a lot of construction in the area so traffic is heavy, at least on Friday afternoon.  We would probably stay again. Will wait to see how the rest of the stay goes.Poor customer follow up (Mary) from the front desk.  That is enough to keep me away for good.PROS-  Customer relations, Helpful staff,  Very comfortable bedding and pillows, decent shower water pressure. CONS- Outside parking under construction,  not enough garbage pails for a two room suite. room not serviced properly. The front desk was very nice and helpful. We wanted a room near the pool, they gave us one, but the key card mechanism for the door was not working properly. She apologized and since we had to get a room further away, she upgraded us to a two room suite for the same price. Everything was what a hotel should be including the front desk printing out my boarding passes for me. As stated above, parking lot under construction, but I didn't drive, so not an issue for me. Only problem (which may have just been miscommunication) I wasn't ready for room service so I had my girlfriend tell the maid not to service the room. When I was done getting ready for the day, I told the same maid that it was okay now to service the room, but when I came back to the room later only the garbage was emptied. The table still had some crumbs on it from our breakfast and the beds (that I made quickly and sloppy) were not remade properly. Also only garbage pails are in the bathrooms, so I had to keep running back to the bathroom or carry a pail around with me if I plan to make something in the kitchen or hang in the living room. But these issues are minor for what I feel is important for a good hotel, so I"m giving them 4 stars. Nice overall stay.I stayed here for a night while moving cross country and finding this hotel was such a relief after staying in a not so clean hotel the night before. The parking lot was big enough for our large moving truck and the room was very clean. The room even had a small kitchen and living area. There are also a lot of restaurants and a gas station by the hotel which is convenient for travelers. The staff was friendly, clean hotel that allows pets (hard to find!) and in a good area.We recently stayed here for a weekend while on a trip to Fort Worth for a bodybuilding competition in downtown.  The hotel was about 10mi away down 35 and we had no problems going to & from.  The hotel lobby & room was bright and clean.  Room had a kitchenette which was a requirement for us.  Nice little living room area to relax in then doors that closed the bedroom with an additional tv in there.  We arrived about an hour before check-in and the front desk clerk had no issues with finding me a room that was ready.  Great guest service.  Hot breakfast had a basic variety of eggs, sausage, biscuits, and diy waffles.  Overall a nice hotel for a very inexpensive price, would definitely stay again!This is the only place in town I could find that would accept pets. The staff was amazingly friendly and welcoming. 5 miles from stockyards.Surprisingly a nice hotel. Would recommend it to anyone looking for a decent room in a good area. Don't order food from outside establishments unless you have someone to help you carry it!! Had to run through a lightning storm to meet the food delivery guy at the front desk and was told by the front desk that it was for "my security". Oh really so running through a rainstorm and lightning crashing down around me is secure to you? All she wanted to do was argue with me about why it was for the guests security when it was a full blown sever storm going on. And if I wanted to pay for delivery and then yet walk to the front desk I would have just ordered take out and skipped the tip and the delivery drivers time. It's these little things that get on my nerves about the rules these places enforce. Would I go back Yes it was a above average stay. Next time though I wouldn't be running through the storm risking getting struck by lightning they could either deliver to the room or don't deliver it at all. Laundry facilitGreat place very friendly, very customer orientatedgreat place to relax after a long day @ work.would be 5/5 if:1. more chicken/turkey/veg options at evening snacks2. better wine/beer selection at evening snacks

hotel_name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Fort Worth - Lake Worth
review_content: I had to make a last minute hotel reservation and a lot of hotels were already booked. I don't think I've ever stayed at a La Quinta Inn before since in my mind I have never given that chain any respect. Well after staying there for a couple of nights I have changed my mind.I enjoyed my stay and the room. Although it didn't start out too well. They didn't have my reservation but since I've done a lot of traveling I'm accustomed to getting a confirmation number. My name was spelled horribly wrong. My last name starts with a D and the foreign sounding dude that took my phone reservation spelled it with an A with some new type of weird spelling. Maybe it was spelled using the Klingon language, it was that far off. Fortunately Larisa made everything alright. Larisa - You Rock!I had a king bed with a Jack and Jill bathroom with a gorgeous view of Lake Worth. There was a separate living room area with a pull out couch. They had free wi-fi. I never tried their continental breakfast so I can't help you on that one.I would definitely stay here again.One huge disappointment this time. The room was very musty and not fresh smelling. There was also some hair in the toilet and the sink. I do have to say the bed was comfortable, and it was very quiet at night which is very important to me. I was able to maintain a perfect temperature in the room. During the middle of the day I encountered a thug in the parking lot switching license plates from one car to another with a screwdriver. I called the hotel desk, I walked outside but the guy got away without them doing anything about it. There needs to be more security at this hotel.Overall visit was good. The girl at front counter didn't say much when she checked us in. Rooms were clean and nice. Breakfast was good but could definitely use some improvements. Would book again.This has been the absolutely worst hotel experience with regards to customer service. I travel a lot and trusted the ratings on this hotel. I work for a large agency that direct bills. Literally I was held hostage at the counter by a bullish employee. She made me wait while she called the general manager because I objected to giving her a CC on a direct bill. The wait was terrible. The wifi did not work. The TV remote did not work. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else.Last night there was a power outage in our neighborhood,  we waited for a couple of hours with the belief that they would be out to fix it that same night, but as expected they didn't so I decided to get two rooms at LQ I tried to book it online and was unable to, so I figured I'd just do it at the location I had decided we would stay, the front desk clerk was on the phone with a guest when I arrived so I waited till he was done and told him I needed two rooms and need to do it with my return points so he proceeded to book the rooms and put a hold on my debit card for the cost of the rooms before he finished with my transactions I asked him again this is going on my reward and there won't be an actual charge to my debit card he said yes it will be removed at checkout. ... well it wasn't I spoke to the manager about and she told me you can't use rewards when you book at the location you can only do that online. . I asked now why would the clerk last night not tell me that her response was maybe he just didn't know how it works and I was absolutely flabbergasted what!! Why would you have someone that doesn't know one of the main things about LQ the rewards program,  not only was the room not up to standard but the manager only gave me credit for one room and also seemed like she really didn't care about my situation, so in order to get things resolved I had to call the complaint department to see if I could have the matter resolved. .. This has been the worst location of LQ I have stayed at and mind you the temps have been in the triple digits and I should have been able to have a good nights rest and a wonderful morning Stress Free but No early stress and a major headache.Very clean and a nice location. Staff was friendly and very helpful.The only thing that keeps this from getting 5 stars is that if you have a trailer you are going to find parking pretty difficult if the place is anywhere near full. And if you have a 5th-wheel or gooseneck trailer, DO NOT try to use the rear parking lot lower entrance or you will probably crunch your truck bed. Very steep entrance/departure angle.Other than that, I would recommend them highly! La Quinta's are my go-to hotel because we travel with our pet and I always look for them first for just that reason.It was an ok Suites but there were a couple things that take a star away.  The breakfast was a little lame for a Suites.  Just some rubbery egg patties and rubbery bacon.  Also, the first room they put me in had a great view...of nothing but the red roof of the entry drive.  I had to ask them to move me to another room.  The TVs are small and don't have a very good picture and the outlets are screwy.  If you turn the light at the entry way off, then all but one of the plugs next to the bed turn off, too, so you can either charge your phone or have the alarm clock plugged in, but not both.  It was clean and pretty and the staff were nice, it was just those little annoying things that dropped it down a star.Great experience.  Very clean and super friendly staff.  They gave my wife and I a chocolate chip cookie when we checked in (awesome after a long road trip).If you are looking for a budget motel for a night's stay in Fort Worth, this is a good spot.  Our room had a flat-screen with HBO, the bed was comfortable, and everything was clean.  They offered free breakfast, but, we didn't partake.They do allow dogs at this hotel.  We didn't hear any while in the room, but, could hear them while walking up and down the halls.Clean place.  Good condition.  Friendly staff.  Dog friendly but rooms are very quiet.  A+.First time staying at a La Quinta Inn.  I got an excellent deal at Booking Dot Com for a 2 Queen room for 2 nights.  The property is freeway close, and there are many close options for food, shopping, gas, etc.  The property is very quiet, and clean.  The staff is extremely friendly and helpful.  There is a free breakfast in the morning.  Very basic, eggs, bacon, fresh waffles, juice, muffins, breads, coffee, but saves you money if you are travelling with a family.WiFi is available in the room and is pretty quick.  It is a no smoking property, so everything looks and smells very fresh.  There is an outdoor pool, but did not see much use even in 90 degree weather.Overall a very nice and comfortable stay at a great price.Very clean and reasonably priced.  The amenities were very good.  They ran out of some breakfast items one morning but we were eating out that morning anyway but heard some others complaining.  The pillows were ROCK hard.  I will stay there again when in the area.This inn is very clean and has friendly staff.  It is about 15 minutes from Fort Worth.  I recommend staying here.This place is new and shiny.  Everything is clean and neat .. great service.  Nice location.

hotel_name: Extended Stay America - Fort Worth - Southwest
review_content: Having stayed at several different extended stay hotels, this is the best bang for your buck. Full kitchen with oven and stovetop.  Fitness room with WORKING equipment and a nice clean pool. I got the studio suite whuch includes a recliner for my PM naps and a sofa sleeper for friends that come visit. Closet was big enough for a clothes horse like me and lots of drawers ladies. It could use an update but I bet once they do that they will be increasing the rate.    Have to take a star away for the multiple weeks of incorrect billing or somebody forgot to bill on the right day so I got billed for 8 days instead of 7. Just totally messed up my company reimbursement for the first 6 weeks. Once the new manager Jessica took over my billing I magically got billed correctly.  Thanks to her. Highly recommended. Thanks Fort Worth. It was fun while it lastedEnjoyed our one night stay here. I came to town to visit my son and made online booking here for a really good "express deals" rate from "Priceline.com". The couch could of been cleaned as it was dingy and the entire elevator and 3rd floor  smelled of cigarettes,  BUT other than that, the stay was perfect.I ended up staying here after getting a $33/night deal on Priceline. The room itself, a queen deluxe suite, was clean. The only problem I has was the room smelled musty and like mildew during my entire weeklong stay. We got rid of our used towels, bought a candle, and even propped open door occasionally but the smell wouldn't go away. I guess this is another example of getting what you pay for :(Easy to get to, clean, comfortable room. Right next door to Target. Breakfast is instant oatmeal, muffins, granola bars, and coffee. I did an Express Deal with Priceline for $36 and am extremely pleased with the room. Front desk is helpful and nice. Would definitely stay here again.The chair was split wide open, hopefully this gives you an idea. But it's right next to food carts. So this makes it hip.Here we are.  I am working nights and I did not feel like having Luis drive us back to our apartment in Arlington, TX and it is Luis spring break.  We paid $137.98 for (3) nights all in.  The first night we were given room 231.  The tv was too archaic to have hook ups for Luis new PS3 player and since it is his spring break this was really important to him to have hook ups.  Management transferred us to room 119 and it does have hook ups, but the room reeks of smoke:( Yuck!  We have to run the a/c just to circulate the smoky air.  Thank goodness we like to sleep in a cool room  The room has a large refrig.  We are keeping Cokes and oranges.  We have been going to Lone Star Oyster bar and Chipoltle.  I was able to get an oil change around the corner at Goodyear, $34, expensive, but convenient!  Tomorrow we are getting a serpentine belt and rear shock attention on the mini van and since Goodyear is right around the corner from Extended Stay the service fellow will drop me off:)  So far this location is working for us, but still have the smoky smell.  It is quite even though there are some little boys who run around the complex w/o supervision.  Sadly for the young fellas hotel livin is just not conducive for child raising.  Some guest has a pitbull here.  The dog is friendly, but come on, it is a pitbull.  Sometimes the little fella has command of it?Parking is ample here.  I will probably go to Central Market tomorrow. It is up by I-30 and this hotel is down near I-20.  It is 4.4 miles away.  The sheets are so cheap and plastic that i'll probably go to Anna's linens or Tuesday Morning and get some flannel sheets.  I really can't stand plastic sheets, but you get what you pay for.  There is a LaQuinta and Marriott Courtyard near hear, but I don't wanna pay there fees.  La Quinta is $109 after tax and the price goes up as their booking go up. I went to see a La Quinta room and the Extended Stay America room is much larger and more amenable for a claustrophobic person like myself.  The shower is awesome!   The water is plentiful and stays hot.  Luis said the water got cooler during his shower so you gotta take your shower in the middle of the day if constant hot water is important to you.It   is just like being under a rainfall.  The shower head is very high so you all of your body gets wet.   I left for work feeling awesome and happy.Well management WOKE ME UP ON THE TELE THIS MORNING!:(  They asked if I would be staying and they want another $68 if we are?  Huh! We told the check-in girl that we would be staying (3) nights and she said that wil be $137.98.  Well as it turns out today's managers want another $68.99 for tonight b/c the initial lady miscalculated even though we went thru our entire itinerary with her and told her that we would be leaving Thursday.  She only charged us for (2) nights rather than the (3) that she said we could have at this rate.  I wish I had a tape recorder.  She also quoted this price prior to our coming.  She told Luis that she only had (1) room left when he talked to her initially.  He was so nervous that we were gonna loose the (1) room.  I told him calm down.  I used to be in sales.  Well if you l like being low-balled then this is your hotel.  When the Goodyear people come to pick us up, then we are gonna go look at the Hyatt and LaQuinta.  I will be doing a yelp on the Goodyear as well.  Read that one.I would definitely stay at the Extended Stay America again b/c it is so close to the hospital that I am working at occasionally.  It was also quiet during the time that we stayed.  I did not have to walk very far from the front door to our room and I liked that as well.  I am searching some other hotels for a better rate though since I am just coming for work.Stop!  Do not book a stay here.  Some rooms have been updated but do not expect that updated room.  So many complaints about the stay.  The room was filthy, the rugs were stained, the couch smelled like a barn, the laminated floor was torn and both of my parents tripped and one fell.  I reported this serious incident at the front desk and nothing was done.  No report filed and no floor repairs made.  Mildew in the bathroom, fuzzy television reception and unlocked entrances to the hotel for all kinds of people to enter during non-business hours.   Dogs barking all night (pet-friendly hotel) and dog feces littered the hallways as well as a lingering fried fish smell everyday.  Massive wires hanging out from under the AC unit.  I went to Corporate and was able to vacate early but not without the hotel charging my credit card soo many times that my bank called me.  It took several calls and a lot of valuable time to get the charges credited.  Save yourself the hassle and do not stay here.Despite being overwhelmingly generic and in a lame part of FTW, this place was def both affordable and comfortable.  The downsides: hallways that reeked of smoke and bacon/french fry/something else smells, a broken treadmill, and undrinkable coffee.  The plus sides: a dvd player hooked up to every tv (yes!) and the mandatory free wifi.If you have a pet DO NOT STAY HERE!  They say they are pet friendly, but honestly not really.  They only clean the room once/week on the day you check in the next week.  So the 1st cleaning comes and oops the housekeeping staff does NOT show up.  So somehow it is my fault they tried to clean my room the next day and I wasn't there.  Someone touched my sleeping cat, and something happened.  Then that person refused to clean my room.  It took almost 3 weeks for someone to come clean my room.  I had to do it myself, change my sheets, get fresh towels.  UGH - the staff was NOT all friendly either - some were, others were not.  I had talked to manager and regional manager to arrange specific times for me to be there for a cleaning - and no one seemed to communicate that to the hotel.  It was annoying.  When I complained to corporate, that never was followed up on.  I did finally contact someone at corporate and she gave me a "free ngiht"!  After a month with one cleaning and a lot of crap - not sure if it is worth it.  I will NOT allow my family or anyone from work to stay there.  NEVER, EVER !  Limited TV channels when you are staying there long term.  (I do give a positive to the corporate people for making me feel like this horrible experience may help someone else)I stayed at this hotel for four days and had a very good experience. The person working the front desk was very helpful when I let him know that I was not from Texas and wanted to find a good place to eat. He asked me what I was in the mood for and let me know exactly what was good, in the area and inexpensive. The room was very clean, had a flat screen TV and a DVD player attached. The wifi in the room was not free and I had to pay a one time fee to have the wifi for the whole week. The refrigerator and kitchen was very clean when I arrived but the one thing that had me scratching my head was that this was the first hotel I have ever stayed at that did not provide shampoo in the shower. The shampoo was available at the front desk by request there was plenty of soap in the shower but no shampoo, I do not know if this is the same for all extended stay hotels or if it was just this one but I was surprised to not see any shampoo.

I actually booked this room through the express deal on Priceline. Glad I did! The hotel was very nice. Front desk were all friendly and even gave us a late checkout despite being almost fully booked. I missed breakfast, sadly, so I can't comment on that. The room was neat and clean. I didn't realize this would have a full kitchen! Full size fridge, dishwasher and sink. Completely furnished with dishes and cookware. We got worried because we forgot a bottle opener and found one in the drawer! Life saver ;)Shower was nice. The head kind of sprayed too much and too wide. I prefer a more pressurized narrow spray but it still serves its purpose. Bed was lovely and tv had plenty of channels. It's satellite so we lost signal a few times. Parking is a little sparse but there was street parking which was not far at all.Chose to stay here while our house is being renovated.  Walls are extremely thin!  You can hear everything in the halls.  Doors slamming, people's conversations.  A loud train goes by every so often and its louder than loud.  We asked for the first floor because we have 2 dogs and the only two rooms left were by the elevator and the side door.  Worst locations ever!  People in and out all night, doors slamming, loud conversations.  My dogs barked at everything.  Also got stuck across from the loudest, rudest neighbors.We were going to stay two weeks.  We checked out at midnight and went back to our home.  Felt bad about the dogs barking and just couldn't take the loud neighbors.  I got used to the train.  It's not the hotels fault about the loud guests or the train.  Thin walls are thin walls.  We've stayed here before and didn't notice all the noise that time but we were on a different floor in the middle of the hall.  Location, location, location!Good things:1.  They have free breakfast and a buffet dinner two or three times a week2.  You can walk around downtown Fort Worth3.  Hotel is clean4.  Rooms are decent equipped with kitchen and full sized fridge5. A free bus comes to bring you to and from downtown Fort WorthI chose to stay at this hotel a few nights ago as I was coming in town for a good friend's wedding, and the parents of the bride had reserved a block of rooms at a special rate. I am not giving this hotel a one star review because of the cleanliness of the rooms, the amenities provided, or the location. This hotel is receiving the worst review possible because it failed to provide literally the only thing I expected, which was to have a room ready at the check-in time of 3pm so my girlfriend and I could get ready for the wedding.We arrived around 3:45pm, and upon arrival, were told by the front desk that our room was not ready since the maids were running behind schedule, and that we were in line behind 6 other guests. I was already irritated as it seemed it was pointless that I had reserved my room a month and a half in advance. We sat around and waited for an hour and 15 minutes, and by that time I was starting to get a bit nervous as the shuttle departed for the wedding at 5:30. Yet, still no room was ready. We ended up having to lug our suitcases into the bathroom in the reception area and change into our formal attire as quickly as possible, and then bring the suitcases back out to the car. The room was finally ready at 5:25pm, 5 minutes before the shuttle departed. We may as well have just driven straight to the wedding and changed in the car on the way.The wedding guests were also supposed to have a dedicated shuttle service to the wedding and reception afterwards. Instead, we had to over-crowd on one shuttle to wedding, and after the wedding the shuttle never even came to take us to the reception. They said they were busy shuttling other guests around, and we ended up having to pay for a cab to the reception.I called the general manager of the hotel, Allie Giraldo, on her direct line and left a polite message expressing my extreme disappointment in the way things were handled. I couldn't understand what the point was of booking a room a month in advance for a wedding if the hotel management couldn't even properly accommodate the guests in a timely fashion. She hasn't returned my call or even acknowledged the message two days later. We received no apologies for the way things were handled. The poor lady at the front desk had to deal with all  of the upset wedding guests who didn't have access to their rooms on time because for some reason there was no manager on-site Valentine's Day weekend, one of the busiest times of the year. This made zero sense to me.I'm sorry for the rant or if I sound like a bit of a snob, but I have stayed at Marriott hotels in the past both for work and vacation purposes and have never had anything even close to the experience I had at this hotel. I would absolutely never recommend this hotel if you have any sort of important time obligations, as it is clearly very poorly managed. I don't know if this is a one-off occurrence, but if this is how things are handled at Marriott hotels, I am honestly considering never staying at one again.I would definitely come back to this location. The staff was so good to me and my family. Its super close to downtown area. Hell it has me considering a move to Ft. Worth in that specific area. Breakfast could be better or at least some variation. The room was big and spacious and fully stocked. They even accommodated my request for a porta crib for my youngest and brought sheet set for it too. Pool stayed busy so I didn't get to try it out.Being a hotel that targets long stays, business/hospital related costumers,  it has some pretty competitive prices if you plan to book over Xmas break. The rooms are spacious and the king size bed is huge and easily fit my mum, myself and my (then 12 yo) daughter. There also is a pullout couch we didn't end up using anyways. (If you plan to use it, make sure to request extra sheets).The AC is quiet (unlike MANY other hotels).The TV is perfectly sized and hangs on the wall. The channels are enough to please each and all.Yes,  the walls are thin. But, you shouldn't allow that to count against the MANY pros.It is equipped with a full kitchenette (microwave, stove tops... no stove). A full size fridge (that may be too loud at times). There is a bigger than average closet.The toiletries are top notch and replaced daily.They "go green" (which means they will only change towels you lay on the floor, energy savers).The cleaning ladies are so nice and caring. If you happen to be sick or wake up late, you have up untill 3PM to ask for house cleaning. The policy for cancelation is till 4PM for sane day cancelations (i believe), otherwise you get charged for the night. There is late check out and early check-in. The location is by the beltway so you may wanna asl for rooma facing away from it.They have a rather cute swimming pool and, Monday through Friday they offer a free of charge happy hour with wine (red or white), beer, orange and apple juice, water and sodas as well as buffet like food (each day different offer among italian, mexican, chinese...)Included there also is a continental breakfast. There also is 24 hour concierge and a mini market right next to it.Though it is not exactly located downtown, you may choose to walk (10 minutes) or hop on the Molly the Trolly (which is ALSO free of charge). They also offer a free shuttle service throughout Fort WorthI was so disappointed in this hotel.We booked the rooms since we were in the military and traveling for business (and they offered the military rate).When we had to cancel last minute, they still charged us for one night stay in the rooms.I understand if we were going for leisure or if they did not offer the government rate, but they offer the government rate knowing that schedule changes occur and accepting that risk.So now we are seeing if the military can pay for the $600 they charged us or if that has to come out of our pockets. I am going to try to get the taxes back since Texas has a hotel tax exemption for government and non profits, but we will still have to figure out who pays the other $500+.Just so much hassle for us when we are already so ridiculously busy. I would not recommend staying here--they don't care about the people.Overall, this was a pretty good hotel.The day I arrived they informed me they didn't have a room for me even though they had my reservation - because a pipe had burst. So... rooms were unusable. I was shuttled to their sister hotel 8 miles away. That wasn't especially great... but I'm cutting them some "act of God" kind of slack here.Let's talk about the 2 out of 3 nights I actually stayed here.The room: pretty good. Well appointed, great thermostat, comfy linens, plenty of space.The complimentary breakfast: adequate. Stay away from the French toast. And the eggs are clearly out of a pouch. Bleh. Go for fruit, cereal, and maybe a waffle. :-)Service to downtown: you can walk there in 15-20 minutes or they have a shuttle that will drop you off at your DTFW destination. But the shuttle only runs Mon-Fri from 8a to 6p. However, Molly the Trolley has a stop right outside the hotel for other hours you may need transportation - and the front desk will call the trolley for you.Overall, it ain't the Omni - but for the price differential, it's a solid place to bunk in Fort Worth.Like the rest of the reviews note, it is nice, recently built, and in a convenient location. What I did like:The Paul Mitchell bath products, the fitness room, the room size, comfortable beds, quiet air conditioner, and it's within walking distance (half a mile to a mile) to a host of restaurants (or you can take that Molly the Trolly thing but I had a bad experience and gave up on that).HOWEVERThe internet was EXTREMELY SLOW. Come on y'all. Considering the size of this hotel and the business travelers that stay here, you need at least one wireless connection per floor. One connection for the ENTIRE hotel is UNACCEPTABLE. You can't even load basic websites. I just gave up altogether after the first night and relied on the 4G connection on my phone for everything internet related.Additionally, be warned that the walls are EXTREMELY THIN. You will be able to hear your neighbor cough and snore, even with the A/C on. All in all, I think I'll be looking at different hotels when I go back to Fort Worth next month for business.Jason made this place a FIVE star stay for our group. Super easy parking and walking access to Main st and the trolley Thank you Jason and crewI have picky criteria whenever I travel - location - is it centrally-located and accessible to a business district or running trails cost - relative to location, similar competitors, and hotel gradefood - is it free, or does it have a restaurant?fitness center - does it have one?wi-fi in the room and lobbyRate was around $149 p/night (weekend rate + tax + surcharge). Though higher-priced than what I normally pay, anything cheaper wasn't as centrally-located, and everything else in the area seemed more expensive; and though they were right at the edge of downtown, it was walkable for me (and foresee it to be walkable for those who are used to it).The place was kept spotless 24-hrs and you could tell.The breakfast buffet was decent with hot items such as scrambled eggs, potatoes, sausage, and it also had a waffle machine. There were other typical items such as fruit, yogurt, cereal, coffee, juice, etc.They had a pool and a fitness room, which had weights and cardio machines.They specialize in suites, and mine was a good size - with bed, over-stuffed chair, kitchenette, and desk. Last of all, unless you know where you're going in the surrounding neighborhood, the place is hard to get to from the main road, and you kinda have to navigate some of back streets to know where to go. I got it in a coupla tries...(but not on the first!)Note that they are located really close to an intra-city overpass (i.e. not a freeway overpass), which kind of caused the debacle that I mention.My complaints - 1. Wi-fi was down in the room the whole entire time I was there (three nights), and luckily, I carry a hard wire most of the time, which is what I ended up using to net-connect. The error that I was getting had something to do with the router. I mentioned this to the night crew, and they checked their phones, and said, "oh, wel...ours' works!" and they kinda left it at that.2. Last of all, I drove in at 'round 11 pm one night, and the whole parking was full with absolutely no spaces available!Seriously, they should ensure that each guest room should come with a space!This was an excellent place to stay.  The hotel is in excellent condition - nothing shabby or worn.  The service was great.  A self-serve breakfast was available every morning.  And, although we didn't attend due to other plans, a free 'happy hour' with red and white wine, as well as snacks that might  suffice for dinner, was advertised for three days each week.  My grand daughter could tell you, their waffles are shaped like the map of TEXAS. I also like the fact, we have free internet connection! The location in downtown Fort Worth is great if that's where you need to be, but it is a bit away from any convenience or grocery stores.The toilet took seconds to flush.  Another plus!Negative for the doors, if you parked your car out in the back, you end up going the hallway to the front, and coming back inside to go to the back!  I'm saying, they have too many doors, sometimes you forget where the front or the back, until your last day!Us old folks usually don't have forgetful memories!Had no idea about FT Worth and booked this according to price and we were pleasantly surprised. It is newer and well taken care of. Staff was very nice and helpful. While it is not near anything there is a free bus that will take you to the fun downtown area in 5 minutes and we used it everyday. The front desk called them over even outside their normal hours. So we had the benefits of a downtown hotel but with free parking. Breakfast was fine for a free one with Texas shaped waffles even. The pool was too cold for some but a couple of us like a cool refreshing pool. Would stay here again.I stayed here for a few weeks when I first moved to town and I loved it. I will probably never book a regular hotel again. The room had a full sized refrigerator, a two eye stove, toaster, and all the cooking utensils you could need for your stay. It was clean and quiet and the staff went out of their way to accommodate me. They have free breakfasts in the morning, usually eggs, sausage, biscuits, make your own waffles, cereal, juice and coffee. They also have receptions on some nights with beer and wine and appetizers. The hotel is in a great location and you can walk to Sundance Square. There's also a free trolley line that will take you around downtown. I never heard a train, probably because of my location in the hotel.This place is the best great staff very helpful they have free shuttle comfortable beds and quiet location free breakfast and some days free dinner 5 star review!!!Most. Comfortable. Beds. EVER.This place is sort of hidden from the rest of downtown and is on the outskirts but still a great location nonetheless.  My friend stayed here and I didn't expect much of it.  It's pretty new (2008) and has a clean interior as well as clean rooms - complete with a mini-kitchen, full-size fridge, large desk/chair, couch, and marble countertops!  I was very pleased with the service that they provided - all of the staff here is really friendly.  Pros:Free hot breakfast daily - the waffle maker is in the shape of TEXAS!Free wifiFree dinner and happy hour on some weeknights - check the scheduleCons:None that I can think of!We stayed at this hotel for Advocare Leadership weekend. Everyone was very nice!!! Their shuttle service to near by stores and gym was so convenient for us. Justin and Duane were such a great help and became great buddies for us! Room was VERY comfortable and clean, the kitchen was such a plus for us. A full kitchen with every bowl, plate, spoon we could have needed. Will definitely stay here again!Showed up late but everyone at the desk was courteous. Room was super awesome and definitely more plush than I was accustomed to. They only downside to this place is how close it is to the train tracks. The noise isn't bad but it definitely shakes the building a bit.Great place in Fort Worth to stay in.I would say 4+ really.  If train noise bothers you, it's definitely not a 5.  They weren't running constantly, but I did hear more than one.The accessible room gets you a shower massage instead of a shower head (but don't tell anybody).  The bed was FABULOUS!!  The room was very clean, full size fridge & microwave big plusses.  Breakfast bar had tasty biscuits & gravy (hey, it was Sunday morning) and pretty good coffee and a local paper instead of the national one (U know which one).  Here for two nights while house hunting, which is not the most fun I've ever had, but the staff here has been exceptional and even though this one's a freebie from my Marriott points, there's not anything negative I can say about the accomodation.  Besides, I kinda like train noise.
review_content_20: Nice place to stay. Very clean and maintained. Close to downtown, a 1/2mile away. Sits on a quiet corner next to railroad tracks but there's a dividing wall & we didn't hear the trains. Very popular w/ business travelers.Very clean and new hotel. I prefer the residence inn type hotels anyways, but this one is really top notch.  The staff was all very friendly and the location was great.We were in town for a wedding and this was the designated hotel. When we checked in, it seemed very nice and inviting. The front desk attendant was very pleasant and asked if we wanted to be on the same floor with the other guests from the wedding. Their complimentary breakfast was great. I didn't even need to get lunch, I was so full. I used their gym area and I was the only person there the entire time I was working out. I noticed they even had headphones, in case you forgot yours. All was well when we checked out too. It wasn't until we were almost home that I realized I wasn't wearing my Tiffany's necklace. We left before 7 am (and had but 5 hours of sleep) so we packed quickly and hit the road. I searched in every corner of my bags and purse. I remembered where I took it off exactly. I immediately called the hotel, around 4 pm. I explained that I had just checked out and realized I left a necklace behind. Before I could ever describe it, I was put on hold. The attendant suggested I call back the following morning since everyone from house keeping had already left. Ironically, our room was on the same floor as the housekeeping office and when I was walking down to the wedding at 5 pm....the door was still open and someone was at a desk. I called back this morning and explained my situation again. I was asked if I was here for the wedding party (not sure why that mattered) and said yes. Again, I mentioned it was a silver Tiffany's necklace and before I could go into detail, I was told it was not found. I know exactly where I left the necklace (left corner of the first nightstand) and find it hard to believe it wasn't found. As much as I enjoyed our stay, we will NEVER stay at a TPS again and if it was up to me, we wouldn't stay at a Marriott managed hotel either. I hope whoever has the necklace now loves it as much as I did.

review_content: Love this hotel!The bed & bedding is so comfy. Everyone is friendly & helpful.Best comp breakfast ever!Comp happy hour also has some liquor. Room service has a great hamburger which was actually cooked medium as requestedElevators are quick. Definitely the place we will be coming back for our next staycationJust want to say that this is an EXCELLENT hotel... we normally stay at the Courtyard Blackstone right next door but decided to stay here this year... MUCH bigger rooms then the Courtyard and This Embassy Suites has a GREAT layout for Breakfast!!!If you get a chance to choose your room, I highly recommend choosing a VERY high floor and one that is AWAY from the outside wall near the roads and NOISE.  I had a 2nd floor corner room, LOVED the room, very spacious BUT.  ALL night I could hear traffic... I almost thought that the windows were actually open.  Of course my room was right about the entrance of the hotel where there was a lot of traffic but I really didn't expect it to be so LOUD!!!  Most Hotels that I have stayed in that were downtown in large cities have THICK sound proof glass.  This hotel doesn't have that luxury which made my night a living HELL. There is NO parking on site so unless you want to walk a couple of blocks to the closest Parking Lot, you have to use their Valet parking ($22+tax / Night)The Staff was AWESOME!!!  Very friend and professional Staff from the Front receptionist to the Valet and even the Starbucks Cafe personnel were always friendly and helpful.PRO:  Spacious rooms, GREAT FREE Breakfast and Managers Special at night.CONS:  Noisy Streets thin windows, Valet Parking only est $25/nightStayed here for one night for my bachelorette party. The only parking option they have is to valet your car. When I went to check out the next day, handed the valet my ticket, they could not find my keys in their key box. They finally went to the garage and confirmed that my car was there, they just lost the keys to it. They questioned me and asked me to search through my belongings after I told them I specifically told the valet they're in the cupholder when I got out because it is keyless start. They were out of ideas of how to help me and all they kept saying was it will turn up, its probably in one of the valets pockets from yesterday. They told me this continually like it was not big deal, this happens all the time. Luckily I was only an hour away from home and not from out of town so I was able to have someone bring my spare key. They called that afternoon to let me know one of the other guests found my key in their car and turned it in!!!The manager was not working that day and I have called multiple times to try to speak with him about this but he does not return messages. Worst experience ever and so glad it was not the keys of any of the other 6 cars from our group we had parked there that were all from out of town!I gave it 5 stars based on the breakfast and cookies alone! Pricey but definitely worth it if comfort is what you value. Parking on the street is free on weekends in downtown Fort Worth (It begins Friday after 6pm) so you can forgo the expensive Valet parking garage. The rooms and facilities are clean. Once again, make sure you get breakfast! The chef is a very nice guy who will make you a killer omelet. You'll enjoy your stay.I've stayed here several times for work. The Embassy suites is centrally located in downtown Fort Worth. There are many restaurants nearby and Sundance Square is only three blocks away. It's hard to get much better location wise for Fort Worth.The rooms are very spacious and actually larger than my studio apartment back in New York City. The decor is nothing to pretty vanilla but it gets the job done. My favorite thing about the Embassy suites is the complementary breakfast and the managers reception a.k.a. happy hour each evening until 7pm. At happy hour the serve up well drinks, beer and wine along with bar snacks. The managers lounge is a very relaxing place to wind down after a hard days work. The gym is pretty standard here and I wish the pool was outdoors but the Jacuzzi is quite relaxing. Overall this is a pretty good spot to stay while in Fort Worth for business or pleasure.I have stayed here a few times and been satisfied with the service.  The desk help is friendly but sometimes they seem a little distracted with paperwork or other stuff in the back office off to the side on reception.  One very good thing is that they do a great job quickly connecting to the valet to get your car pulled up very quickly.   The hotel has an excellent location, right in downtown Fort Worth, making it a short walk to restaurants and bars.There is a mini-Starbucks type coffee shop in the lobby as well as a Thai restaurant.  Like all Embassy Suites, they serve free breakfast.  For a free breakfast, it is pretty good.  They have fresh fruit, cereal, bread as well as a chef making omelets.  The rooms here are pretty typical Embassy Suites as well.  The rooms are always neat and clean.  I have never had a problem with the heat / AC either.This particular location doesn't have an atrium and we did not have a view from our room, but it is still a quality place to stay. We could not hear any other guests while in our room, the bed was comfy, and the Valet gentlemen were consistently friendly and prompt. The location is prime, and is walking distance to a variety of fantastic bars/restaurants/sites including the Flying Saucer, Del Frisco's Grille, Taverna ($1 mimosas at brunch!), Sundance Square, Bass Hall, and the FW Water Gardens. My favorite part of Embassy is the complimentary Manager's Reception (Happy Hour) every evening. A full bar is available, no limit to number of drinks, and a spread of homemade snacks (tortilla chips, salsa, pita chips, hummus, veggies, ranch, etc). The bartender was friendly and courteous, and he made the BEST Passion Fruit Guava Margaritas!Lastly, we got a fantastic deal on this hotel by using Priceline's Name Your Price Tool - check it out!Had a company retreat based out of this hotel - was excited to learn it was an Embassy Suites as I often stay at these and am never disappointed - until now.  Staff were brusque and unaccommodating, rooms were extremely noisy, water pressure in the shower almost made me jump around to stay wet.  Breakfast room was poorly lighted and arranged and there was no help in there at all if you had a question or needed assistance.  AND I'm a gold HiltonHonors member and they completely ignored my requests and perks - what's the good in being loyal if they don't treat you a little bit better than the average joe??  Anyway - much better accommodations in Ft Worth - won't be here again.Looking for some southern hospitality? Check!  You can find that here from the hotel staff, everyone is super accommodating and sweet! If you are looking for a modern/updated hotel, it's not that, but the staff and amenities offered more than makes up for it.This place provides you a suite of freebies! And who am I to object?- Free complimentary internet- Free made to order breakfast- Free essentials- Free complimentary booze and finger foods from 5pm to 7pmMy room was pretty spacious. I had a work desk, fridge, microwave, and two TVs. Also, it is walking distance from Sundance Square. Regular HH is from 12pm-5pm everyday, including weekends! HH includes a killer Bloody Mary for 5 bucks. I have had $13 Bloody Marys all over SF and still it is no match for ES's Bloody Marys. The only downside for staying here is the $22 valet. Given that I have paid $30+ at other hotels, that had little to no offerings like ES, I don't mind paying the valet in the least.All in all, if I am ever in the area again, I'll be staying at ES next time for sure!Embassy suits was a fabulous place to stay! The staff is awesome and super helpful. The made to order breakfast is fantastic. The gym and pool area are so nice! They have a Starbucks in the hotel. Our train doesn't leave until Friday and after we check out they're even going to hold our bags for us. The hotel is in perfect walking distance to several fun things to do in FT worth. I highly recommend this place.The staff is extremely nice and helpful.  However,  the two room suite was a disappointment.  We are a family of four ...the sofa bed is very small, and the two room  suite is extremely small.  There is only one bathroom and the vanity sink is inside the bedroom,  next to the bed. The toilet area is very small with a tub. It is difficult to close the door when you walk into the toilet area because the door almost touches the toilet. You have to walk through the bedroom to get to the vanity or,  toilet area. There isn't much separation between rooms.The hotel is old and this is probably why the rooms are so small.  I called the front desk to see if they had a larger suite and they said ours was the largest. .What an amazing hotel experience. Yes you pay a little bit more to stay at Embassy Suites but it is 100% worth it! The staff is very friendly & accommodating! Plus you get a delicious cooked to order breakfast & complimentary happy hour! What could be better than that?Phenomenal service! The staff was very friendly and provided us with excellent recommendations on places to visit. They always had a smile and greated us whenever we entered or leaving. Our car was always ready for us too.The rooms are large, the hotel is inexpensive and very clean. The breakfast had a lot of great options - made to order omelettes, cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit, juice, coffee, grits, etc. The gym was also a decent size and was open 24 hours. The location is right in the heart of dowtown near Sundance Square. I hope to stay here again on my next visit.I stayed at the Embassy with all my bridesmaids before my wedding. I cannot say how amazing the hotel staff was. They sent us up a cheese tray and champagne. They went above and beyond to make the day perfect! After we checked out and went to the venue I realized that I could not find my husband's wedding band. They went through the trash and kept us updated every step of the way! (it ended up being in a random box that we had :/ ). I am so impressed with the staff and recommend this hotel for any events, or just for a random stay! They went above and beyond and I am so thankful we chose the Embassy!!!Stayed here the night of the Bob Newhart show during the wonderful ice strom.  Wasn't planning on an overnight stay but after taking 4.5 hours to get here from Mesquite I wasn't looking forward to the drive home.The staff were all courteous and very helpful.  The valet guys went the extra mile. They helped a couple of motorists get there cars moving when they got stuck by offering to push.  They also were keeping abreast of road closures and conditions on on the highways in the area. Great job!The front desk staff were also very nice and gave us a discount as we were stuck and not planning an overnight. Managers reception that night and breakfast the next morning were both well done and the staff were again very cordial and helpful.Why would I only give this place three stars then?  The room itself.  The layout of the room was fine and the bed was comfy-but I don't know if there was a weird plumbing problem, or what, but everytime someone upstairs flushed or used a sink it was louder than when we flushed our own.  It was quite loud and kept us up most of the night(the people upstairs had bladders the size of walnuts.  They were flushing every 20 minutes or so.)A second problem was the Thai restaurant in the hotel lobby.  We thought a bite from there would be the perfect way to close the night.  They had patrons inside and it was still two hours before the posted closing time.  When we went to get a table we were told they were closed.  I understand during the storm things may have happened, but when I told the front desk, just so they could be aware and suggest maybe posting a sign so no one else would get their hopes up- I was told that they have no control over the restaurant as the space is leased.  This really surprised me.  I understand that the space may be leased but it is in your lobby and, I feel, it reflects poorly on your hotel when a situation like this arises.  I would think they could have talked to the manager of the restaurant to at aleast find out what was going on.Will I gvie this place another shot-probably.  I think that the problems we had are easily fixable and that the vast majority of this establishment merit another stay.Have to say one the best hotels we have stayed at.  Everyone who works here are very helpful. Would come back again and stay hereIf your looking for a mid level hotel with a great location , great service and comfortable rooms this is it . I checked in without showing a credit card or drivers license and was met by a manager who already had my key in the lobby . Wow , that was impressive . I am asumming when I valet  my car they knew I was here and I had been here before . In walking distance of lots of great restaurants and sits right in the middle of beautiful down Fort Worth . Staff is super friendly . Will be back many times .Embassy Suites was the perfect place to stay.The location is wonderful, with easy highway access and plenty of destinations within walking distance as well (including the convention center).Rooms were spotless, and the bed was so comfortable that I wanted to take it home with me.  Breakfast is fantastic, with many of the hot items (omelets, pancakes) cooked to order.  The manager's reception in the late afternoon is a good, free snack to hold you until dinner time.As nice as the hotel is, the staff here raises the experience to a whole new level.  I've never been treated better anywhere.  Everyone from the valets to the front desk to the Bistro was friendly, cheerful, and did their jobs well.You really can't go wrong.I have stayed in Fort Worth a few times. Usually at different hotels. I will be choosing Embassy Suites from now on. The customer service was exceptional. I had a personal note in my room from the rep that took my reservation (Jesus). I told him that I really needed to have a great weekend and he delivered, as did the whole staff. The manager on duty, David, was there to greet us at the door! This hotel is in a prime spot in Downtown Fort Worth. Oh, and it also has an indoor pool/hot tub that is very clean and nice. It was the best weekend I have had in quite some time. Highly recommended!!!Perfect location, wonderful staff.  The work out room and equipment were better than most hotels, clean, new equipment.  The room itself was large, so no crowding.  Valet staff was helpful and courteous.  The manager was very visible, asking if we enjoyed our stay.  Definitely recommend staying here!
review_content_20: Incredible place to stay and great for business travelers. Best complimentary hotel breakfast and the happy hour is spot on. The bar makes great lemon drops, too. And the location is perfect. If I could stay here every time I come to Fort Worth, I would.Ok I booked this through hotwire.com. to get a great rate for a one night stay, for a medical procedure the next morning. We got in late and my husband was annoyed that there is no self parking, except on the downtown streets. Valet was only option at $21 a pop. We head up to our room and its a smoking room, WHY are hotels still doing this?? Anyways, call to front desk, and inquire about changing rooms, was put on hold and CERTAIN, I was going to get some cock and bull story about hotwire res, or online booking doesn't carry over request for non-smoking room(Ive gotten that line from another hotel chain, HOWEVER, was pleasantly surprised to told that although the hotel was overbooked, they would gladly call sister hotel, HIlton, 2 blocks away, and get a non-smoking room, at our Hotwire rate, no extra out of pocket anything and we still could return in the morning for the free breakfast at Embassy. THANK YOU, Bradford, your customer service was excellent. They made it RIGHT, period. Now Embassy just redecorate and go COMPLETELY non-smoking!This is an awesome value hotel! The rooms are comfortable and spacious. The staff is polite and friendly. I stayed here for a convention and will never stay anywhere else.The room was nice and big. Very clean and the maid service went well. 2 big things were wrong with the room. There was no Full length mirror (which is a must) AND the only window was TINY.We stayed here during our Honeymoon from Feb 21-24. It was an all around excellent experience.The valets were beyond sweet and instantly made you feel welcome, while EVERYONE at the front desk was super sweet. Especially Jose who, while we were gone eating dinner, had chocolate covered strawberries and Chardonnay sent to our room.There is starbucks located in the lobby and that was our go-to place to sit and figure out where we were going for the day. The employees were very sweet and the area was never too busy to where you couldn't find a seat.The workout room looked very nice and it had a small pool. The breakfast was delicious and every morning I had a wonderful homecooked omelette. The night we came in there was free drinks and snacks on the 7th floor and they had a great Melon Margarita and any soft drink you could want. The location was perfect because our whole goal was to walk around downtown and Sundance square. We stayed 4 days and took our car out twice. EVERYTHING is within walking distant from the hotel and we did so when it was pretty chilly outside so obviously we could have chosen to drive, but there was no need. Overall, probably the best hotel I have ever stayed at. Reasonable prices for the location and fact we were on our honeymoon and the staff couldn't be beat!Great place. Everyone was very friendly and welcoming.The rooms were nice, but the windows were pretty small and didn't have a view to speak of.The breakfast was really good with cooked to order omelets and various hot side dishes.The happy hours was nice too. They had a craft beer on tap and a great outdoor patio to hang out on. The patio made up for the lack of a view in my suite.I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.Great place to stay. We stay there every time we are in DT DFW. Great location and tons to do. Service is good but booking through hotels.com was our mistake. Highly recommend.I have eaten here two times and the food is great. You also get free valet parking. I had the pad Thai and pineapple fried rice and both plates were good. It's kind of pricey but good.We were pretty much forced to stay here during the severe ice storm just before Christmas in DFW 2013, when we went to see Bob Newhart live. It was this hotel or our car. Since our car got stuck in the ice just in front of the hotel, my husband said, "If their valet can get us out of this, we'll stay here." So we did.The best part of the stay was the free alcohol during Happy Hour, as well as a buffet at that time, and the breakfast buffet. We had gone to the hotel restaurant and were informed that they were closing. This was over 2 hours early. When I complained to the restaurant manager, I was informed that they were not part of the hotel and he did not care if I complained to the hotel, since they would be leaving in 6 months when their lease was up. WOW!!! SERIOUSLY?!?!? I could not believe this and, of course, informed the hotel of the conversation. The rooms are nice and large, but that is negated when one is waken by the guest above getting up 20 times through the night to use the restroom and bathe 3 times. Grant it, not sure how many guests were in that room, but I do know that I DID NOT WANT TO HEAR IT!!!! Especially since I was without my seizure medication and needed the little sleep I was allotted. The breakfast was nice, although the omelets could have used a little seasoning. I was told the salt and pepper were on the tables. Seasoning after the fact isn't as useful. :(The front desk was as helpful as they could be, but even if they were 100 stars, I go to a hotel to get rest, not hear other guests walk to and from the restroom and then their toilet flush all night long. Even free alcohol through the night would not have helped.... (okay, maybe a little).This is what brought the rating down. The front desk was sympathetic, but there is nothing that can be done without physical changes to the rooms. I expect more from the Hilton name, and this hotel just did not fit the bill, (except in personnel). VERY SAD :'(A note to the Hilton Hotel Family: Please think of remodeling and adding better insulation in the walls and floors. (Especially around the pipes and drains)This place is absolutely amazing. I came here this weekend for a conference and brought along my husband and two little ones (a toddler and a baby) . Right from our arrival, they treated us like we were the only guests there. As you pull up to the valet parking, the manager meets you asks for you name before you even exit your car and by the time you have unpacked your car, your room is ready for you and another staff members has your keys waiting for you as soon as you walk through the door.Every staff member from the manager down to the bell-staff and cafe workers are always there to great you with a smile, remembering any and all preferences and as a parent, the fact that they played with my kids and didn't see them as an inconvenience was a huge plus. The rooms were well appointed and as anyone with toddlers can attest, we don't always leave the room in the greatest condition, but it was always spotless upon our return.We highly recommend this place to stay for all families visiting the Fort Worth area.Light sleepers beware! The windows are not double paned and the small street out front is oddly busy with loud vehicles (busses or garbage trucks perhaps). I stay here frequently because of the other things mentioned in reviews. But when an interior room is unavailable I am miserable. I know they can't control traffic but they can honor room requests (for a crappy view) from loyal visitors of over 7 years. My stay at a NY hotel in Times Square was nearly soundproof -- it can be done!Have stayed at this location a couple of times. While the location is perfect for enjoying downtown Ft Worth and Bass Hall, the morning breakfast buffet is not typical Embassy standard. Food assortment is limited and not of the chains typical qualityI was very satisfied with my stay here. The staff was exceptionally pleasant and helpful. The amenities were welcoming, crisp and clean. The hotel is located in a lively part of downtown which is walking distance from restaurants and some shops. I will certainly remember this hotel if I return to Fort Worth.Great one-night stay! I highly recommend this location because the entire staff was top notch...from the front desk to the breakfast staff to the manager's happy hour reception! I have never experienced such flawless customer service during a hotel stay!This was an exceptional experience for an Embassy Suites. We stayed here for 5 nights. It was clean, easy to park at, well priced, and the staff was especially friendly and helpful. Every morning they are out front to greet guests as they come down. The room was very clean and spacious. The fridge worked, as did everything else.The complimentary breakfast and manager's reception at night were pretty decent, and served our kids needs every morning. I realize that this is hard to believe, but the staff was as courteous as the Ritz that we stayed at in Dallas. Highly recommended for your stay in Ft. Worth.Truly spectacular service. It's so often the 'service' gets lost in the service industry that we get accustomed to the mediocre. We have had the opportunity to stay in some quite fabulous hotels and I don't recall ever receiving better service. From the time we got out of our car and were greeted by a staff member that assisted our check in, through our entire stay every staff member we encountered seemed anxious to make sure we were completely content. A special thanks to Ms Mary Beth Lewis. I happened to mention to her I had left my remote for our Apple TV behind making it quite worthless. She tracked one down and had it to me in no time. The hotel is nice, the complimentary breakfast and happy hour are great, but it's the wonderful friendly attentive service that really sets this hotel apart.What a great hotel. I came here looking for Thai Tina's restaurant, and I stayed the night. I was in town for business and thought, what the heck. I was in turned treated to one of the best hotel experiences I have had. First of all, I got a great rate from the very fine staff. Everyone in the hotel was professional and friendly. From housekeeping to management. Second, free booze at the manager's reception from 5:30 to 7:30. And I'm not talking about the cheap stuff. Call brand liquors, wines and local draft beer (Rahr's Red, which was a very nice Amber Lager). Third, free breakfast. Not continental, but cook to order from biscuits and gravy, to pancakes, to made-to-order omelets! And all the other usually stuff. Last and not least, the room. A really spacious two room,with two very comfortable queen size beds. Lots of electrical outlets, fridge, microwave, two big flat screen TVs. The couch even pulls out into a bed. No telling how many people you could get in here comfortably. It was weird being by myself..... It was also quiet and very dark. Just what I need to get a good night's sleep. And I did, which is rare when I travel.If I am ever back in Ft. Worth, I will be staying here, and oh yeah, did I mention the great Thai restaurant on the bottom floor?Probably the best stay in any hotel anywhere!Pro's: Staff, cooked to order breakfast, Mamagers reception, Fittness center, indoor pool, size and quality of the room, and, did I mention, especially the staff!Con's: Only one, to be expected in a downtown hotel, Valet parking @ $21 per day plus tax.Location: In the middle of Sundance Square, within walking distance of everything! We walked to several restaraunts and stores without the need of driving.From check-in to check-out, this was the best hotel I ever stayed at. The prices were reasonable, especially considering the value you get for your money. The included "cooked to order" breakfast was simply amazing. It included everything you can think of for breakfast, from a buffet line, to cooked to order omlets, bacon, sausage, and pancakes. The selection was extensive, including cereals, juices, several types of coffees, teas, numerous baked goods, and so much more.
