Your only other option is to drive in circles around the building in hopes that someone will move from one of the 6 street parking spots. The rooms are nice but nothing overly amazing. The rooms aren't very sound proof. If your neighbors talk loud enough you can hear them. You can also hear everyone's movements in the hallway. If you're a light sleeper beware. There is a train that you'll hear every few hours.On a lighter note, the restaurant and bar areas are decorated beautifully. As expected, prices are a bit high, but you're paying for the Omni experience. There's definitely other restaurants I would suggest visiting first (Reata, Lonesome Dove, Grace, etc). Let the hotel restaurant be your fall back option. Over all this is an ok hotel. Its convenient to the convention center if you have an event to attend there.
review_content_40: Traveling with a one year old for husbands work. No hot water. Maintenance man was sent up to fix it and told us we had to leave it running for thirty minutes. A few hours later still no hot water. We called and asked to be moved to a new room. After we get all our things packed and ready for the bellman they call back and inform us the whole hotel has no hot water....  This is now 9pm and my daughter is exhausted. We ended up giving her a sponge bath in the sink, poor baby. I thought we might be offered something to make up for the inconvenience, but all we were was ignored, no apology!I would not stay here again, and definitely not with my daughter.It started out great w/ great customer service, but then I got a sour taste in my mouth. When you first arrive you are taken in w/ the nice lobby area & friendly faces. The room is great, the bed is soft & comfy. Nice look & feel. As a rewards member you get 2 drinks of your choice per day. Once arriving in my room there were 2 bottles of water already waiting for me. Since I didn't get a card to fill out what time I wanted my drinks, I figured that housekeeping would replace it each day. Also as a rewards member you get free wifi, nothing super fast, but it's free to surf & check emails. It was spotty to say the least as it would cut out here & there. When it would work it would take forever to load pages. Upon returning to my room I noticed that the 2 bottles had not been replenished as I thought. I called down to inform the staff that I was a member & I thought I should be getting drinks. They brought some up. The next day it was more of the same. It wasn't until my 4th day out of the 6 nights I was staying there did it finally get replenished on a daily basis. This bothered me since it states on the website what the members get. The gym is ALOT better than any other hotel gym I've been to. It's not stuffy, plenty of equipment & free weights. AND it's spacious! They have an outside pool as well. There's a Starbucks in the lobby. Along w/ a couple places to eat as well. Minutes away from Sundance Square where there are tons of places to eat.Beautiful hotel In a great location.    The hotel is right next to the convention center.   The rooms are nicely decorated and clean.  The staff is fantastic.  Check in was fast, rooms were cleaned early and daily turn  down.   If you are an omni reward member, you get two drinks a day delivered to your room (coffee, tea or juice).  Or you can go to the Starbucks in the hotel and order the same.  Restaurants in the hotel are good and reasonably priced. The hotel is a little pricey but worth it.Thanks to the wide disparity between taking a flight from HSV to DFW at 6am vs 9am (a $600 swing), I took that dreadful 6am ride and arrived at the Omni at 8am on a Wednesday morning. Any traveler will tell you to expect a room to be made available by noon at the earliest with a 3:00pm check-in much more likely.I went right to the front desk and told them I was painfully early and would just ramble around downtown Ft Worth until my room was ready. The nice girl at the desk took all my info and told me she'd call when I could come get a key.No sooner had I finished my tall mocha at the Starbucks 100ft from the front desk than my phone rang. Yep, room was ready. That might be an isolated thing, and it would be made very unlikely were it a full hotel, but it was worth writing about.To me, this is an example of the kind of service you expect from a premier property like the Omni. Well done everyone. 4 stars.I have mixed reviews for the Omni Fort Worth.  In preface to my comments, I should note that we stayed at the Omni in downtown Dallas just a few weeks prior, so my opinion is somewhat influenced by the comparison of the two.Regarding the appearance of the hotel itself, it was great.  Excellent location in Fort Worth, within easy walking distance of Sundance Square, and just a short drive to the Stockyards.  The lobby was beautiful, and check-in was a breeze.  The staff was super-friendly.  Our room was lovely and perfectly clean.  Compared to the downtown Dallas Omni, I would have to say I liked the room a little better at the Dallas Omni - but that is simply personal preference for the decor and city view.  The shower at the Fort Worth Omni was FABULOUS.  Excellent water pressure, and I could have stayed in the shower forever!  The breakfast buffet at the Omni was also excellent.  Well-prepared, and everything was hot and fresh.  Now on to my only complaints:First, the pool.  And this is the same complaint I have about the Dallas Omni.  The pool is WAAAAY  too small for the hotel size.  It was impossible to get a chair to put our towels on, and in the pool we felt like we were elbow to elbow with other patrons.  Second, there was one exceptionally rowdy patron who was ruining a relaxing afternoon for everyone.  Management was definitely aware of the situation......the pool manager was standing nearby....but did nothing about it.  Second complaint:  the bar at the pool.  This could be a GREAT place to hang out and enjoy a drink.  However the bar was grossly understaffed for a weekend.   I waited about 20 minutes to get a margarita.  We have up after one drink and went back to our room. All in all a nice hotel.   But given the choice between the Dallas location and Fort Worth location I would choose the Dallas hotel every time.I did not stay here but attended a conference here and was so impressed. Staff,food, and facilities were exceptional.Stayed here for a professional conference that was being hosted onsite.  As my company picked up the tab, my review is based more on experience and less on value (I normally don't treat myself to accommodations this nice or pricey).Beautiful place and clean throughout.  Staff was very friendly and attentive from doormen to front desk staff.  Have valet parking, but did not take advantage.  Tip:  If you self-park, you will be parking at convention center parking and walking block and a half.  You will be given a badge at check-in to swipe in and out of garage.  Do not use the parking garage ticket or else you will be double paying!  This was one thing that was not explained well.Room with parking came out to $267 / night (and that apparently was the conference discounted price!).  I would never pay that much myself for a room, but would say you get your monies worth for the experience.  If weather is bad, they have 4-5 dining options on-site as well that run the gamut from bar scene, wine scene, steak house.  Last tip:  If you do decide to reserve a room, make sure you sign up for their preferred guest program.  Free to join and it gets you the wifi for free along with some other nice perks.  Saved me (or my company) $40 in wifi charges.We came to the omni for just one night and it was extremely crowded, our rooms were not ready and the pool was too crowded where you couldn't get a seat or much room in the pool to move around. We were very disappointed with the hotel and service-but it didn't help that there was a big crowd.I recently booked a night for my girlfriends 21st birthday and our stay was perfect. This hotel is beautiful, and accommodated every one of our needs. Jesse (the concierge) was incredibly helpful with anything we needed assistance with (shuttle service, directions, and even small birthday gifts from the hotel). The Whiskey and rye bar was also a great experience. Overall, I can't say enough good things about this hotel and will definitely return in the future!This is not my first time to stay at the Omni Fort Worth because RE/MAX holds conferences here every couple of years.  This is a gorgeous hotel, complete with a wine bar, sports bar, steakhouse, restaurant, and spa.  The rooms are nicely appointed and on my previous visit, I slept like a baby.  HOWEVER, on this stay, they put me on floor 5 and there is a train station a block or so over, so basically every hour on the hour I was awoken by the sound of a train.  Not what I needed after driving 5 hours to get there earlier that day and then driving 5 hours to get home the next.  I complained to the front desk and basically all she could do was comp breakfast for me.  Not really what I was looking for.  After completing a survey that was emailed to me though, in which I complained about the stupid train, the Omni Fort Worth made it right, so they are getting 4 stars.The other complaint I forgot to mention is that, upon arrival, I had to unload my own bags ... the valet didn't bother because he was too distracted talking to a co-worker.  They made up for this upon departure though my having my car to me very quickly.I have only eaten at the breakfast buffet, so I do not know if anything else is good there and I only partake of the omelette station.Service in the sports bar is slow, but they made me a killer tea w/vodka ... those could really do some damage.Wine bar has a nice selection, but I opted for a cocktail there instead.Overall, this is an excellent place to stay with lots of nice amenities and service that is typically very good.  I obviously will be back, since RE/MAX will hold another event there in the future I'm sure.We often stay at this Omni when we want a weekend in Fort Worth and have noticed that the customer service, unfortunately, has been steadily decreasing over the last six months. Sometimes it's just really busy - which is understandable - in a big hotel like that sometimes you are 1 in a thousand guests.....but when the staff treats you like 1 in a thousand it makes for a much less enjoyable experience. On top of that, be sure you watch the Best Rate Guarantee they offer online. We usually book through the Omni website and for an upcoming stay they actually lowered their website price by 50.00 for the exact same room we had already booked. When I contacted them to have the Best Rate Guarantee honored, they said it only works if you find the better rate through another company's website....which seemed totally ridiculous. All in all, it's a nice hotel and the location is great in Fort Worth, just don't expect to be treated well - from hotel staff to corporate guest relations it's below par. It's surprising since they just bought Barton Creek in Austin - you'd think they would be all about wanting people to like the brand more, but the opposite seems to be true.I recently stayed here for a work event, and I can't wait to come back!The room was incredible. Clean, lovely, spacious. The in-room climate control is almost silent, so I asked the front desk for a floor fan for the noise; they ran one up immediately. The bathroom is luxurious--beautiful shower, fluffy towels, good lighting (for makeup application!). The meeting areas were easy to navigate, and our concierge provided refreshments and other materials that made the long conferences enjoyable. We visited Whiskey and Rye and the Wine Thief, each having a unique atmosphere and some impressive beverage selections. Our final night, we had a private event at Bob's Steak House. The food and service was absolutely top notch. There's also a Starbucks in the hotel itself--I certainly appreciated this feature (conferences? caffeine, please). Omni's location couldn't be better, especially if you're one of the many needing to visit the nearby convention center. There are also countless dining options within walking distance if you'd like to venture from the hotel. But with its great customer service and comfortable accommodations, you probably won't want to!I was pretty impressed with this place! It has a classic Texan feel while maintaining a luxurious atmosphere. The restaurant inside has gotten mixed reviews and I have heard from the rest of the people in my party not to go there. The staff of the Omni are exceptional and have been extremely hospitable. Whether it's the valet rushing to get your car or the staff at the hotel pool asking to make your stay better, I have been thoroughly impressed. Perhaps the greatest part if the hotel is the location which has an easy way to exit with your vehicle and rentable bikes across the street! The gym is pretty nice too and I was able to go for a nice jog easily without waiting on their treadmills.To say I was disappointed with the treatment I received while at the Omni Hotel would be the understatement of the year.  From the moment we checked in, we were greeted by rude staff (except the three at the Starbucks- they were wonderful and helpful!) , and it only got worse from there.A couple of us had chosen to stay here because of its upscale ambiance that was promised to us by many who had stayed here before us.  It was my bachelorette party weekend and we wanted a classy vibe from beginning to end.  Honestly, we were treated with more class at 'The Library', a downtown bar, than we were at this hotel.  Those at the check in desk were slow, short and very nearing rude- but the real gem came when we ordered room service.We called room service when we arrived back to the hotel room around 3:00 AM.  When I attempted to call back at 3:50 AM to check on where our food was, my call was not answered.  I tried again immediately after and was not answered again.  Finally, I called the front desk who.  The attendant at the front desk was not interested in hearing what I had to say- as soon as the words 'Room Service' were out of my mouth, she directed my call to them.  I didn't even get to finish my sentence.  When my call was *finally* picked up by the kitchen, and I asked why our food hadn't yet arrived after an hour of waiting I was told that we had absolutely NOT been waiting an hour and that we were NOT the only people at the hotel and we would have to wait- our order would be up within 10 minutes.  I couldn't believe the way I was spoken to.  We waited another ten minutes- the amount of time she quoted us, and then I called back.  Same song and dance- no one answered when I called room service directly, called front desk, finally was patched through and spoke with the angry lady again.  She said our food would be there within five minutes.  So, here we are waiting, it's been an hour and five minutes since we ordered (this was not a complex order- it was three orders of french fries, an order of wings and an order of queso.)  I decided I was going to call the manager and complain.  I pick up the phone, had to *again* deal with the very rude lady at the front desk, and was able to get ahold of the manager, Shawn.  As I was voicing my complaints to Shawn, our food FINALLY arrived.  I told him as much, and we got off the phone.Wouldn't you know it... the food was ice cold.  The queso was a congealed mess, the wings looked like they had been sitting under a heating lamp for hours, and the fries were dry and stale.  Surely, it couldn't have gotten in that shape on a five minute walk from the kitchen to our room- *especially* when it was covered.I immediately picked up the phone and spoke with Shawn again.  I told him the queso was a congealed mess, the wings were cold and the fries were 'barely edible'.  I told him there was no way we were paying for this and I told him exactly how dissatisfied I was.  He stated he would go talk to the cook and see what he could do.  4:30 AM comes and goes and Shawn calls me back to tell me that the cook will cook more immediately and bring them up- it would be another 15 minutes.  Having seen how 'quickly' this kitchen works already, I declined, and told him I only wanted a credit, I didn't wish to stay up until 6:00 AM trying to get a late night snack.  He assured me we wouldn't be billed and we hung up the phone.The next morning, my friends bill, who was paying for the room as a gift,  does not include the charges for room service.  We are still dissatisfied, but this takes away the sting a bit.  Lo and behold, She checks her account with her bank and the charge to my credit card was higher than the bill was for.  She called the hotel to find out what the extra charge was for... and they billed her for the french fries!  Because I had stated on the phone that they were 'edible' they took that to mean that it was okay to charge me for frozen french fries!!  She immediately called to have the charge removed and she has been getting the run around all day.  She never received a call back from the manager, nothing.  They twisted my words so that they could nickel and dime her over $19.00.Needless to say, this is the most dissatisfied I have been with a hotel in my entire life.  I won't be staying here at any time in the future.  If you're a fan of friendly service and hot food, I recommend you take your business elsewhere too.It's hard to beat the Omni for events in Fort Worth. I've stayed here, and I've also enjoyed Whiskey & Rye for frivolity. The staff is professional and courteous; the food is tasty and diverse; and the location is extremely convenient. Valet parking can be a pain if there is an event going on, but that's about the only down side.The room service at this hotel is horrible. They give misleading information and their food is not good. Very disappointed and will not stay here again.Celebrated our 16th wedding anniversary and really loved the hotel experience. Service was excellent and they even surprised us with a bottle of champaign and chocolate covered strawberries!Great room with a view. Room was very clean. Hotel staff was extremely nice and helpful. Valet parking was fast and with little wait time. My room didn't have a microwave other than that I would definitely stay and recommend this hotel again.Girls weekend out! Had a great time! The hotel car took us to meet the horse drawn carriage and the ride though downtown was awesome! The hotel driver even gave us his number in case he needed to come pick us up afterwards! The live music in the bar was good and the wait staff was friendly and quick ! We will definitely be come back!Wow! Was just here for 3 days for the 2012 Cyberstar Summit and can't say enough good about this hotel. Following the advice of another attendee, I enrolled in the Omni Loyalty program prior to reserving my room. This entitled me to a lot of freebies including 2 items pressed for free, one pair of shoes shined at no charge, 2 robes in the room, free wi-fi, 2 complimentary bottles of water each day, plus 2 complimentary drinks of our choice delivered by room service each morning (juice, tea, etc). On the second night of my stay I ordered a croissant with the complimentary juice. Was extremely impressed when a lovely tray was delivered with the juice, 2 croissants, jams, butter, and a pot of freshly brewed coffee, all for $2.82! (Croissant was $2 + tax). It seems this hotel goes above & beyond (2 complimentary apples were delivered w/the complimentary juice the 1st day) and it really made me want to stay here again.The hotel itself is beautiful. Had a quick lunch in the bar/restaurant the 1st day and a steak dinner at Bob's the 2nd night. Both meals were delicious and the service was outstanding (besides providing great table service for such a large group, separate checks for a party of 40+ was "no problem"). I also appreciated the inviting lobby with fireplace, the spacious & well appointed rooms, the tasteful artwork throughout, and the available  fitness & business centers. All this, combined with the incredible service and fabulous attitude of every employee I interacted with, truly merit a 5+ star rating!
review_content_60: 3.5 stars.I enjoyed our stay at the Omni Fort Worth.  After staying at the Aloft in Austin, coming here felt we were commoners being elevated to royalty. The staff at the Omni were very accommodating and put our group into two adjoining rooms, which made getting ready in the morning/evening much more fun.  The rooms were spacious and well appointed... about half of the square footage was devoted to a monstrous bathroom.  We didn't really spend too much time in the rooms-- only a few hours for a quick nap once we arrived in Fort Worth, and then the few hours sleeping through the night.JF and I decided to attend the free yoga session provided by Omni FW on weekends.  We wandered around for a while looking for the location, and were directed to a conference room (the pool area was being renovated) by a helpful spa employee.  Unfortunately, the yoga instructor NEVER SHOWED (even after a few assurances by the hotel staff), which was a total downer!  I hate when people renege on their promises.OVERALL: an unremarkable stay; the higher rating is biased due to an average to slightly-below-average stay the few days before at the Aloft in Austin. PS - Parking will cost you $25/day if you valet; $15/day if you self park.  We chose to self park, and were directed to the large convention center parking structure about a block away.  Make sure you take you parking ticket to the Omni front desk, where they will switch it out with a hotel version so that you have in-and-out privileges.Top Notch Hotel!!! We've also stayed at their Dallas, and Nashville locations, and the Omni has become our favorite hotel! Hotel is gorgeous, and the rooms are off the charts! Kudos!!!I've got a son who goes to TCU so I've had a chance to stay at several places and I have to say this place has it all. Everything you need is here. And it's reasonably priced. I see absolutely no place to stay anywhere else.Smiley face and a starAwesome hotel.  We took advantage of a winter sale and went on "vacation" 10min from our house.  The staff is very friendly and accommodating.  Gorgeous views from our room.  Free champagne and chocolates in room because I mentioned it was first time out of house as a couple for several months.  Water gardens are steps away and although I've lived here for over 15 years I've overlooked this gem of a park until today.Was here for 3 nights/4 days for a work conference, and definitely left impressed.3 year old facilities were GORGEOUS and seemed new still. I had a king room with a beautiful large shower in the bathroom (friends who stayed in double queen rooms had lame tub showers). Anytime I needed anything (room service) the staff was quick to respond. One time they overcharged me on my beer, so when I mentioned it the next time I placed an order, they sent a couple free beers as an apology. Quality customer service!!! If you are part of their fancy shmancy frequent stayer club thingy (it's free), you get free coffee and orange juice in the morning - delivered at whatever time you want. Classy. The conference facilities were adequate - nothing fancy. Our water pitchers were always full, the catered meals were delicious, they brought more chairs in when we needed them... blah blah blah.One night had a lovely couple drinks out at the pool bar with friends. Nice, chill, atmosphere. If I'm ever back in Ft Worth, I hope it's at this great hotel!!!!!!!!!Simply put; from the valet parking, to reception, to friendliest staff ever, to an amazing and cozy room, to the onsite Starbucks, this Hotel is among the best we've ever stayed in. We chose this resort to celebrate our 10th anniversary and we are so glad that we picked this place. Walking distance from family friendly night life. You don't need to leave this place for nothing. It includes all the services you can imagine. Had breakfast at the cast iron and our experience was unforgettable. Food was delicious and staff was incredibly kind. Would've loved to experience their spa but they were booked for the day. We will definitely recommend this resort for your stay in Fort Worth. Simply one of the best hotel experiences. No negatives whatsoever.What a nice luxury hotel in a great area! The hotel room was very nice and comfortable. Great facilities in the hotel such as a shop, Starbucks,  2 bars and a restaraunt. The bars were great and provided a great place to conversate and watch football. Nice spacious lobby and frindly hotel staff. The courtousy driver was a great knowledge of stuff to do in the area and responsive to our requirements to come and go.The area is great, right across from the convention center, half a mile from the newer part of Ft Worth and a 10 minute trip to the historic part. A great area to be in!Ohhhh, luxury! This hotel remained in a constant hustle and bustle; they have the system down to get people in and out without a hitch. From weddings, to college football fans, to conference goers, this hotel accommodated us all!The lobby is dimly lit for a warm and intimate arrival. There was a fancy wine bar on one end and a sports bar/tavern on the other side, with an upscale restaurant in the middle. They even had a mini museum indoors too. For you coffee lovers, there is a full Starbucks in the lobby too!The bedrooms were luxurious and spacious. The turndown service was nice...although their tv station/music was very outdated, but seemed to fit the Ft. Worth/western theme nicely. They have an ottoman that was covered in faux cowhide that was a bit creepy, but overall the decor was nice.I like! This newish hotel offered some great rates and turned into home for a few days this past week. I found the staff, the rooms, the dinning choices, everything to be in good shape and more than a great value! Actually, the bellmen and management were top notch, better than most places that I stay . SO- I checked in, checked out my room, and all was good. High floor (my preference), King bed (non negotiable because I like to sleep sideways on them- a benefit of being short), and large bathroom. The room itself was in good repair- a bonus, large enough for my needs (when you travel to NYC 15 plus times a year, you do not get too picky on this issue), nicely fitted, and- if you like to watch yourself sleep or whatever- a HUGE mirror is posted directly next to the bed. I have to say, I felt kind of bad for the cleaning crew. The bathrooms feature these wonderful showers with HUGE GLASS walls. I kept thinking about what a PITA it would be to clean! BUT- they came through, my shower walls sparkled every day. (My mother would have kept a squeegee in the shower just so you could wipe it down at the time- but she is a bit freaky that way.) Free wifi and free coffee and diet coke in the AM (just for being a member- nice) was a definite plus! I wish all of my hotel stays were this posh/clean/friendly. I did not have a chance to check out the pool/spa/anything fun- but- hey, for my work life, this was great!Charlie Short greeted us with so much warmth and class. Everyone was so personable and treated us beyond our expectations. They did so many extra things to make us feel special. This was the best hotel I have ever stayed at. LOVE LOVE LOVED it. Thank you Charlie for the complimentary bottle of wine for our 20th Anniversary. You are the best!Great service, great employees, great rooms. So impressed with the Omni. The valet may be a little pricey ($20 /day) but your car is safe and you don't have to walk 2 blocks to get it in Texas heat. BUT, the valet will not be able to find your keys ever and you'll have to look for yourself.The facilities were superb. I went to a reception there and to Bob's on the ground floor of the hotel. Both, were impeccable. The food was delicious at the reception and out of this world at Bob's.Stands to reason that I'll likely never be able to encapsulate this hotel for all comers from all corners...but for the sake of the way the pyrotechnics explode into a summer sky here when the weather turns temperate, and, well, the fact that I wandered up just enough to staple myself onto the pool bar, well, I'd be remiss not to share at least a little of the general juju that prevails when you catch the Omni from a choice angle among its many preferred ones, and shake it 'til an experience comes out.Ultimately I popped in on a mission with plenty of wiggle room for misunderstanding: they host a legit pool party upstairs, and on a day that posed the harmonic convergence of Cinco de Mayo and the Kentucky Derby, how wrong could you possibly go by staking your claim on a barstool at a genuinely lofty spot in downtown, where they understood the value of a flatscreen but seldom to the point where it interfered with their blended cocktail. There was breeze, and should you make your way to the The Water Horse, chances are you'll find yourself just ducky with where they hang their hat. It's a pool bar, but they're not suctioning flunkies in: in fact, you can make the argument that when one rails against the dyling of the light, shouldn't he or she do it where the sky remains infiinite? That part's still possible and we'll see. In the mean time, new friends and some good brews to boot.My wife and I were in Ft. Worth last weekend for the Cowboys Classic college football game & stayed at the Omni.  In addition to the football game, we also used the occasion to celebrate my wife's birthday.  My situation was a little different however.......I had broken my foot previous to the trip, so arrived in a wheelchair and crutches.  And how did the Omni accommodate us?  They hit a big time grand slam.......tremendous customer service from the get go, starting with valet and front desk check-in, to make absolutely sure we were taken care of.  The Concierge Mgr, Stephen, went above & beyond the call of duty to not only make sure our room was set up with birthday flowers and chocolate, but also arranged to have a stool placed in the shower to help out with the broken foot.  We also enjoyed the Whiskey & Rye Bar inside the hotel and turned out to be a great place to enjoy local craft beer and watch college football.If you're planning to be in the Ft. Worth area and looking for a great hotel, look no further than the Omni.........I'm sold!Smells like Soap Happiness Everywhere...and it is pretty...nice staff...great decor.I have stayed at this Omni twice now in the last 3 years and I love it!  The beds are amazingly comfortable as are the pillows, the rooms are always clean and smell great.  The check-in and check-out process is smooth along with valet.  Room service is top notch as is the Cast Iron restaurant.  This past stay we had a great view of the city.  I love Omni and feel like I'm at home when I stay here.Superior quality rooms, excellent on-site dining options and management that truly cares about their guests! Best hotel in Fort Worth!The best hotel in Fort Worth.   One of my favorite hotels in the US.I come to Fort Worth at least once a month and this is my go to place to stay.   They have fantastic service, a nice gym, reasonable room rates, and a great preferred guest program.  Rooms are large, clean, and new.We checked in on 7/3 for a two night stay.  The check in was easy and they gave our 2 year old son a toy.  They also told us there was a free, tip not included, car service for us to use.The next morning, we asked about the car service.  They said we could not use it because they did not have a car seat.  It would have been nice if they had said that while they were telling us about it knowing we had a small child with us.We returned to the hotel at 11pm on July 4 and were locked out of our room.  We called the front desk and someone came up to let us in.  When we got in the room, the maid service had not been there.  The front desk called us and told us we had just checked in that day - which obviously we had not.  They offered to send a maid, but at this point we just wanted to get in bed.  They did give us complimentary breakfast for the next morning.We checked out with no issues.  However, today I am reconciling credit card bills and there is a random charge on my card.  I called the hotel, and they are charging us additional money over what we already pre-paid for the stay because "Hotwire did not give us enough money".  They are researching it, but having this happen on top of everything else is just icing on the cake for me.  I will definitely think twice before staying at the Omni again.A good time spoiled by incompetent, unapologetic morons at the valet. Pros: Well decorated hotel, subtly blending what you'd expect from Ft. Worth flare with Omni elegance. Nice restaurants and bars attached. Good walking proximity to local restaurants and night life. Cons: 1) Walls are paper-thin. I literally woke up 20 times with random bumps and creaks. It's hard to blame a hotel for loud, drunk guests staggering through the halls at 2:00 a.m., but when you're brushing your teeth the next morning and are able to eaves drop on the people in the adjacent room as though you were separated by a Japanese rice paper screen, there's a problem. 2) The valet was pathetic. they forgot to put a tag on our keys and we proceeded to sit for 30+ minutes, all the while dealing with their insistence that someone had the keys and was on his/her way. Finally they asked us to find our keys on the peg board, which we found in a few seconds. No apologies. 3) The pool is an afterthought. Small and borderline useless, plus the western winds of North Texas gust at around 40 mph, which isn't exactly fun.Clean rooms with nice amenities.  I would definitely stay here again!
review_content_80: Stayed at the Omni Fort Worth about a week after it opened. The hotel's grand opening was earlier than it should have been--the pool area was unfinished and some of the room's fixtures seem to have been constructed in a hurry. (Speaking of the pool, it is TINY. We walked all the way up and down the third floor before we finally spotted the pool, which was dark and about the size of a bathroom.) The rooms are otherwise very nice and spacious. One thing that stood out was the empty minibars--instead of being full of beverages that you can use as you please, you call down to the desk and request that it be filled with whatever you want to order. It seems to be a mix of room service and just having a minifridge in the room. We just drove out and bought our own drinks. Valet parking fees are high, but we ended up finding free meters within a block or two. We came out to visit with friends and relax, so we didn't do much sight seeing in Fort Worth, but the water gardens across the street were pretty entertaining. The downtown area is very cute. The staff was wonderful--absolutely everyone we encountered greeted us and were very helpful. Now that the hotel's been open a few months and gotten adjusted, I wouldn't mind staying again. I'd recommend it for a quiet getaway.Not happy with Omni FW Hotel right now! A guest & I transferred reservation over phone  last Sat 3/22, put room in my name & my credit card--removed her completely from reservation for 4/3-4/7/14. When I called Omni to cancel reservation yesterday afternoon, as another guest & I are combining rooms, they had no record of me, still had it in prior guest's name with her card so they wouldn't talk to me or let me cancel. When she called to cancel they told her they are charging her one night penalty because we missed 12 pm deadline, which I knew nothing about as they never emailed my confirmation. If any of you have booked, canceled or transferred rooms at Omni--double check & make sure you get email confirmation. Seriously how much money are we bringing Omni with our WV Travel Agent convention of 10,000 guests & they do this!? Not to mention some of us have clients booked here for Final Four & College BB finals next month & we're tempted to pull our reservations & never book at this hotel again! So much for their customer service guarantee!Wife was here for a convention, I picked her up from motel to move to a Sheridan for a night in Dallas before swinging onto our vacation.   I travel a lot - about 14 weeks a year, I'm partial to Sheridan & Westin because of the MUCH better fitness facilities & healthier dining options. The Omni was "ok".. but for the $300 / or so a night, definitely not worth it... I would never buy it, but it was convenient for her needs this time.  I'll stay at the Westin anytime instead.Staff was mediocre at best, mostly incompetent at the lobby desk and sometimes rude. We didn't get a receipt when checking out, and... staff didn't seem to think anything of it.   Wife called the 800-number to get a folio.   Really, really unprofessional.After the Omni, we stayed at the Sheraton on Canal Street in New Orleans.   Over-the-Top service, over-the-top luxury.I was really excited about coming to this hotel. Unfortunately, it wasn't what I expected.I came here for a 3day/2night business conference a couple weeks ago.  This hotel is beautiful. From the hotel rooms to the ballrooms, it's very nice. One thing about this hotel is the parking is NOT connected to the hotel. No big deal, I was going to get valet anyways. I came to the hotel looking a little frumpy, since I was planning on carrying several boxes from my car to the ballroom (thankfully the employees of the hotel did it all for me). When I came down later in the evening to get my car, valet made it a point to tell me how nice I looked in my business suit. That's always nice.So, starting my very stressful 3 day business trip I decided to check in and take a quick shower. While I was in the shower I noticed something on the shower floor, a contact! A used one no doubt. That was pretty gross but I decided I would just ask the hotel to clean the shower when they do room service. After looking around the room I noticed a half empty water bottle and some food in the mini refrigerator. Something else to let room service know about. That evening I had an opening reception to get to and forgot all about the cleanliness of my room. When I came back and checked my room, they had cleaned it for me and took the throw pillows off of my bed and pulled the sheets down.Day 2 of my experience at the Omni hotel. I was on a time crunch and trying to get some lunch before I had to get back to work. I went down to get my car from valet and was told it would a few minutes, okay no problem. 15 minutes later I finally went and asked what was taking so long?? I was told they couldn't find my car! What?? No apologies from the lady, just that they were looking. Okay. So I sat back down and 10 minutes passes and the supervisor came up to me and explained that they have 3 parking garages and he has employees in every one looking for my vehicle. FINALLY 30 minutes later my car arrives and I am stuck having to go back to work hungry since this ordeal took so long. To make it up to me, the supervisor gave me a free night of valet. All in all, the appearance of the hotel is very nice, the staff is friendly, but they are lacking in service. Room service, valet service. These are 2 major things I look for in a hotel. On a last note, once I was home and unpacking my things what do I find on my shampoo bottle??? That damn contact! Disgusting.Hotel is nice and elegant. Rooms are standard but nothing fancy. Staff s nice but I had trouble with my room keys, not once but twice. Cell phone service blows while in the hotel along with Internet service. There are bars and restaurants at walking distance. I'm not that impressed.The beds, staff, ambience and decor is amazing!Beautiful, new hotel in Ft. Worth. Right across from the convention center - which makes it a convention hotel. Check-in smooth, valets on top of it.  Sign up for the rewards program before you arrive which gives you free wi-fi in your room, corner room (if you want it), 2 free launderings, turn down service and free coffee or tea delivered each morning.The free morning coffee and wifi was a plus. The delivery for the chosen time slot got slow as the hotel booked up. The room was very nice, bathroom beautiful. Bed, sleepable!Hotel bar was very cool with decent live music and treated my group well.....we were there for a week, they got used to us.  Restaurant offers a nice Sunday Brunch.  Be sure to read your hotel bill before checking out. I was charged for valet parking for 2 nights - did not even have a car.  Staff took it off at check out without me having to yell, but I think its bad to be asked "did you have a car" what happened to honesty?  Starbucks in hotel lobby...but lines got long when the hotel was full and during the afternoon as convention folks came over for their afternoon fix.The Molly free bus stops right in front of the hotel. It runs until late night...takes you down to Sundance Square a few miles away which is full of restaurants, shops (which close at 6ish) etc.We had a lovely hotel experience. Brandon and his staff really know how to give great service. The hotel is beautiful and new. The room service  and menu were wonderful. They seem to have anticipated and prepared for every need. We felt spoiled and refreshed by our brief stay. I will definitely try other Omni hotels in our future travels.I highly recommend the Omni Fort Worth.We just can't seem to get it right in our city! Out of all the "Omni's that I have stayed at this one is one of the smallest. I'm am not impressed by this one at all! There desk clerks are not up to a 3 or 4 star standard quality. I expected better...So I stayed here for a few nights for a wedding that I was in-much better than the Hilton!! I paid up a bit extra for a premier king which was so worth it-great view, and the room and bathroom were really spacious! I'm a huge fan of the walk in shower. Ordered room service a couple of times, and it came quickly and was pretty good. They even let me order something that wasn't on the menu, when I rolled in from the bar at 2 a.m. and had the drunk munchies. Pretty hotel-it's huge-good rooms, and the hotel bar-Whiskey and Rye-is nice. I'd definately stay here again!!After a bad experience at the Sheraton across the park I switched to the Omni and could not have been happier. Though the room was not especially large it had everything I needed and more! All of the finishes in the room were top of the line not to mention the comfortable beds and pillows. Our room even had a mini fridge and spacious closet for us to use while we were there! The staff was helpful and pleasant always offering to go the extra mile. They even had a courtesy car that took me to Target to pick up something free of charge, you just tipped the driver! It was close to the convention center and restaurants. Even had two great places to eat right in the hotel. I have never stayed with Omni before and will not look for it during all my future travels! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Fort Worth!Planned special weekend for me and hubby for his birthday and after researching a couple of local hotel options, I chose the Omni. I requested early check in via phone when I booked the reservation and web (when I went online and did the actual early check in that apparently means absolutely nothing). When we arrived one hour before the regular check in time, we were told our room wasn't ready and they would call us. Slightly annoyed, we went and had a $30 sub par lunch at one of the restaurants in the hotel. Two hours later, more annoyed and very apologetic to my understanding birthday hubby we found the pool which looked like a pond full of chlorine that was over it's people capacity. We sat on one of the couches by the pool that smelled exactly like an ash tray. At that point hubby and I decided we'd had enough and went to the front desk to cancel our reservation. It was just  another example of poor customer service. It doesn't matter how attractive your hotel may be on the outside if you don't deliver on the inside.I sent the following email message to the Guest Services Manager on 1/22/12.  Today is 1/29/12. I have not yet received a response.  Not even an acknowledgement of receipt.I wanted to take the opportunity to comment on my recent experience staying at the Omni Fort Worth on January 14, 2012 through January 16, 2012.  Like you I also manage employees and always appreciate it when people take the time to provide me feedback on the results of their performance.  I feel that the information helps me improve the performance of our organization as well as their personal performance.  I travel relatively frequently and primarily stay at Marriott properties.  However, for the weekend of January 14 I decided to stay at the Omni since it was close to my daughter's cheer competition and I had not stayed in an Omni in some time.  I have stayed at both the Mandalay and Park West locations in the past and had very nice experiences.My experience for this weekend in January began when I arrived.  I had received an email prior to my arrival giving me the option to check in early (my card would be charged immediately).  I took advantage of that option because I thought I might have a better chance to get my preference of rooms.  I specified during the check-in procedure that I wanted the highest floor possible and a room at the end of a hallway.  Upon arrival I went to my assigned room only to find that it was right next to the elevator and only on the 9th floor.  This was not what I wanted by any means. I value quiet and don't like to hear all the conversations that occur while people wait on the elevator.   As a result I went back down to the front desk while my family waited for me.  I was reassigned a room much closer to the end of a hallway and was told a room at the end of a hallway would be available the following day.  Why wasn't I assigned the room closer to the end of the hallway in the first place?  Strange.  Of course I didn't move to a room at the end of a hall the following day because that would require moving all our belongings.On the first full day of my stay my family and I wanted to do some shopping that evening so we went downstairs to get my car from the valet.  I was then informed that the valet from the previous night had left my lights on all night and they had to charge my battery.  After waiting about 25 minutes my car was delivered and I was told it should be "good to go".  We drove about 15 minutes to a shopping area.  When I went to start my car it wouldn't even turn over.  I called the hotel and asked for the valet.  I was put on hold for 15 minutes (I timed it).  I hung up and called the hotel back and asked for a manager.  I was very ticked by this time.  I talked to the front desk manager who said she would talk to the valet and get someone to call me as soon as possible.  About 10 minutes later I received a call from the valet manager, the valet manager.  I told him where I was and he came out to jump start our car.  He arrived fairly quickly.  He followed me back to the hotel and filled out an incident report.  He was very professional and I appreciated him taking the time to document the incident without me having to ask him.  Our plans were to go out to dinner that night but those plans were ruined since I could not count on my car to start if I took it anywhere.  Mark asked the valet to keep it running to ensure the battery had a chance to charge.  Next I went inside to talk to the front desk manager again.  I apologized to her for being upset when I spoke with her earlier.  I did not say anything inappropriate but was upset at the whole incident and then being placed on hold.  She was very nice but I guess I was just looking for some understanding and acknowledgement regarding the situation.  She said she was sorry about it.  I guess I was at least expecting an offer of complementary valet service at a minimum for our trouble.  Not hearing that I just asked for it and she said they would do that.  I guess the point is, I shouldn't have had to ask.  Having had our dinner plans ruined we were fed up and just stayed in the room and ordered room service which I guess worked out well for the hotel since we spent more money there as a result of this fiasco.  When we ordered the room service we were told the wait would be one hour.  Tolerable given that the hotel seemed fairly crowded.  We recieved our food after about an hour and a half.  Although we ordered four entrees and two desserts we received three place settings.  Needless to say, it was not a stellar stay at the Omni.  Fortunately, upon checkout my car worked fine.  It would not be fair of me to be 100% critical.  The employees were friendly, the room was nice and quiet (even though I would have loved to have been on a much higher floor), the complementary juice in the morning was exactly on time and a nice touch.  The WiFi was excellent.This is the NEWEST place to stay in Fort Worth. Not to mention it's a great addition to the downtown skyline. Our room on the ninth floor was CLEAN and COMFORTABLE. Beautiful decor throughout the hotel, not just the lobby. There is a lot to offer in one place at the Omni; pool, gym, spa, business, kids activities, etc. Booking our stay during July 4th weekend was discounted because of a special we got through the Omni's website. So, if you're planning on staying here you might want to check the web often. Try the beyond tasty breakfast buffet at the Cast Iron Restaurant. Enjoy attentive service in the Whiskey & Rye bar. Also, the Omni has a fantastic Kimbell Art Museum gift shop and Wine Bar.I stayed here for the 2012 CyberStar Summit in January 2012 and I can tell you that this is truly a great hotel.  The rooms are gorgeous and the service is excellent.  Tonight we had dinner at Bob's here in the hotel and with at least 60 of us the service was impeccable and they actually allowed each of us to be billed separately.  No matter where I've been in this hotel, service has been outstanding along with the facilities.  This is simply a great place to stay and it's directly across the street from the Convention Center.  The steaks tonight were cooked perfectly and no matter what anyone ordered at Bob's it was cooked perfectly.  You can't miss coming here.  It's well worth the cost.I just returned from a Cyber Stars summit and had the good fortune to stay at the Omni while there. From check in to check out, every detail was thought of. My room was a comfortable temperature when I arrived, the pillows were FANTASTIC, and the staff helped me every time I had a question. Many times, lunched at meetings are sub-par but not at the OMNI- they were great! Tasty, well balanced and enough to satisfy my appetite. On site, the restaurant we ate at was comfortable, staff was friendly and helpful, and the food was good. The concierge services were very helpful too. I already signed up for their "points program" and I suggest you do as well! I would certainly recommend the Omni Fort Worth and would stay there again.Fantastic stay, super guest service, perfect location near the Stockyards and a great overall experience. The hotel staff took care of our conference and everything was done well. Great free wifi in the rooms and our connection in the meeting rooms was solid. Lots of computers and networks in this group and the system handled it with apparent ease. Would definitely stay here again!!We stayed here because we needed a weekend away, nothing too special just a change of scene. This was the perfect place to do it, everything from when we first pulled in to when we left was excellent. A very friendly and courteous staff, the bellman even helped me find my watch that I had forgotten! We used their spa services as well, and the staff there could not have made us more comfortable. Even with it being a busy weekend for the hotel it was still a nice relaxing weekend for us. Priced very well for what you get.Key demagnetizes, not a single vending machine in the place and staff made it seem like it was an inconvenience to get helpGot a great rate.  Room was spacious, clean, and functional.  Good breakfast, albeit expensive.  Only real knock was that the hotel bar touts their specialty cocktail menu...what a laugh.  When I order a Sazerac, and you serve me a drink with 3 lemon wedges and no bitters in it...well, you get the picture.  Anyway, you will not be disappointed you stayed at the Omni.  As far as I can tell, it's the best hotel in downtown Ft. Worth.
